title: Right at Home partners with RespirAI Medical on AI home monitoring  (Testbed)
content: Right at Home is collaborating with RespirAI Medical to develop an AI-powered home monitoring platform for managing chronic respiratory diseases like COPD.

title: NIA finds natural dietary supplement effective against Alzheimer’s disease (Investor)
content: Researchers from the NIA and the University of Delaware discovered that nicotinamide riboside (NR), a form of vitamin B3, can cross into the brain, suggesting potential new ways to study and treat brain diseases related to aging, such as Alzheimer's.

title: CABHI invests over $1.8M in 23 aging, brain health innovators through Ignite (Enterprise)
content: All 23 awardees are seeking CABHI's guidance in the aging and brain health sector delivered through services including mentorship, scientific coaching, end-user validation services and access to CABHI's network of academic, healthcare and industry partners.

title: LeadingAge expressed concerns over HSS reorganization, reduction of staff (Enterprise)
content: Katie Smith Sloan, CEO of LeadingAge, questioned the impact of reorganization and staffing reductions on quality of care access and services for nonprofit providers of aging services, including nursing homes, home health care and PACE.

title: LeadingAge calls for release of government funding to maintain staffing to support senior housing programs (Enterprises)
content: LeadingAge requested the Department of Housing and Urban Development (HUD) to release previously allocated funding and retain the workforce necessary to administer programs affecting low-income older adults, which raised concerns over negative impacts on low-income older adults due to uncertainty in HUD funding for programs like the Section 202 Supportive Housing for the Elderly.

title: Goodwin Living, Forest Hills of DC affiliate to deliver senior living, healthcare services in capital region (Testbed)
content: The affiliation aims to enhance resident programs and improve occupancy.

title: Best Buy Health, Mass General Brigham partner to develop care orchestration platform for hospital-at-home care (Enterprise)
content: The platform aims to streamline communication and logistics across different vendors, reducing the need for individual processes.

title: Argentum addressed Senate Special Committee on Aging regarding assisted living affordability, workforce needs, long-term care insurance market (Business Service)
content: President and CEO James Balda emphasized the importance of social determinants of health in assisted living facilities, which provide nutrition, physical activity, mental and cognitive activity and socialization.

title: Trust & Will secures $25M in Series C to expand estate planning platform (Startup)
content: The over $25M raised in a Series C funding round led by Moderne Ventures will help Trust & Will make estate planning more accessible and affordable, addressing the fact that, while 83% of Americans believe estate planning is important, only 31% have a will.

title: Koda Health, Houston Methodist Coordinate Care partner to reduce end-of-life spending by nearly 20% (Startup)
content: The collaboration will promote advance care planning, which ensures patients' preferences are documented and honored, leading to fewer hospitalizations, less intensive care and significant cost savings.

title: XRHealth acquires RealizedCare to optimize personalized patient care, expand care accessibility, improve patient outcomes (Startup)
content: The acquisition aims to enhance XRHealth's therapeutic XR platform by integrating RealizedCare’s AI-powered triage tool and evidence-based methods for managing chronic pain and behavioral health conditions.

title: Rippl brings virtual, value-based model to dementia care to improve patient outcomes, caregiver support (Startup)
content: Rippl aims to enhance accessibility, support caregivers and reduce hospitalizations, while partnering with major healthcare providers to expand its reach across the U.S.

title: Salesforce to invest $1B in Singapore to expand adoption of digital labor platform, Agentforce (Enterprise)
content: The investment to help businesses deploy AI-driven agents aims to address labor shortages due to Singapore's aging population and aligns with the country's National AI Strategy 2.0.

title: Argentum report emphasizes assisted living's role in providing cost-effective care for seniors (Business Service)
content: The Value of Assisted Living for America report suggests policy solutions to support assisted living, such as improving access for veterans and enacting legislative solutions like the Caring for Seniors Act.

title: Argentum testified before U.S. Senate Special Committee on Aging about importance of socialization in senior care (Business Service)
content: Argentum, represented senior living communities at the hearing, following the introduction of the SENIOR Act, aimed at addressing senior loneliness.

title: Pluto Health becomes qualified Tenn. Medicaid provider (Startup)
content: Patients under Medicaid TN can access Pluto Health's services, including health assessments, clinician chats, care coordination and in-home labs, enhancing care delivery and closing care gaps.

title: Boomerang Ventures leads Lizzy Care $2.6M seed funding round (Investor)
content: The funding will help Lizzy Care expand its services and enhance its platform making dementia care more accessible and effective.

title: Best Buy Health advances home-based care strategy by hosting webinar with healthcare leaders from Baptist Health South Florida, Mass General Brigham (Enterprise)
content: The discussion focused on the financial benefits and value of care-at-home programs, highlighting Best Buy Health's role as a significant player in this space.

title: Salesforce introduces library of pre-built agent skills, actions to enhance healthcare operations through agentic AI (Enterprise)
content: Agentforce for Health aims to improve patient outcomes by integrating healthcare-specific workflows and digital collaboration, reducing the burden on human workers.

title: AT&T, Peerbridge Health introduce advanced cardiac IoT wearable (Enterprise)
content: Cor MDx is designed to improve access to early detection and intervention for heart conditions, especially in rural areas lacking cardiologists and supports comprehensive monitoring, including 14-day Holter monitoring and advanced hemodynamic assessments.

title: Twilio, Cedar partner to enhance patient engagement, streamline healthcare billing processes (Business Service)
content: By integrating Twilio's communication tools and AI capabilities into Cedar's platform, the collaboration aims to improve patient communication through automated SMS notifications and reminders and provide a seamless payment experience with secure phone payments via Twilio's Voice API and Stripe Pay Connector.

title: Right at Home Canada, Sensi.AI partner to enhance senior care using data-driven insights
content: The initiative seeks to address Canada's healthcare challenges by reducing preventable hospital readmissions and improving care continuity for seniors, particularly those with dementia and multimorbidity.

title: Comcast Ventures invests in AI Care platform that combines human clinicians with AI to provide healthcare at home (Investor)
content: Sword Health uses AI technology and proprietary devices to create personalized treatment programs for musculoskeletal pain, serving over 10 million people through partnerships with major employers and health plans like Citi Group, Cisco and Independence Blue Cross.

title: LUMO Labs leads German digital medtech startup $3.7M funding round for AI-based blood data analysis (Investor)
content: The funds will be used to enhance Hema.to's AI-powered blood data analysis technology, which significantly reduces lab analysis time and improves accuracy in diagnosing blood cancers.

title: Synovus Bank, Carefull partner to provide enhanced fraud prevention services, focusing on protecting older adults from financial exploitation (Enterprise)
content: The collaboration allows Synovus to leverage Carefull's fraud prevention products to offer its customers across the southeast U.S. elevated protections against falling for fraud and scams or making money mistakes.

title: Homeward Health Advanced Research Projects Agency for Health initiative funds five-year pilot program to deliver hospital-at-home care to rural communities using mobile medical units (Enterprise)
content: Despite challenges such as staffing and patient buy-in, the program seeks to address the limitations of the current CMS waiver, which restricts hospital-at-home services to patients living within 25 miles of a participating hospital.

title: XRHealth acquires digital therapeutics company RealizedCare, creating largest AI-driven therapeutic XR platform globally (Startup)
content: The acquisition enhances XRHealth's AI-driven platform, expanding its capabilities in managing chronic pain and behavioral health conditions.

title: Boomerang Ventures leads seed funding for Lizzy Care to develop AI-driven solutions for at-home dementia, memory care (Investor)
content: The investment aims to advance Lizzy Care's technology and expand its offerings in the AgeTech sector, providing innovative business services to improve the quality of life for aging individuals.

title: CVS Health Ventures participates in Abridge $250M Series D investment round (Investor)
content: The platform aims to reduce administrative burdens and clinician burnout by converting medical conversations into billable documentation, using the funds to enhance AI capabilities and support commercial growth.

title: Underdog Labs participates in Keebler Health $6M seed funding round for AI-based risk adjustment platform (Investor)
content: The funding will be used to expand Keebler Health's team and accelerate the product roadmap to meet the growing demand for its AI-based risk adjustment platform, which supports the U.S. healthcare system's shift towards Value-Based Care.

title: Walgreens, NationsBenefits partnership allows health plan partners to use Benefits Mastercard Prepaid Card at Walgreens locations (Enterprise)
content: This integration enhances access to over-the-counter health and wellness products.

title: Accenture, INFRONEER Holdings JV aims to address issues in Japan's aging infrastructure using digital technologies, including AI (Enterprise)
content: The INFRONEER Strategy & Innovation JV, to be established in Apr. 2025, will focus on optimizing IT operating costs and strategic IT investments to improve productivity in construction and infrastructure operations, aiming to enhance safety and efficiency in Japan's infrastructure.

title: CVS Health Ventures participates in Lynx $27M Series A funding round to simplify healthcare payments, administration (Investor)
content: The company aims to use the funds to accelerate growth and expand operations in areas such as Medicare Advantage, Medicaid benefits and API-driven solutions for healthcare financial accounts.

title: SCAN Foundation supports Public Policy Institute of California report projecting 22% of Californians will be aged 65 or more by 2040 (Investor)
content: The report emphasizes the need for state and federal support to ensure public systems and regulatory frameworks can accommodate this demographic shift.

title: NIH awards UT Health San Antonio scientist $16M to study Alzheimer’s risk in Hispanic population (Investor)
content: Mohamad Habes' study, VITAL, will use advanced AI imaging technology to investigate tau protein development and potential interventions to address the disproportionate burden of Alzheimer's disease expected among ethnic minorities, particularly Hispanics, as cases rise nationally.

title: Boomerang Ventures completes $2.1M Series A2 funding round for Wicked Technologies to advance incontinence care (Investor)
content: Wicked Technologies seeks to use its Wicked Smart Pad™ to revolutionize incontinence care by providing real-time alerts, optimizing caregiver efficiency and improving patient outcomes.

title: Michael J. Fox Foundation aids with National Alliance for Caregiving on report  highlighting role, challenges faced by Parkinson's disease caregivers (Enterprise)
content: The report, based on a survey of 72 caregivers and interviews, emphasizes the need for better support and recognition for these caregivers, who are crucial in managing the complex care needs of Parkinson's patients.

title: LeadingAge advocates for Congress to protect programs supporting older adults in 2025 legislative agenda (Enterprise)
content: It emphasized the importance of rejecting Medicaid funding cuts and preserving the tax exemption of municipal bonds, which are crucial for senior living and care providers, as well as called for an increase in Low-Income Housing Tax Credit (LIHTC) allocations to build more affordable senior housing, urging Congress to boost the annual housing credit allocation by at least 50% and provide basis boosts for rural and extremely low-income properties.

title: Boston Dynamics founder discussed potential of AI-powered robots in elderly care, assistance for people with disabilities (Enterprise)
content: At the LEAP summit in Riyadh, Marc Raibert emphasized the importance of not overregulating robotics technology too early, as it could hinder its potential benefits, highlighting that while regulation is necessary, excessive restrictions could slow progress in solving problems through robotics, particularly in healthcare and elderly assistance.

title: Best Buy Health among Moving Health Home stakeholders pushing Congress for longer extension for hospital at home (Enterprise)
content: The extension aims to transition from a demonstration model to a permanent one, providing regulatory clarity for hospitals.

title: InsideTracker partners with HealthLab, Arete Health to offer bundled healthcare benefits combining comprehensive blood testing with personalized health coaching (Enterprise)
content: The initiative aims to empower employees to proactively address potential health concerns by providing actionable recommendations to improve their diet, exercise and overall well-being.

title: NIA awards Brown University School of Public Health researchers $13M grant to research impact of health policy changes on people living with Alzheimer's disease, dementias (Investors)
content: The study will focus on the effects of Medicare Advantage and Medicaid coverage, particularly when insurance plans are terminated or no longer participate in Medicare Advantage, which could significantly impact patients with dementia.

title: LeadingAge appoints EPIC Insurance Brokers & Consultants as exclusive broker, program administrator for national Aging Services Insurance program (Enterprise)
content: The program aims to provide comprehensive risk management services and insurance solutions to LeadingAge members, including specialized coverage and general liability options.

title: Whispp  introduced AI-powered Live Conversations to enable face-to-face conversations for people with vocal cord disabilities (Startup)
content: The app, which has already helped over 10,000 users with vocal cord disabilities, is expanding its use cases to face-to-face interactions.

title: Grapefruit Health, NEIS partner to improve patient post-discharge follow-ups, reduce readmissions (Startup)
content: The company launched a partnership with New England Inpatient Specialists (NEIS) to conduct post-discharge follow-ups, improving patient care, reducing readmissions by 13% and offering cost-effective solutions compared to traditional in-house approaches.

title: Citi Impact Fund, Samsung Next participate in TailorMed $40M financing round (Investor)
content: The funding will help TailorMed advance its mission to improve medication access and affordability across the U.S. by expanding its affordability network, which connects patients, providers, pharmacies and life science companies.

title: NIA recognizes IGC Pharma as top 15 finalist in PREPARE Challenge for its use of AI, machine learning in early detection of Alzheimer's disease (Investor)
content: The company's AI model analyzes acoustic biomarkers from voice recordings to predict Alzheimer's and related dementias, with a focus on precision, cost, and access.

title: Nationwide Ventures participates in AI long-term care needs prediction startup $7M seed funding round (Investor)
content: The funds will be used to expand Waterlily's platform, which uses personalized data and predictive algorithms to create custom care plans that can be analyzed against financial data, insurance coverage and healthcare trends to help preserve family savings.

title: NIA awards Translational Research Institute for Pain in Later Life five-year, $5M renewal grant
content: The Translational Research Institute for Pain in Later Life focuses on nonpharmacologic methods to manage persistent pain in older adults, affecting nearly half of older Americans.

title: Nobi raised over $36M to enhance smart lamps that detect falls among elderly, alert caregivers (Enterprise)
content: Nobi also secured a deal with Frontier Senior Living, deploying lamps across 56 care centers with 3,700 residents.

title: Samsung announces progress on non-invasive continuous glucose monitoring for future wearables (Enterprise)
content: Samsung is working on a non-invasive glucose monitoring feature, which could be integrated into the Galaxy Watch or other devices, aiming to revolutionize health tracking and early diabetes detection.

title: Coalition of aging services, disability-related organizations, including LeadingAge, urges Congress avoid Medicaid policy changes that could cut funding, create barriers to eligibility (Enterprise)
content: The Disability and Aging Collaborative and the Consortium for Constituents with Disabilities expressed concerns over proposed Republican cuts to Medicaid aimed at reducing the federal deficit.

title: Lighthouse Guild finds AI transformative for Individuals with vision loss (Testbed)
content: The research emphasizes AI's potential to enhance the lives of visually impaired individuals as AI advancements in computer vision and digital imaging are leading to innovative assistive solutions like smart glasses and smartphone apps, improving daily living activities for those with vision impairments.

title: Citi Impact Fund participates in IntusCare's $11.5M financing round (Investor)
content: The investment will support the launch of CareHub, a comprehensive care management platform designed to address the needs of Programs of All-Inclusive Care for the Elderly (PACE) and other value-based care models.

title: NIA awards $5.8M five-year P30 grant renewal to Roybal Center for Dementia Caregiving Mastery at Emory University (Investor)
content: The center, co-directed by Ken Hepburn, PhD, and Molly Perkins, PhD, will continue to support research aimed at enhancing the caregiving skills of family members and friends of those with dementia.

title: Citi Impact Fund, Samsung Next participate in TailorMed $40M financing round (Investor)
content: The investment aims to enhance TailorMed's mission to improve medication access and affordability in the U.S. by expanding its affordability network.

title: The Michael J. Fox Foundation, Parkinson's Resource Organization partner to present 'Parkinson's Today: An Educational Symposium' on Feb. 8 in Palm Desert (Enterprise)
content: This free event will feature panels discussing advancements in Parkinson's treatment, policy and caregiving in a push to benefit individuals with Parkinson's and their caregivers, especially in the Coachella Valley and across the U.S., amid increased focus on the disease due to federal legislation and celebrity attention.

title: Accenture partners with Meiji Yasuda Life Insurance Company in digital transformation initiative aimed at integrating AI technologies into Meiji Yasuda's operations (Enterprise)
content: This collaboration, extending until Mar. 2030, will involve deploying AI-enabled digital assistants and other tools to enhance innovation and efficiency.

title: Samsung adds Health Records feature to Samsung Health app for improved health management in India (Enterprise)
content: This feature allows users to access and manage their Ayushman Bharat Health Account (ABHA) directly through the app, integrating with India’s digital health ecosystem to enable secure, comprehensive health data management.

title: Best Buy Health expanded care-at-home partnerships with several major health systems (Enterprise)
content: Key collaborations include Mass General Brigham expanding patient eligibility for postsurgical and postpartum care, Sarah Cannon Cancer Network exploring remote patient monitoring for oncology patients, UC Davis Health launching care at home for high blood pressure patients, UMass Memorial Health broadening eligibility for postsurgical and postpartum patients and Virtua Health growing its Care after Discharge program to allow faster hospital discharges with remote monitoring.

title: AT&T, Boston Police Department host workshop at Charlestown community center to help older adults navigate digital world safely (Enterprise)
content: The workshops include presentations translated into Spanish, Cantonese and Mandarin, and cover topics like scams, fraud and robocalls.

title: Google Cloud, SandboxAQ partner to enhance development, integration, deployment of Large Quantitative Models in enterprise environments (Business Service)
content: The collaboration will utilize Google Cloud's infrastructure and marketplace to expand SandboxAQ's solutions in areas like drug discovery, chemical and materials science, advanced sensing and cybersecurity to accelerate the development of Quantitative AI technologies, addressing critical challenges such as Alzheimer's research.

title: MindMics showcased wearable device that uses headphones, wave-based technology to provide comprehensive analysis of cardiac activity, heart valve conditions at CES in Las Vegas (Startup)
content: MindMics' device demonstrated its capability by detecting a murmur in a patient with aortic stenosis during clinical trials.

title: Imago Rehab awarded U.S. patent for wearable device to aid patients with motor impairments due to neurological conditions (Startup)
content: The patent, held by Harvard University and exclusively licensed to Imago Rehab, highlights the company's unique approach of integrating soft actuators, sensors and a novel actuation method to deliver personalized home-based rehabilitation therapy.

title: St. John's Lutheran Community implements Zemplee remote patient monitoring system in The Meadows memory care unit (Startup)
content: The system uses AI to track health data like temperature, blood pressure and heart rate, as well as movements through sensors, without using cameras in an attempt to support staff by providing insights into residents' well-being, potentially reducing the need for frequent doctor visits.

title: ZNET highlights Lotus ring among most memorable CES 2025 product (Startup)
content: The Lotus smart ring allows users to control appliances including lights, fans, AC units and TVs by pressing the button on the ring.

title: Right at Home, PocketRN partner to support Medicare dementia beneficiaries (Testbed)
content: Right at Home will conduct in-home care and safety assessments for these beneficiaries, while PocketRN, a participant in the CMS's GUIDE Model, will offer virtual nursing care at no cost to eligible beneficiaries, providing continuous education, coaching and emotional support.

title: WesleyLife Foundation awarded nearly $375K Geisler Penquite Foundation grant to support Park Centre in Newton (Testbed)
content: The funds will benefit the Good Samaritan Fund, ensuring residents aren't asked to leave if they deplete their financial resources, and will also aid in the redevelopment of Park Centre's memory care households.

title: CVS Health Venture leads $14.5M Nema Health Series A funding round (Investor)
content: Nema's virtual treatment program, based on cognitive processing therapy, has a high completion rate and supports patients for a year post-treatment to ensure sustainable recovery.

title: NIA awards $2.2M grant to UT Health San Antonio, Trinity University scientists in collaboration with the San Antonio Food Bank to study eating disorders in older Hispanic women (Investor)
content: The study aims to explore the intersection of binge eating, food insecurity and health disparities, with the goal of developing scalable interventions and providing insights for policymakers.

title: NIH-funded NYU Langone Health study finds the risk of developing dementia after 55 is 42% higher than previously reported (Investor)
content: This increase is attributed to the aging U.S. population, genetic factors and lifestyle-related health issues such as hypertension, diabetes, obesity and poor mental health.

title: UC Davis Health, in collaboration with Best Buy Health's care at home platform, Current Health, launched at-home monitoring program for hypertension (Enterprise)
content: Patients will use connected devices to send health data to the Current Health platform, which will be accessible by the UC Davis Health Connected Care Center in a push to keep patients' blood pressure within a healthy range and plans to expand to support additional chronic diseases.

title: Samsung Health introduces advanced Health, Wellness solutions At CES 2025 (Enterprise)
content: Samsung's Galaxy wearables, including the Galaxy Ring and Galaxy Watch, offer personalized sleep solutions and a sleep apnea detection feature that connects to telehealth services for comprehensive health management.

title: LeadingAge, UNCF announce $250K grant from Next50 Foundation to launch fellowship program aimed at increasing diversity among nonclinical leaders in long-term care (Enterprise)
content: Participants will receive salary, benefits, training, and mentoring, with the goal of addressing the lack of diverse leadership in the aging services sector.

title: Michigan Veteran Homes seniors use Rendever VR platform to explore global destinations, revisit cherished memories (Startup)
content: The program allows participants to virtually tour historical sites like the Great Wall of China and the International Space Station, providing realistic experiences that enhance their quality of life.

title: Soliddd develops SolidddVision smart glasses to assist individuals with macular degeneration (Startup)
content: The glasses, currently in beta, use proprietary lens arrays to project images onto undamaged areas of the retina, helping the brain construct a 3D image.

title: Rendever launches VR app for aging individuals (Startup)
content: Alcove Sanctuary, a consumer subscription service, allows users to customize their virtual space with photos, videos and 3D models, and includes, Nova, a family-friendly AI companion that facilitates natural conversation, offers world tours, language learning and art creation.

title: Ageless Innovation to showcase Joy for All collection, engage in a panel on robotics transforming daily life for older adults at CES 2025 (Startup)
content: The company will discuss the role of technology in healthcare, social engagement and the broader AgeTech landscape.

title: Onscreen introduces Joy AI companion app for Android tablets, iPads, aimed at reducing social isolation, enhancing the quality of life for older adults (Startup)
content: Onscreen has introduced its Joy AI companion app for Android tablets and iPads, aimed at reducing social isolation and enhancing the quality of life for older adults. The app was unveiled at CES 2025 in Las Vegas, expanding Onscreen's mission to make care more accessible for seniors. The Joy AI companion supports aging in place and addresses the loneliness epidemic among the elderly.

title: United Church Homes redeveloping Longfellow School in Dayton, Ohio, into 126-unit residential community for those aged 55, older (Testbed)
content: This project aims to revitalize the area and serve as an anchor site for a developing corridor in Northwest Dayton.

title: Right At Home in Columbia co-owner suggests using technology to maintain regular communication with seniors, family, friends to combat holiday loneliness (Testbed)
content: Michael Brown emphasizes the importance of routine and encourages making check-ins or in-person visits a part of New Year's resolutions to help seniors feel connected and identify any potential issues early.

title: Four Lifespace Communities recognized as America's Best for 2025 by Newsweek and Statista (Testbed)
content: The recognition highlights the growing appeal of continuing care retirement communities, which offer a comprehensive living solution combining independent living with assisted living, memory care, skilled nursing and rehabilitation therapies.

title: NIH awards Drs. $16M to explore healthcare delivery for individuals with Alzheimer's, related dementias (Investor)
content: Kosali Simon, PhD, and Katherine Baicker, PhD, will co-lead an initiative to address barriers to equitable healthcare for this population, involving collaboration with the National Bureau of Economic Research, IU School of Medicine and Regenstrief's IU Center for Aging Research.

title: NIH finds different brain cell types age differently, with hormone-controlling ones experiencing more age-related genetic changes (Investor)
content: This research, published in Nature, highlights the sensitivity of certain brain cells to aging and related disorders, such as Alzheimer's.

title: NIH awards OMRF doctor $1M to study muscle loss in aging (Investor)
content: The grant includes a $234,000 two-year mentored phase and $783,000 for three additional years to establish an independent lab as Jordan Fuqua aims to understand sarcopenia and develop therapeutic treatments to delay muscle atrophy in older adults.

title: CVS Health Ventures heads Nema Health's $14.5M Series A funding round to expand virtual PTSD treatment model, promote long-term healing (Investor)
content: The funding will support Nema Health's expansion into new states, including Calif., Fla., and Pa. as the company aims to offer evidence-based treatment and rapid relief to trauma survivors, helping them achieve long-term healing.

title: National Sleep Foundation presents 2024 SleepTech Award to Neurovalens for Modius Sleep device (Enterprise)
content: The award for the noninvasive solution for chronic insomnia allows Neurovalens to join the CES 2025 lineup in Las Vegas, where Kate Willis, Vice President of Commercialization, will participate in a panel discussion on sleep technology and brain health.

title: Intuition Robotics launches the ElliQ Caregiver Solution, using AI to assist in care of older adults (Enterprise)
content: This solution includes the ElliQ companion robot and a Caregiver App, creating a system that allows caregivers to stay informed and engaged in their loved ones' care remotely.

title: Samsung integrates Galaxy Watch, Galaxy Ring with Samsung Health platform (Enterprise)
content: These devices offer enhanced AI-powered health tracking features such as improved heart rate monitoring, advanced sleep analytics and real-time stress management.

title: Intuition Robotics enhances ElliQ by integrating Sensory's TrulyHandsfree technology (Enterprise)
content: The collaboration with Sensory allows for hands-free interaction with ElliQ, improving user experience and accessibility by including low-power wake words, speaker verification for personalized interactions and SoundID for environmental sound detection.

title: Panasonic unveils Umi, AI-powered wellness coach for families, in partnership with Anthropic (Enterprise)
content: Umi aims to help families coordinate care and connect, offering features like goal setting, routine creation and task management through a mobile app, and is particularly beneficial for caregivers of aging parents.

title: Google Cloud's Vertex AI platform leveraged by healthcare AI player to enhance AI assistant (Business Service)
content: The updated Suki Assistant offers comprehensive support to clinicians, including medical record summarization, Q&A, documentation tasks, coding capabilities, patient data access and dictation features in a push to make healthcare technology more assistive and allow clinicians to focus more on patient care.

title: Right at Home opens location in Visalia to provide in-home care for seniors and adults with disabilities (Testbed)
content: The services offered include companion care, personal care and specialty care for conditions like Alzheimer's, Parkinson's and diabetes.

title: Vivalon serves nearly 90 meals at annual Holiday Celebration at Healthy Aging Campus in San Rafael, Calif. (Testbed)
content: The event featured performances by the Bread and Roses Holiday Swing Band and included a holiday meal with a green salad, glazed Cornish hens and dessert.

title: Right at Home expands to Syracuse, N.Y., with three territories (Testbed)
content: This expansion offers entrepreneurs the opportunity to provide essential care to seniors and adults with disabilities, allowing them to remain in their homes.

title: NIH-funded $16M project co-led by Kosali Simon, Katherine Baicker to explore healthcare delivery for Alzheimer's, related dementias patients (Investor)
content: The project will study the impact of racial concordance between healthcare providers and patients on healthcare outcomes using Medicare data.

title: AT&T, Digital Girl partner to boost digital literacy for older adults (Enterprise)
content: Digital Girl's Senior Technology Intergenerational Course, funded by a $25,000 grant from AT&T, concluded its fall session at the Major Owens Health & Wellness Community Center, providing over 20 older adults with free laptops and essential digital skills, such as using Google Workspace and sending WhatsApp messages.

title: Prudential Financial, Empathy partner to enhance beneficiary support services (Enterprise)
content: The collaboration provides beneficiaries with access to a suite of resources, including funeral arrangements, obituary writing, probate and estate settlement, as well as grating beneficiaries access to dedicated Care Managers for personalized assistance.

title: Wareologie integrates rehabilitation technology into healthcare systems, leading to acquisition of IP by global medical distributor (Startup)
content: The company, which focuses on addressing a $34-billion problem related to patient falls, handling and mobility, developed portable parallel bars to enhance patient outcomes by enabling early mobility access.

title: Whispp enables face-to-face conversations for people with vocal cord disabilities through AI-powered Live Conversations (Startup)
content: The feature allows people with voice disabilities to speak naturally in face-to-face conversations, even in noisy environments by converting whispered and vocal cord-impaired speech into clear, natural voice, expanding its use cases beyond phone and video calls.

title: Main Line Health, ChartSpan partner to offer chronic care management services to Medicare patients in southeastern Pa. (Testbed)
content: The collaboration aims to enhance patient engagement, offer personalized care plans and improve healthcare access for Medicare beneficiaries with chronic conditions.

title: Meridian signed 23,000-sq-ft lease with Center for Elders Independence at Oakland Calif. Broadway Medical Plaza (Testbed)
content: This will be Center for Elders Independence's sixth Bay Area location, and the tenant fit-out is expected to be completed by next spring.

title: Right at Home recognized for having highest number of local franchise offices receiving Caring Stars awards (Testbed)
content: This achievement marks the seventh consecutive year that Right at Home has been ranked No. 1 in the nation.

title: NIA-backed I CAN DO Surgical ACP trial transitions from planning to implementation (Investor)
content: The trial aims to help older adults undergoing elective surgery engage in advanced care planning and understand digital engagement and social drivers of health.

title: NIA grants Akava Therapeutics $7.3M to study protein aggregation inhibitor for effects on Alzheimer's disease, frontotemporal dementia (Investor)
content: The NU-9 (AKV9) compound, developed by Dr. Richard B. Silverman and Dr. P. Hande Ozdinler at Northwestern University, is also being tested for amyotrophic lateral sclerosis (ALS) and received FDA clearance for a Phase I study in healthy subjects.

title: NIA awards Olera $3M grant to address senior care affordability in U.S (Investor)
content: The funding will be used to develop AI agents that assist families in finding and applying for senior care benefits, aiming to make quality care more accessible and affordable for aging Americans.

title: Best Buy Health CMO emphasizes importance of member engagement, preventive care in addressing challenges in payer industry (Enterprise)
content: Dr. Ben Zaniello, CMO at Best Buy Health, highlighted the need for payers to expand beyond traditional roles by building stronger relationships with members and leveraging data insights.

title: Primetime Partners participates in Seen Health Nets $22M Series A funding round (Investor)
content: The senior care tech company will use the funds to establish a Program of All-Inclusive Care for the Elderly (PACE) center in Alhambra, Calif., focusing on the Asian and Pacific Islander community

title: Rock Health launches Innovation Maturity Curve for assessing progress of emerging digital health technologies (Business Service)
content: The curve evaluates trends based on research publication volume, venture funding and partnership activity, categorizing them as nascent, emerging, developing, calibrating or mature.

title: AgeTech Atlanta gaining momentum as innovation hub (Business Service)
content: The community, which focuses on developing technology to support the elderly and caregivers, expanded to cities like Los Angeles, Denver, Chicago, NYC, DC and Toronto.

title: Tembo Health, Family Caregiver Alliance partnership delivers comprehensive dementia care to patients' homes through CMS GUIDE Model (Startup)
content: The program is free for those with traditional Medicare and aims to transform dementia care by testing a new payment approach for key supportive services.

title: Ōmcare Home Health Hub to be debuted at CES in Las Vegas in early 2025 (Startup)
content: The Hub aims to transform care for the aging population through a 'phygital' approach, blending physical health support with digital connectivity, linking patients, pharmacies and care providers, fostering a sense of community and ensuring holistic caregiving.

title: Goodwin Living uses Dutch musical instrument to help residents with Alzheimer's disease, dementia communicate through touch, music (Testbed)
content: The crdl is designed for individuals with various neurological impairments, including dementia and cognitive impairment and aims to foster human connection through music therapy.

title: MiiCare participates in 18-month pilot in London Borough of Redbridge to reduce falls among elderly residents (Testbed)
content: This initiative, funded by the Government's Adult Social Care Technology Fund and led by LBR in collaboration with Care City, aims to deploy assistive technology across various care settings to address the high incidence of falls among the elderly in Redbridge, aiming to improve their quality of life and reduce the strain on healthcare resources.

title: HealthyLifetime, Rose Villa partner to offer independent aging program (Testbed)
content: The eight-week program offers personalized one-on-one coaching to support independent aging and is available exclusively to Committed Tier members of Rose Villa's Take Root program, launching in Feb. 2025.

title: N.Y., N.J. Centers Health Care locations bring health improvements for residents, returning some home (Testbed)
content: The nursing home chain achieved over 2,500 minutes of movement in Aug. and continued to encourage fitness through various activities during the holiday season.

title: NIA awards Aphios Corporation NIH SBIR grant to develop anti-CCR5 nanoparticles for treating Alzheimer's (Investor)
content: The company is using its proprietary PNS polymer nanoparticles technology to transport the anti-CCR5 antagonist across the blood-brain barrier to manage inflammation and dementia.

title: Care Daily, Belgian home care federations consortium partner to launch AI Virtual Caregiver (Enterprise)
content: Jeremi, powered by Care Daily's open AI Platform and developed with AiDiDom, aims to revolutionize senior care by providing personalized home care, helping caregivers prioritize attention, predict needs and protect seniors with real-time insights and proactive alerts.

title: Nobi, Frontier Senior Living partner to implement AI-powered smart lamps in 56 communities (Enterprise)
content: The collaboration aims to enhance fall detection and prevention, improving safety and saving lives in senior care, following successful pilots in two Frontier memory care communities, which showed significant improvements in fall prevention and intervention times.

title: Braze Mobility develops world's first wheelchair blind spot sensors (Startup)
content: Aimed at improving safe, independent mobility for wheelchair users, the innovation includes a multi-modal feedback system offering visual, auditory and vibratory cues to cater to various user needs.

title: Kalogon develops custom smart cushion to increase blood flow to reduce risk of pressure injuries (Startup)
content: Orbiter Med, recognized among TIME magazine's Best Innovations of 2024, features an Advanced Pressure Management System (APMS) that improves blood flow and is custom-fabricated for wheelchair users, pilots, transportation workers and others based on their unique seating and positioning requirements.

title: MiiCare integrates data-driven insights with Aider's concierge-style services (Startup)
content: The collaboration aims to simplify healthcare navigation by offering data-driven insights, integrated services and tailored care pathways by covering in-home visits, virtual consultations and hospital-based care.

title: CareYaya AI-powered glasses assist dementia patients through real-time visual, audio cues (Startup)
content: Equipped with sensors and an AI assistant, the glasses help users recognize faces, recover lost objects and remember tasks and appointments.

title: De Oro Devices Co-founder featured on Forbes' 2025 30 Under 30 list (Startup)
content: Sidney Collin invented the NexStride device that attaches to a walker or cane and emits visual and auditory cues to help with mobility.

title: LUCID combines AI, facial recognition, music to treat dementia (Startup)
content: LUCID's ResonanceRX uses facial mapping to determine how patients react to certain songs, using this data to develop AI-generated individualized playlists to reduce agitation and stress among those suffering from memory-loss disorders.

title: Right at Home South Cheshire distributes Christmas advent calendars to clients (Testbed)
content: This initiative, which started last year, has proven popular and helps elderly patients develop cognitive and motor skills.

title: Zemplee partner, St John's of Albert Lea, awarded $600K grant from LeadingAge Minnesota Foundation (Startup)
content: This grant is part of a $1.8-million investment to develop and support the Connected Communities initiative, aimed at improving the health, well-being and quality of life for seniors in rural Minnesota.

title: Goodwin Living appointed Hwan Yi as Executive Director of Goodwin House Bailey's Crossroads (Testbed)
content: Yi expressed his commitment to supporting the lives of older adults and contributing to the company's legacy as a not-for-profit senior living and healthcare services organization at Goodwin House Bailey's Crossroads.

title: Accenture's Disability Inclusion initiative empowers hearing-impaired employees by using real-time transcription, AI-powered sign language interpretation tools (Enterprise)
content: These technologies enabled better communication and participation in work-related discussions, fostering an accessible and inclusive workplace.

title: Demant participates in European Hearing Aids Market projected growth from $11.29B to $21.09B by 2030 (Enterprise)
content: This growth is driven by rising awareness of hearing health and technological advancements as key players are introducing innovative solutions, including digital hearing aids with advanced connectivity features and sustainable product designs.

title: Accenture, HealthCare Global Enterprises partner to enhance cancer research, care using AI, GenAI, deep learning (Enterprise)
content: This collaboration aims to leverage Accenture's expertise in data and AI, combined with HealthCare Global's clinical insights in oncology, to enable early detection and treatment of various cancers.

title: Next50 awarded nearly $4M in grants through Changing Aging program (Enterprise)
content: Out of 600 applicants, 35 nonprofit organizations were selected to receive funding for initiatives such as digital literacy training, anti-ageism campaigns, workforce development and hospice telehealth.

title: NIH-backed Flowly launches Galactic Mission VR experience, enhanced app's user experience (Startup)
content: The Galactic Mission VR experience combines storytelling and gaming elements, taking users on a space journey to water plants and deliver them to a distant planet, aligning with Flowly's mission to empower users to take charge of their health and well-being, fostering resilience and self-love.

title: Ottobock leads ONWARD Medical's $52.6M funding round (Startup)
content: The company also signed an exclusive license with CEA to develop and commercialize the WIMAGINE Brain Computer Interface (BCI) as part of its investigational ARC BCI System.

title: Embr Labs granted six patents across U.S., Japan, EU (Startup)
content: These patents focus on AI-driven systems that deliver personalized warming and cooling stimuli to address hot flashes, stress and sleep disruptions by leveraging sensors to detect physiological signals, enabling adaptive and personalized thermal waveforms.

title: Right at Home looks to expand in Daytona Beach, Fla. (Testbed)
content: The franchise offers an investment opportunity for entrepreneurs to provide essential care to seniors and adults with disabilities, allowing them to remain in their homes.

title: WesleyLife introduces Continuing Care at Home membership program (Testbed)
content: WellAhead is designed to help people focus on their health and well-being at home while enabling them to financially plan for potential services and care in the future, allowing WesleyLife to support the independence and health of individuals who wish to remain in their homes as they age.

title: Windham Capital Partners, Citi Impact Fund, Samsung Next lead TailorMed $40M financing round (Investor)
content: The investment aims to support TailorMed's efforts to eliminate barriers to medication affordability and access by fostering collaboration among patients, providers, pharmacies, life sciences and payers.

title: NIHR, others fund Cardiff healthtech firm (Investor)
content: The funding will accelerate Laennec AI Limited's development of affordable AI-powered medical devices designed to bring healthcare closer to patients and promote self-care.

title: Citi Impact Fund participates in TailorMed $40M financing (Investor)
content: The healthcare technology innovator will use the funds to expand its affordability network into an end-to-end platform aimed at transforming patient access to care across the U.S.

title: NIH awards UCR $45M, five-year grant to extend longevity (Investor)
content: The grant will support the development of interventions to promote healthy aging and longevity in humans as the University of California Riverside (UCR) participates in an effort to develop treatments that delay aging and improve life for older adults.

title: Primetime Partners raised $42M of planned $60M second fund, focusing on those aged 50, above (Investor)
content: The firm invests across health tech and fintech, addressing the needs of an aging U.S. population.

title: CVS Health Ventures participates in Synapticure  $25M Series A funding round (Investor)
content: The funds will be used to expand partnerships with healthcare payers and providers, advance its technology platform, accelerate clinical research and scale nationally.

title: First LeadingAge California's Gateway In Project graduate cohort employed as certified nursing assistants, home health aides (Enterprise)
content: The initiative, funded by a $25-million grant from the California Department of Health Care Access and Information, aims to address clinical workforce shortages by providing training and employment opportunities.

title: CABHI's Ignite program offers non-dilutive funding from $35.7K to $107K for early-stage Canadian aging, brain health innovators (Enterprise)
content: The program aims to help innovators overcome challenges such as limited access to funding, high development costs and difficulties in validating solutions in real-world settings.

title: LeadingAge  outlines Medicaid access, workforce, affordable senior housing issues as top concerns in letter sent to House, Senate leaders (Enterprise)
content: LeadingAge supports the Healthcare Workforce Resilience Act (HR 6205/S 3211), which aims to address the staffing shortage in healthcare by recapturing 40,000 unused visas for foreign-born physicians and nurses.

title: Famileo converts digital messages, photos into newspapers to bridge digital disconnect between generations (Startup)
content: The platform aims to combine the convenience of digital communication with the sentimental value of traditional print, making it especially appealing to older people.

title: Flowly launches Pathways to Healing fund to help financially support those ineligible, not covered by health plan (Startup)
content: Backed by the NIH and Y Combinator, the "Pathways to Healing" fund, aims to remove financial barriers and provide accessible, non-pharmaceutical treatments for chronic pain through evidence-based Healing from Pain program.

title: CVS Health Ventures participates in Synapticure $25M Series A funding round (Investor)
content: The virtual care company aims to improve access and outcomes for patients and caregivers dealing with Alzheimer's, Parkinson's, ALS and other neurodegenerative diseases by providing nationwide access to expert neurologists, treatments, trials and support services.

title: Centre for Aging + Brain Health Innovation Discover Adopt program matches Scarborough Centre for Healthy Communities with Kaleidoscope XR for Caregiver VR (Enterprise)
content: The match with the live role-playing simulations platform improved the Scarborough Centre for Healthy Communities' staff capacity for effective communication with clients experiencing cognitive decline or differing communication abilities, leading to better client access to care, improved client experience and enhanced cost-effectiveness of the healthcare system.

title: XRHealth launches AI-powered extended reality platform to enhance therapeutic outcomes (Startup)
content: The platform includes an AI Generator Space for creating custom 360-degree environments, dynamic avatars for personalized patient interaction and features like AI Treatment Search, AI Reports Analysis and AI Treatment Plan to provide targeted therapeutic suggestions and detailed session insights.

title: OATS hosts free online education event on identifying, stopping online shopping scams (Testbed)
content: The event, held on Dec. 12 and aimed at older Americans, will provide a general introduction to shopping online using Amazon.com, including how to search for products, make comparisons and add items to an online shopping cart.

title: 7Wire Ventures leads $20M Homethrive funding round (Investor)
content: The funds, raised in a funding round co-led by 7Wire ventures and TELUS Global Ventures, will be used to expand Homethrive's end-to-end caregiving platform, focusing on personalized caregiving support and scaling its AI-driven care navigation and recommendations.

title: XRHealth acquires NeuroReality to enhance therapeutic offerings with flagship Koji's Quest product (Startup)
content: Koji's Quest provides therapeutic and rehabilitative experiences through immersive XR games.

title: Embodied Labs, Santa Clara University research develops VR training experiences for dementia caregivers (Startup)
content: The VR simulations provide realistic scenarios where caregivers must make decisions, helping to improve their training and support.

title: Right at Home supports veteran clients, caregivers, local owners (Testbed)
content: The company emphasizes helping veterans navigate the complex landscape of VA benefits, ensuring they receive the in-home care they need.

title: Archetype leads Crypto-AI startup's $7.5M seed funding round (Investor)
content: Pond initially built a user search engine powered by on-chain data and has now expanded to develop crypto-native AI models for broader applications.

title: Dentsu Canada, Optable partner to develop client IDs, partner connection to deliver targeted insights (Investor)
content: The partnership resulted in the creation of Merkury, an enterprise identity and data platform that leverages Dentsu's investment in understanding Canadians and is powered by Optable's clean room capabilities.

title: Citi Impact Fund invests in Hopscotch Primary Care to address seniors' health disparities in rural America (Investor)
content: Hopscotch aims to bring accessible and proactive value-based care to these communities.

title: Accenture inks MoU with Department of Health Abu Dhabi to advance health data governance, services (Enterprise)
content: The collaboration will focus on data governance execution, health AI use case advisory and health data infrastructure.

title: Trustmark acquires Enroll For Life technology platform from iOpt (Enterprise)
content: The acquired platform, which supports self-service enrollment for permanent life insurance products, including those with long-term care benefits, aims to enhance enrollment process efficiency and simplify benefit selection for smaller companies, while continuing to rely on valued enrollment partners for mid-size and larger opportunities.

title: Salesforce named Leader in Gartner Magic Quadrant for Digital Commerce for ninth consecutive year (Enterprise)
content: The company continues to support B2B and B2C commerce businesses with personalized and AI-powered customer experiences.

title: Salesforce hires 1,000 sales personnel to promote Agentforce AI products (Enterprise)
content: Agentforce, introduced in mid-Sept., integrates AI across workflows to drive customer success, anticipate needs and take proactive actions.

title: Nihon Kohden acquires 71.4% stake in Ad Tech Medical Instrument Corporation parent (Enterprise)
content: The NeuroAdvanced acquisition enhances Nihon Kohden's capabilities in epilepsy diagnostics and care by combining its expertise in EEG systems with Ad Tech's specialized intracranial electrodes in a push to provide comprehensive solutions for neurological conditions including drug-resistant epilepsy and is expected to create synergies for clinicians and hospital systems across the U.S.

title: Wellpointe opens office at Accenture Tower, Chicago (Enterprise)
content: The company focuses on providing affordable boutique-style assisted living services for older adults, particularly those with multiple chronic illnesses such as Alzheimer's and other dementias.

title: Google Cloud, Wipro launch Google Gemini Experience Zone to identify customer GenAI use cases (Business Service)
content: The Experience Zone allows businesses to gain hands-on experience with Google's AI technology, including Gemini models and Vertex AI, applied in real-world applications like natural language processing, predictive analytics and image generation.

title: Google Cloud, DeliverHealth partner to enhance medical documentation using AI models (Business Service)
content: The collaboration aims to improve patient-physician interaction by allowing clinicians to document patient care entirely via voice, reducing their burden and enabling them to focus more on patient care.

title: Embr Labs raises $3M in equity funding, aims to double amount (Startup)
content: The funding will help scale the body temperature perception device developer's subscription model, accelerate momentum with retail partners and advance technology that predicts menopausal hot flashes.

title: Wave Therapeutics receives Nurse Capital funding in seed round (Startup)
content: The AI-powered wheelchair cushion developer was among two startups to receive funding from Wave Therapeutics in its first participation in seed funding.

title: XRHealth acquires NeuroReality, including flagship product Koji's Quest, to enhance XR therapeutic platform (Startup)
content: The acquisition follows XRHealth's purchase of Amelia Virtual Care and aims to expand its therapeutic offerings for physical, emotional and cognitive rehabilitation through immersive XR experiences.

title: ABBY launches fundraising campaign to support powered wheelchair accessibility (Startup)
content: The ABBY Smart Wheelchair integrates technologies like machine vision and IoT connectivity to enhance safety and communication.

title: Moderne Ventures announced 2024 Fall Moderne Passport Class (Investor)
content: The Moderne Passport Program is a six-month industry immersion program that provides participants with education, exposure, insight and relationships to drive customer growth.

title: Accenture Ventures invests in 1910 Genetics as it focused on drug discovery using multimodal AI platform, lab automation (Enterprise)
content: The partnership aims to help biopharma clients speed up drug target identification, lower costs and deliver more affordable therapies.

title: Accenture consulting, technology company specializing in Anaplan solutions (Enterprise)
content: Accenture's Allitix acquisition enhances its connected planning capabilities using Anaplan, a platform that helps organizations improve business outcomes through better planning and decision-making.

title: Verato launched for Salesforce on Salesforce AppExchange, enabling 360-degree view of patients (Enterprise)
content: The integration aims to drive smarter growth, improve patient experience and enhance operational efficiency for health systems by combining healthcare's most accurate EMPI with trusted identity verification, enterprise master data management and data enrichment.

title: CDW received 16 awards at Cisco Partner Summit 2024 (Enterprise)
content: Awards included Global SMB Partner of the Year, Americas SMB Partner of the Year, and US Federal Intelligence Partner of the Year.

title: Walgreens, Learn Look Locate celebrate three years of collaboration, providing comprehensive breast cancer resources (Enterprise)
content: The partnership evolved to offer educational materials, expert insights from Walgreens oncology pharmacist Alex Cosimano and direct access to LLL's resources through Walgreens' cancer resources page.

title: RAZ Memory Cell Phone to be sold by Sask. leading wireless provider (Startup)
content: The phone, which helps seniors with memory loss, dementia, Alzheimer's or those who prefer a simple experience, can be managed remotely by caregivers through the RAZ Care app and will be sold by SaskTel.

title: Whispp recognized as one of TIME's Best Inventions of 2024 in Accessibility (Startup)
content: Whispp's technology enables seamless voice and video communication by converting whispered speech into clear, natural voice during calls and messages, bypassing delays common in conventional speech aids and providing instant, natural-sounding speech conversion.

title: Kalogon’s smart wheelchair cushion recognized as one of TIME's Best Investion of 2024 (Startup)
content: The smart cushion seeks to prevent life-threatening pressure injuries by analyzing pressure points and redistributing weight accordingly.

title: Ageless Innovation, Hasbro reimagine TABOO game to better cater to older adults (Startup)
content: The collaboration aims to address loneliness and social isolation among older adults by providing engaging and joyful play experiences.

title: CareYaya enables affordable home care by connecting healthcare students with elders (Startup)
content: Founded in 2022 by Neal Shah, the startup has grown to include over 25,000 students from various universities and provides affordable in-home support.

title: OATS from AARP welcomes 13 licensed partners across 10 states to join Senior Planet licensing program during Q3 (Testbed)
content: The partners began delivering in-person technology classes to older adults, making Senior Planet classes more accessible, bringing the program to over 141 active sponsoring partners offering programs at 484 licensed partner sites in 36 states

title: Healthy Ventures participates in Cornerstone $5M seed round funding (Investor)
content: The software company which automates the cleaning of healthcare data and focuses on pharma and data companies in the life sciences space, addressing data management challenges in EHR, registry, digital health claims, clinical trials and sensor data raised a $5 million seed round led by Acrew Capital, with participation from Initiate Ventures and Healthy Ventures.

title: CareYaya launches AI-powered smart glasses to assist dementia, Alzheimer's patients (Startup)
content: MedaCareLLM, developed as part of the OpenMind Project, uses facial and object recognition to provide real-time support, including memory recall prompts, object identification and medication reminders, enhancing the quality of life for users.

title: NIA awards $2.3M SBIR grant to Onward Health for two-year research project (Startup) (Investor)
content: The study will evaluate the effectiveness of Onward's Door Through Door transportation solutions for older adults, particularly those with Alzheimer's disease and other age-related health conditions in an attempt to measure the impact of these services on the health, well-being and quality of life of older adults requiring accessible transportation to essential health appointments.

title: Right at Home, Village of Hoffman Estates partner to become dementia-friendly (Testbed)
content: The initiative includes 'Learning to Become Dementia Friendly' training sessions led by a Certified Dementia Specialist from Right at Home and aims to build a supportive environment for individuals living with dementia, their families and caregivers.

title: Right at Home’s Carer of the Year Awards announces Mayo/Roscommon finalist (Testbed)
content: Margaret Callaghan was named as the Mayo Roscommon regional winner and finalist in Right at Home's Carer of the Year Awards, recognized for her dedication of care, enabling elderly and disabled individuals to live independently at home.

title: NIH awards TGen, Longevity Consortium $45M (Investor)
content: The Translational Genomics Research Institute (TGen) and its partners in the Longevity Consortium were awarded the funds to integrate results from previous studies.

title: LUMO Labs appoints Kim Fuqua, Peter Brock to Scientific Industry, Impact Board of Advisors, Impact Committee (Investor)
content: Kim Fuqua, EMEA Director Customer Experience at Microsoft, emphasizes the importance of integrating DE&I into business processes for sustainable growth and success while Fuqua aims to help founders instill DE&I as a foundational value to shape inclusive cultures and prevent systemic inequities.

title: Hearst Venture participates in Supermom $14M Series B funding round (Investor)
content: The funds will be used to enhance AI capabilities and support international expansion as Supermom connects brands to over 10 million parents in Southeast Asia and has more than 250 consumer brands as clients.

title: Socium Ventures creates second $300M fund (Investor)
content: The venture capital arm of Cox Enterprises plans to invest in industries such as healthcare, enterprise, software, fintech and sustainability, with investments ranging from $3 million to $25 million.

title: LeadingAge urges providers form national movement to address long-term care system issues (Enterprise)
content: During the LeadingAge Annual Meeting, President and CEO Katie Smith Sloan emphasized the need for better infrastructure, services and funding to support the aging population and highlighted the current system's inefficiencies.

title: Samsung introduces Medications tracking feature in Samsung Health app (Enterprise)
content: The feature, designed with Indian consumers in mind, allows users to track their prescribed or over-the-counter medications and offers important medical information and tips, making it particularly beneficial users managing chronic diseases like hypertension, diabetes, PCOS and PCOD.

title: Prudential taps Google MedLM GenAI to verify medical claims (Enterprise)
content: The company is leveraging Google's GenAI to expedite the verification of medical insurance claims and reduce errors from manual data entry.

title: Infineon Technologies AG launches Edge AI, Machine Learning software solution brand (Enterprise)
content: DEEPCRAFT aims to provide a comprehensive portfolio of Edge AI solutions, including DEEPCRAFT Studio and DEEPCRAFT Ready Models, to meet the growing demand for AI applications in consumer and industrial markets.

title: Prudential Financial, 123Seguro partner to expand South American presence (Enterprise)
content: The partnership aims to distribute accident, health, life and ancillary products to mass-market customers in Brazil and Mexico through a digital platform built by 123Seguro.

title: Helfie AI partners with Microsoft to offer health assessment tools via Azure Marketplace (Enterprise)
content: Helfie, which was accepted into the Microsoft for Startups Pegasus program, aims to revolutionize global healthcare access with its AI-powered mobile platform by allowing Microsoft enterprise customers to access and integrate its health assessment tools, which boast over 90% accuracy.

title: Steadiwear launches third-generation Steadi 3 glove to reduce hand tremors (Startup)
content: The Steadi 3 glove, designed to reduce hand tremors for people with Essential Tremor and Parkinson's disease, is available for pre-order in Canada and the U.S. for delivery in early 2025.

title: United Church Homes ranks 19th in 2024 LeadingAge Ziegler 200 report (Testbed)
content: UCH's management arm also retains its standing as the fifth largest managed services provider.

title: Morehouse School of Medicine, Ferring Pharmaceuticals introduce FertilityEquity eLearning modules powered by EngagedMD (Testbed)
content: This initiative aims to address disparities in fertility care for Black women by providing education and practical applications for healthcare professionals and fertility clinic staff.

title: NIH awards Wayne State University's School of Medicine assistant professor $2.3M for Alzheimer's disease research (Investor)
content: Joongkyu Park, Ph.D., received a five-year $1.9-million R01 project, that aims to understand how tau pathology affects protein biogenesis in neuronal compartments and a two-year $413,915-R21 project, which will explore how redirected CaMKII can restore deficits in Alzheimer's disease models.

title: John Hancock Financial Resilience and Longevity Report highlights financial challenges faced by different generations (Enterprise)
content: The report also discusses a five-year multimillion-dollar collaboration with MIT AgeLab aimed at raising public awareness and driving innovation in preparing for longer lives.

title: Microsoft for Startup to offer up to $150,000 in Azure Credits for four years to startups (Enterprise)
content: The enterprise will also offer access to AI large language models and up to $200,000 worth of Microsoft 365, Visual Studio and GitHub services.

title: Samsung Health launches major app upgrade (Enterprise)
content: Newly introduced features include Medications Tracking and Food Intake tracking and the Health Records feature, which allows users to access their medical records from various clinics and hospitals through a partnership with b well Connected Health.

title: Prudential leverages Google's MedLM to verify medical insurance claims (Enterprise)
content: In a push to speed up processes and reduce errors from manual data entry, Prudential became among the first insurance providers globally to adopt MedLM, which is expected to enhance the accuracy and efficiency of medical insurance claims.

title: Walgreens, Veeva Systems partner to understand market trends, enhance patient engagement (Enterprise)
content: The long-term partnership aims to improve patient outcomes by enabling Walgreens to leverage Veeva Data Cloud products and the Veeva Clinical Platform, providing life sciences companies with high-quality data to understand market trends and enhance patient engagement.

title: CABHI's Ignite program provides funding, acceleration services to early-stage AgeTech innovators (Enterprise)
content: The aim to support the development and commercialization of AgeTech solutions, including remote monitoring for seniors' safety, social engagement platforms and speech recognition technology.

title: CareYaya supports Sandwich Generation families by providing paid companions to assist with parents (Startup)
content: CareYaya provides vital support for families like the Giordanos, enabling Kait, a 34-year-old new mother, to balance caring for her infant son and her live-in parents with dementia, highlighting the crucial role of caregiving services for the growing "sandwich generation" in the U.S.

title: USPTO approves VoltSafe patented flagship power connectors’ resistive sensing technology (Startup)
content: VoltSafe received a Notice of Allowance from the USPTO for a patent continuation on its resistive sensing technology.

title: FallCall Pendant connects directly to smartphones via FallCall Detect, FallCall Lite app (Startup)
content: The FallCall Solutions medical alert pendants, developed in partnership with Essence Smartcare, offer 24/7 emergency monitoring and are designed for active older adults who are tech-savvy.

title: WesleyLife, Drake University launch accelerated bachelor of science for nursing program (Testbed)
content: The initiative addresses nursing shortages and provides students with experience in long-term care settings, including skilled nursing, assisted living, home health and hospice.

title: Lifespace Communities to redevelop vacant office building into residential property near Village on the Green retirement community (Testbed)
content: The company is seeking a pre-application discussion to determine if rezoning or a planned development amendment is required.

title: Remedy invests in  pediatric mental health care platform (Investor)
content: The investment is part of Manatee's seed extension round as the company aims to address the growing mental health crisis among children by fostering family connection through its family-centered approach.

title: National Sleep Foundation grants three 2024 SleepTech Awards (Enterprise)
content: Loop Earplugs and UBlockout were awarded in the Sleep Health and Wellness category, while Neurovalens was recognized in the Sleep Disorders and Conditions category.

title: dsm-firmenich to showcase innovations in nutrition, health, beauty at Food ingredients Europe (Enterprise)
content: Experts from dsm-firmenich will address health concerns related to nutrition and the aging population, discussing the importance of essential nutrients and reducing sugar, salt and saturated fats.

title: Samsung Health partners with b.well Connected Health to allow users to track medical records (Enterprise)
content: The collaboration enables Samsung Health to integrate medical records from b.well's database, providing users access to previous medical records, including vaccinations, prescriptions and specific medical tests.

title: CABHI launches program to support Canadian innovators designing solutions for older persons (Enterprise)
content: Ignite offers funding between $36,000 and $109,000 and acceleration services to early-stage innovators, empowering them to develop, test and validate solutions in real-world settings.

title: Comcast NBCUniversal announces eight startups for Fall 2024 LIFT Labs Collaborative AI Accelerator (Enterprise)
content: Notable startups include Archetype AI, which integrates real-time sensor data and natural language for interactive applications, and Crossing Minds, which uses scalable AI technology to deliver personalized content experiences for media enterprises.

title: Soliddd unveils smartglasses shown to improve sight of people with Macular Degeneration (Startup)
content: A study by Lighthouse Guild indicated that the novel low-vision technology significantly improved reading speed for most subjects and restored sight in areas previously unseen by users.

title: Lifespace Communities names Phyllis DeLaricheliere as executive director at The Craig in Amarillo, Texas (Testbed)
content: With nearly 20 years of experience in senior living, Phyllis DeLaricheliere previously held leadership roles at Sunrise Senior Living, Brookdale and Benchmark Senior Living.

title: United Church Homes member hosts entrepreneurs to live on campus, collaborate with residents (Testbes)
content: The Glenwood Community's Entrepreneur in Residence program allows entrepreneurs to test and develop new technologies for senior living through experiential opportunities.

title: OATS from AARP receives $2.5M to educate on senior social isolation and loneliness (Testbed)
content: The Humana Foundation is financing OATS by AARP, among others in grants totaling $15.2 million, to support health equity, with a focus on seniors and school-aged children in Ken., Fla., La. and Texas.

title: NIA awards $3.9M for Alzheimer's research leveraging 4M Therapeutics (Investor)
content: Jerome Mertens, Associate Professor of Neurosciences at UC San Diego, was awarded a $3.9-million grant from NIA for Alzheimer's research using age-equivalent neurons derived from reprogrammed skin cells.

title: NIA-funded RISE project taken on by University of Tennessee Health Science Center, University of Tennessee Knoxville partnership (Investor)
content: RISE aims to develop an AI-powered humanoid social robot to support caregivers of individuals with Alzheimer's and related dementia, providing training and information to enhance caregiver health.

title: NIA grants $17M to establish StARS Center (Investor)
content: The center aims to advance dementia care by fostering research collaboration, creating a national data infrastructure and evaluating state and regional dementia care programs for effectiveness, accessibility and equity.

title: NIH-supported study finds Alzheimer's disease may cause brain damage in two stages (Investor)
content: The early phase is slow and silent, affecting only a few cell types, while the late phase causes widespread damage and correlates with symptom onset and the accumulation of Alzheimer's hallmarks.

title: Samsung expands healthcare Galaxy Watch features focusing on mental health (Enterprise)
content: Collaborating with Massachusetts General Hospital, Samsung is studying the relationship between depression and biometric indicators from the Galaxy Watch and aims to develop a mental health index for the Samsung Health app.

title: T. Rowe Price launches retirement solution combining managed payout investment with Pacific Life Qualifying Longevity Annuity Contract (Enterprise)
content: Managed Lifetime Income provides stable, predictable monthly income for life to retirees in a defined contribution plan by building on T. Rowe Price's experience with managed payout products and target date solutions, offering a choice between guaranteed income and non-guaranteed options.

title: John Hancock hosts its second Longevity Symposium (Enterprise)
content: The Longer, Healthier, Better Longevity Symposium in Boston, focusing on innovations driving longevity, includes sessions on nutrition, weight management, stress, sleep, healthcare delivery and early cancer detection.

title: Salesforce integrates Honeywell technology to boost pharma tech solutions (Enterprise)
content: By integrating Honeywell's TrackWise Quality suite with Salesforce's Life Sciences Cloud and other solutions, the partnership aims to speed up the delivery of medications and healthcare devices with a focus on safety and affordability.

title: Zendesk launches AI-powered suite to enhance customer service (Business Service)
content: The suite of AI-powered innovations, aiming to provide personalized service at a lower cost, includes AI agents for omnichannel support, an enhanced agent copilot, voice capabilities and an agent builder.

title: ManchesterStory leads COVU's $12.5M funding round (Investor)
content: The investor was joined by Benhamou Global Ventures in leading the Series A funding round for the AI-native services provider for insurance agencies, with total funding now exceeding $20 million.

title: Best Buy Health brings on Mass General Brigham to form country’s largest Hospital-at-Home program (Enterprise)
content: The program aims to treat 200-300 patients at home, which is about 10% of MGB's overall capacity, and has Best Buy Health providing patients with computer tablets and internet access to facilitate the program.

title: Accenture, NVIDIA partner to accelerate agentic AI development, adoption (Enterprise)
content: NVIDIA will support Accenture in creating a dedicated NVIDIA Business Group and launching the AI Refinery platform, which will utilize Nvidia's AI technology stack, including AI Foundry, AI Enterprise and Omniverse.

title: Cooley recognized as finalist for six M&A Advisor Awards (Business Service)
content: The company was nominated for awards including Healthcare/Life Sciences Deal of the Year,  Restructuring of the Year and Cross Border Deal of the Year for its work with Gamida Cell.

title: CareYaya’s introduces AI call service for seniors (Startup)
content: QuikTok is an AI phone companion for lonely older adults, designed to alleviate loneliness and monitor early signs of cognitive decline.

title: NIA awards Dr. Rachita Sumbria grant to investigate impact of obesity on Alzheimer's (Investor)
content: The grant worth over $405,000 will support a study on the impact of obesity on the liver's regulation of amyloid beta and its effect on Alzheimer's disease.

title: NIA invests in small-scale multi-organism interaction simulations to study aging (Investor)
content: The investment in microphysiological systems, also known as organoids, tissue explants, tissue chips or organs on a chip, could advance aging research as it offers a novel platform for preclinical drug development alongside animal models.

title: NIA awards Kaiser Permanente, Boston University School of Public Health, UCSF $28.8M to study dementia preventative factors (Investor)
content: The research project called TIME-AD will investigate whether interventions targeting alcohol use, depression, vision or hearing impairments, or social isolation can protect against Alzheimer's disease and related dementias.
