title: Jumpstart Health invests $150K in eight companies offering aging solutions (Investor)
content: The companies offer solutions for aging in place, women's care products, health record access, digital twin technology, youth mental health, musculoskeletal injury screening, AI-driven precision medicine and prescription delivery services.

title: NIH multi-million-dollar grant will support physical independence research for five more years (Investor)
content: Sutter Health's Sequoia Center for the Science of Aging was awarded $21 million to support research with a focus on helping older adults maintain physical independence.

title: Accenture acquires consus.health (Enterprise)
content: It purchased the German healthcare management consultancy, to strengthen its healthcare sector capabilities in the DACH region.

title: NIA awards grant to medtech company seeking AI-driven solutions for dementia, chronic health conditions (Investor)
content: The grant will support HiDO Technologies' research aimed at transforming dementia care through facial recognition and video observation technologies.

title: NIA presents IGC Pharma with prizes for work on dementia prediction tools (Investor)
content: IGC Pharma's Mexican Health and Aging Study database was recognized for its potential to aid algorithms targeting disproportionately affected populations.

title: National Innovation Centre for Ageing launches community, support site for Newcastle's elderly (Enterprise)
content: The Grainger Market's Being Well Place offers expert advice on wellbeing, allows for the exploration of new technologies and hosts the Young at Heart Clinic, wellness programs, events and workshops.

title: Digital Therapeutics Alliance, Evercore ISI, HLTH to host digital health, therapeutics program at HLTH 2024 (Enterprise)
content: The program, titled 'Tech Meets Therapy: Evaluating the Digital Health Landscape,' will feature two panels of industry executives discussing the investment environment and strategic partnership opportunities in digital health.

title: Twilio.org integrates OpenAI Realtime API into communications platform (Business Service)
content: This integration allows developers to create more natural, real-time AI voice interactions for automated customer experiences, with the API supporting text and audio inputs and includes features like conversation pacing and tone adjustments.

title: Mary Furlong and Associates podcast features NIA, CareYaYa  (Investor) (Startup) (Business Services)
content: The NIA is seeking applications for the 2025 NIA Start Up Challenge and Accelerator Program. CareYaYa was featured for the company's recognition on the LinkedIn list of Top 50 Start-Ups.

title: Panasonic Well startup competition aims to drive innovation, foster well-being outcomes (Enterprise)
content: The Family Wellness Innovation Challenge aims to find and fund breakthrough startups focused on family well-being.

title: ResMed's stock sees 2.1% rise following enhancement of digital sleep solutions (Enterprise)
content: The company introduced patient-centric products for sleep apnea patients, including updates to the myAir consumer patient engagement app, a Generative AI-enabled sleep health assistant and travel gear for CPAP therapy.

title: DeepLook Medical raises undisclosed amount in Series A funding (Startup)
content: The company will use the funds to commercialize its technology, expand into other modalities, and extend its global reach.

title: 6Degrees helps war amputees reduce phantom pain (Startup)
content: The company aims to help war amputees decrease phantom pain and reliance on pain medications through its immersive AI virtual reality games, allowing them to engage in mirror therapy independently.

title: dsm-firmenich showcases health, nutrition, care solutions at SupplySide West 2024 (Enterprise)
content: The company offers science-backed products that cater to consumers' evolving needs and are environmentally sustainable.

title: Samsung introduces Health Research Stack, an open-source project aimed at enhancing digital health research (Enterprise)
content: The platform supports the creation of watch apps that can measure and utilize data such as electrocardiograms, blood oxygen levels, body composition and sleep data from Samsung devices like the Galaxy Watch or Galaxy Ring.

title: TIAA partners with Accenture to enhance retirement recordkeeping capabilities (Enterprise)
content: Accenture will begin supporting TIAA's operations in 2025, focusing on efficiency through automation and process enhancements.

title: Voiceitt could help people with speech impairments to work remotely (Startup)
content: The AI-powered speech recognition system expanded its technology to support remote workers with integrations for WebEx and ChatGPT, a Google Chrome extension for captions, and partnerships with Zoom and Microsoft Teams.

title: Joylux partners with Halle Berry's Respin to address health issues for peri-, post-menopausal women (Startup)
content: The partnership began with the launch of an intimacy gel and a special edition vFit Plus device which uses red light technology for pelvic floor health.

title: Embr Wave named best OTC product at Total Store Expo (Startup)
content: The wearable, which helps manage hot flashes, improve sleep and manage stress, is aimed at the 1.1 billion women experiencing menopause and is also used by others for thermal comfort.

title: Embr Labs named finalist for 2024 Digital Health Hub Foundation awards (Startup)
content: The company is among the top six in the Best in Class for Women's Health category, selected from over 1,500 submissions.

title: Case study shows Wesper reduces Hypoglossal Nerve Stimulation titration time for Obstructive Sleep Apnea by up to 45% (Startup)
content: The Insomnia and Sleep Institute of Arizona has been developing a titration protocol using Wesper's cloud-based sleep tracking, which allows quicker assessment of Hypoglossal Nerve Stimulation device adjustments and tracks objective improvements..

title: Proto Hologram technology allows virtual consultations at West Cancer Center (Startup)
content: This innovation, which has been in use for a few months, allows patients to receive specialized care without the need to travel.

title: Trust & Will among end-of-life startups raising funds in recent years (Startup)
content: It is part of a trend of startups receiving funding for death-related business models, including eco-friendly burial, digital estate planning tools, and funeral planning services.

title: NIA awards $1.6M grant to Emory University's School of Nursing (Investor)
content: The grant was awarded to study Alzheimer's Special Care Units and their role in reducing racial and ethnic disparities in dementia care.

title: Wood County Senior Center to offer seniors' digital literacy program from AT&T, National Council on Aging (Enterprise)
content: WCCOA, one of 50 selected organizations, will offer workshops in English and Spanish on topics like online safety and using communication tools.

title: ONSCREEN recognized for video calling device designed for older adults living at home (Startup)
content: The device, called The Moment, was showcased and won an award at the Consumer Electronics Show (CES), it features an AI companion capable of fall detection, medication reminders and conversation.

title: Meta Ray Ban sunglasses shared at Lighthouse Guild fundraiser (Testbed)
content: The event focused on supporting the visually impaired community and highlighted the importance of inclusion, accessibility and accessible technology.

title: NIA awards Constantiam Bio with $485K grant for Alzheimer's tool (Investor)
content: The MAVEvidence platform will curate and analyze genetic variant data from functional studies, refining the process for gathering and validating data from MAVE studies.

title: Dignify Therapeutics receives research grant from NIA (Investor)
content: Dignify Therapeutics, a developer of therapies for bladder and bowel dysfunction, received grants from the NIA and National Institute of Diabetes and Digestive and Kidney Diseases (NIDDK) to support the development of therapies for the elderly and those with neurological conditions.

title: Kinsome aims to strengthen connections between children and grandparents (Startup)
content: Kinzey, a robot, facilitates conversations and activities between generations; the service also uses an app for kids and notifications via email or text for grandparents, allowing them to interact easily.

title: Tuned takes part in Mind The Tech London (Startup)
content: The AI-powered Hearing Assistant provides 24/7 support and includes a self-service app for hearing evaluation, personalized hearing aid fitting and rehabilitation, all from home.

title: Walgreens, Nationwide participate in $65M funding round for Vesta Healthcare (Investor) (Enterprise)
content: The company, which focuses on older adults with chronic conditions, will use the funding to expand its services to home care providers.

title: Moderne Ventures raises over $230M for MV Core Fund III (Investor)
content: The firm's strategy focuses on PropTech companies with applicability in other markets, a diversification approach stemming from the economic downturn experienced in 2008-2010.

title: Healthworx Accelerator selected 20 startups for three-month business development cohort (Enterprise)
content: The startups, which focus on various areas - including aging, cancer care, brain health and digital therapeutics - will each receive a $25,000 equity-based investment from the Healthworx venture fund.

title: Accenture launches U.K. Regenerative AI program to help disadvantaged communities build AI skills (Enterprise)
content: The initiative aims to train over 1 million people with the support of employee volunteers, partners, and community organizations, providing access to devices, data and AI.

title: Salesforce launches autonomous AI agent suite (Enterprise)
content: Salesforce launched AgentForce, an AI-powered solution to automate repetitive tasks and improve customer service efficiency in service, sales, marketing and commerce.

title: T. Rowe Price launches Personalized Retirement Manager solution (Enterprise)
content: The global investment management firm's service uses personal data to create asset allocation tailored to individuals' specific savings goals, preferences and financial situation to help drive better retirement outcomes.

title: LeadingAge, Ziegler release 21st annual LeadingAge Ziegler LZ 200 Report (Enterprise)
content: LeadingAge partenered with Ziegler to release this year's ranking and analysis of the country's 200 largest not-for-profit senior living organizations.

title: Prudential partners with financial planning platforms to incorporate protected growth, lifetime income strategies (Enterprise)
content: Prudential Financial is enhancing its presence on digital financial planning platforms including RightCapital, Envestnet MoneyGuide and eMoney that are integrating tools like the 'annuity easy button' to streamline the modeling process for advisors, enabling them to create more secure retirement income plans.

title: Centricity solicits Lightspeed to lead $20M funding round (Business Service)
content: Centricity raised $20 million in seed funding at a valuation of $125 million to be used to scale its platforms Invictus and One Digital, expand private banking services and pursue strategic acquisitions.

title: OATS provides technology education to adults over 50 (Testbed)
content: The initiative aims to make students comfortable with technology and meet them at their current skill level.

title: Dentsu launches House of Creators on Roblox to support emerging creators (Investor)
content: The program aims to connect creators with intellectual properties and brands, and includes an accelerator for creators.

title: Fintech Sandbox to host Boston Fintech Week in October (Business Service)
content: During the event from Oct. 14-18, 2024, attendees will delve into the burgeoning role of generative AI, the push for faster payments, challenges posed by an aging population, the impact of climate change and other critical topics.

title: CareYaya, Haptic, Kalogon, Koda Health, Wave Therapeutics part of TechCrunch Startup Battlefield cohort (Startup)
content: The final 20 startups pitch on the TechCrunch Disrupt Stage, and the winner will receive $100,000 in equity-free prize money and the Disrupt Cup.

title: Mid Oregon Credit Union installs RightHear system (Startup)
content: The system was implemented across all seven branch locations to enhance access for the blind and visually impaired.

title: Second Century Ventures participates in $30M Series B funding for Unlock Technologies (Investor)
content: The company offers home equity agreements to homeowners, allowing them to access cash for a share of future home appreciation.

title: Google Cloud opens up on its generative AI plans in life sciences
content: Google launched Med Gemini AI models for medical applications and offers services like Healthcare Data Engine and Vertex AI Search for Healthcare.

title: Kinsome makes public launch, raises $1.2M in pre-seed funding (Startup)
content: The communication platform was designed to allow kids and grandparents to share updates and preserve memories; it features Kinzey, an audio-first AI companion that aims to support kids and grandparents with expressing themselves.

title: London-based MiiCare relocates headquarters to Arizona (Startup)
content: This move aligns with Phoenix's goal to become a leading hub for health technology and demonstrates MiiHealth's commitment to innovating in senior healthcare.

title: CareYaya expands to Atlanta (Startup)
content: The platform offers affordable senior care services at $17 per hour, which is 30-40% lower than traditional care companies.

title: Cephable aims for collaborative approach to digital inclusion (Startup)
content: The company's software supports diverse interaction methods like head motion and adaptive voice controls.

title: FallCall Solutions aims to enhance access to care and reduce costs for the elderly (Startup)
content: Dr. Shea Gregg, a trauma surgeon from Connecticut, observed an increasing incidence of falls among older adults, which led to him founding FallCall Solutions in 2015.

title: United Church Homes receives W.I.S.E. Certification (Testbed)
content: This certification underscores UCH's commitment to creating a supportive environment for mental health.

title: Pivotal Ventures focuses on the $648B care economy (Investor)
content: The firm is making direct investments in companies and investing in women-led venture capital funds that aim to reduce caregiving burdens, lower costs, and improve access.

title: NIA funds $15.5M for nursing home clinical trials network (Investor)
content: The Indiana University School of Medicine and Regenstrief Institute received the grant to create NEXT STEPs, a national nursing home clinical trials network that aims to include more nursing home residents in clinical research.

title: NIA awards over $400K for project RISE (Investor)
content: Project RISE (Robot-based Information and Support to Enhance Alzheimer's Caregiver Health) aims to develop an AI-powered system using a humanoid social robot to deliver educational information to the Alzheimer's community, enhancing caregiver engagement and information accessibility.

title: Montage Ventures participates in funding rounds for Somite Therapeutics (Investor)
content: With the $4.8M extension of its pre-seed round, the TechBio company will accelerate data generation for its AI platform, advance clinical programs and initiate research with hypoimmune cell lines.

title: dsm-firmenich’s Biomedical Division promotes Robyn Wiseman as VP of Global Commercial (Enterprise)
content: Wiseman will lead the global commercial team and drive commercial strategies in the biomedical sector.

title: Homecare Hub presents Froedtert Hospital model at Wisconsin Hospital Association's Annual Post Acute Care Seminar (Startup)
content: Homecare Hub & Froedtert Hospital presented the preliminary results from their post-acute care project that discharges complex patients into Homecare Hub’s network of small residential assisted living homes.

title: NIA neuroscience division commemorates 50th anniversary (Investor)
content: The NIA's Division of Neuroscience expanded its portfolio due to increased congressional funding, leading to discoveries of multiple biological pathways associated with Alzheimer's disease.

title: Penn State receives NIH grant to develop voice assistant for persons living with dementia (Investor)
content: The $432,198 grant will fund a voice assistant to facilitate customized cognitive stimulation therapy given at home to improve the quality of life for persons living with dementia and their care partners.

title: NIH awards Tulane University up to $4M over five years to establish coordinating center for research on aging (Investor)
content: The center, led by the Tulane National Primate Research Center in partnership with the California National Primate Research Center and Baylor College of Medicine, will focus on studies of nonhuman primates to harmonize and integrate data across projects, facilitate collaboration and improve the quality and accessibility of aging research data.

title: Bilt Rewards, Walgreens partner on pharmacy benefits program that rewards customers for using FSA, HSA dollars (Enterprise)
content: Bilt allows renters to earn points on rent payments and apply them towards a future home down payment.

title: Amenities Health chosen for Microsoft for Startups Pegasus Program (Enterprise)
content: Amenities Health offers a digital platform that enhances patient experiences.

title: LG Nova digital health venture seeks to address Appalachian Region healthcare needs (Enterprise)
content: Primefocus Health, a digital health venture launched in collaboration with LG Nova, is working with Marshall Health Network to address key Appalachian Region healthcare issues, such as obesity, healthy aging, substance use disorder and rural healthcare needs.

title: TIAA, Accenture partnership seeks to transform Retirement recordkeeping (Enterprise)
content: TIAA partnered with Accenture to enhance its retirement recordkeeping capabilities by introducing next-generation technologies and improving efficiency through automation.

title: GaitBetter's fall prevention solution eligible for Medicare reimbursement in 12 states ‌(Startup)
content: The Israeli med tech startup developed a system that uses a virtual reality environment to simulate daily walking with motor and cognitive challenges and AI technology to track and integrate leg movements in real time.

title: Vivo joins RAZ Club benefit program (Startup)
content: Grounded in the science of strength training, Vivo offers seniors an individualized personal training experience combined with the convenience of LIVE Zoom sessions you can join from the comfort of your home.

title: Health tech pioneer Ilkka Korhonen joins CardioSignal (Startup)
content: Korhonen will lead the development of novel gyrocardiography technology to speed up its adoption across emerging clinical applications, primarily in heart failure and aortic stenosis.

title: Central Florida nonprofit gives ElliQ to lonely seniors (Enterprise)
content: Central Florida's Senior Resource Alliance (SRA) partnered with Intuition Robotics to distribute 187 ElliQ robots to seniors to help combat loneliness.

title: Assaf Gad from Intuition Robotics discusses what makes a machine smart (Enterprise)
content: On the TechFirst podcast, Gad discusses how AI is different from organic intelligence and chats about the ElliQ elder care companion.

title: FallCall Solutions app launched in five additional countries (Startup)
content: The app, designed for Apple Watch, iPhone and Android, helps caregivers schedule electronic check-ins with their loved ones and is now available in Canada, the U.K., Ireland, Australia and New Zealand.

title: Duke University's Palliative Care program to study impact of CareYaya's platform on patient outcomes, caregiver well-being (Startup)
content: The research, led by Dr. Jessica Ma, will quantify the effects of CareYaya's technology on patient functional status, caregiver burnout and healthcare utilization.

title: Windham Venture Partners participates in $23M founding round for Neuspera Medical (Investor)
content: The company intends to use the money to fund the regulatory approval process for its Neuspera Implantable Sacral Neuromodulation System, an implant designed to provide patients personal control and relief from urinary urge incontinence, a symptom of overactive bladder.

title: Accenture invests in Earli to advance early cancer detection technologies (Enterprise)
content: The investment is expected to help Earli expand its collaborations with global health and pharma companies, potentially accelerating the development of early detection and treatment solutions.

title: Caavo's Jubilee TV set-top box allows caregivers to control it remotely (Enterprise)
content: The set-top box was designed to simplify the streaming experience for the elderly, with features allowing caregivers to control the box via a smartphone app, which is beneficial for troubleshooting or setting up programs to watch.

title: Walgreens enters $100M partnership to conduct clinical trials aimed at future emergency preparedness (Enterprise)
content: The initiative, part of the Decentralized Clinical Operations for Healthcare and Research program, seeks to reach diverse populations and improve public health emergency responses.

title: CareYaya receives grant from Johns Hopkins University, NIA to develop AI app for dementia caregiver training (Startup) (Investor)
content: The app, likened to 'Duolingo for dementia care training', will use AI and micro-learning to deliver personalized training modules to caregivers' smartphones.

title: Perry partners with National Menopause Foundation to make Sept. Perimenopause Awareness Month (Startup)
content: This initiative aims to increase awareness, education, and support for perimenopause, which can begin as early as age 35 and is marked by a decrease in reproductive hormones.

title: Research shows VR services like Rendever enhance lives of seniors (Startup)
content: The study notes the availability of game-based and non-game-based VR experiences, including medical care and pain management and highlights technological advancements that are making VR more immersive and user-friendly.

title: Cake Ventures, AARP, Mary Furlong, Kinsome part of growing age tech industry (Investor) (Business Service) (Enterprise) (Startup)
content: With 62 million Americans over 65, representing nearly 20% of the population, and a projected increase in tech spending by this demographic, there is a significant opportunity for innovation in age tech.

title: Natural Bridge State Park installs RightHear (Startup)
content: Upon entering the park, users can easily access audio instructions and directions through their smartphones, guiding them to key points along the trail, like the Natural Bridge.

title: InsideTracker launches AI Chat feature (Enterprise)
content: 'Ask InsideTracker' provides members with science-backed health and wellness advice and taps into InsideTracker's extensive library of expert articles, offering real-time solutions to health challenges and personalized recommendations.

title: Accenture wins $289-million contract from Australia's Department of Health and Aged Care (Enterprise)
content: Accenture will provide a workforce uplift to meet temporary demands of reform initiatives and maintain the future aged care digital ecosystem

title: Betterleave awarded the Shortlister Top End of Life Resource Provider for 7th consecutive quarter (Startup)
content: Shortlister is a marketplace for buyers to find and select digital service providers, including end-of-life resources.

title: Main Line Health hospitals recognized for commitment to quality care for heart attacks (Testbed)
content: Bryn Mawr Hospital earned the Gold Award for rapid, research-based treatment of heart attack patients.

title: Flint Capital raises $160M for investments in IT, cybersecurity, fintech, digital health (Investor)
content: Flint Capital's unique strategy involves courting IT entrepreneurs as limited partner investors, rather than traditional LPs like pension funds or endowments.

title: Samsung's Galaxy Watch 7, Ultra feature AGEs index health metric (Enterprise)
content: The index measures metabolic health based on advanced glycation end products, it is influenced by diet and is a result of proteins or fats combining with sugar in the bloodstream.

title: Montclair Gateway to Aging in Place awarded $10K Partners for Health Foundation grant (Testbed)
content: The funds will support the digital navigation program, geared to Montclair’s 50+ residents, to facilite access to digital communication, assistive technology and emergency alerts.

title: Second Century Ventures chose seven companies for the 2024 REACH Commercial program (Investor)
content: Companies selected for the 2024 program span large land transactions, real estate ownership, commercial lease abstraction, digital sales and leasing, lowering of carbon emissions and improving building operations.

title: ResMed sees improvement in gross margins through strong device sales (Enterprise)
content: The company's gross margins increased to 59.1% and was attributed to manufacturing improvements, procurement initiatives, scale benefits and efficiencies from transitioning to the AirSense11.

title: Fidelity Investments releases 2024 Retiree Health Care Cost Estimate (Enterprise)
content: The report reveals that a 65-year-old retiring this year can expect to spend an average of $165,000 in healthcare and medical expenses throughout retirement.

title: Caring.com finds one third of employed seniors have unretired (Enterprise)
content: Over half of the "unretired" seniors cite inflation and the increasing cost of living as the primary reason for returning to work.

title: Careteam Technologies named in Fast Company’s 'Innovation by Design Awards' (Startup)
content: The startup received an Honorable Mention in the User Experience category of the awards which honor the designers and businesses solving problems of today and anticipating the issues of tomorrow.

title: Evergreen Daytime Senior Care rolls out Rendever’s engagement platform (Startup)
content: This partnership expands Rendever's offerings to adult daycare programming, bringing the VR solution to aging adults seeking part-time care and social opportunities.

title: Lutheran Senior Services opens Netherlands-inspired dementia village (Testbed)
content: The community features design elements that encourage sensory engagement, including a Harmony Garden, a floral shop, a general store, an art studio, a pet shop with robotic animals and a full-sized aquarium.

title: NIA awards Clemson University researcher grant to develop AI-powered system for elder care planning (Investor)
content: This OleraCare Navigator system aims to connect individuals and caregivers with healthcare resources and services for Alzheimer's and related dementias, including local, state and federal aid programs.

title: NIA-funded study finds personalized health coaching may improve cognition, lower dementia risks in some older adults (Investor)
content: Researchers from the University of California, San Francisco, Kaiser Permanente Washington Health Research Institute support the idea that a customized health coaching approach for reducing dementia risks, such as high blood pressure and low physical activity, may be beneficial to older adults who are at high risk for dementia.

title: Amplify Capital began fundraising for third fund (Investor)
content: The firm focuses on investing in health, education and environment industry-changing technologies at the pre-seed, seed and Series A financing stages.

title: WRF Capital took part in $144M Series B funding round for Outpace Bio (Investor)
content: The funds will be used to advance Outpace's pipeline of engineered T-cell therapy candidates, including their lead candidate OPB-101 for ovarian cancer treatment.

title: Accenture Federal Services wins $81M contract with Social Security Administration for AI services to process benefit documents (Enterprise)
content: This effort is part of the SSA's Modernization Plan, aiming to enhance response capabilities to retiree and survivor benefits needs while managing costs.

title: Livindi named most comprehensive elderly monitoring system by Fortune (Startup)
content: Livindi allows users to create a customized monitoring system, detect falls without needing a wearable and offers a mental health component.

title: NIA-funded study shows blood test improves accuracy of Alzheimer's diagnosis in primary care, memory care (Investors)
content: The study on C2N Diagnostics LLC's PrecivityAD2 blood test shows over 90% accuracy in diagnosing Alzheimer's compared to CSF or amyloid PET analysis.

title: Researcher gets $2.69M NIA grant to study use of short-term estrogen to prevent cognitive decline in women (Investor)
content: Tulane University's research, led by Professor Jill Daniel, focuses on the hippocampus and neuroestrogens, with initial findings suggesting that estrogen therapy could maintain higher neuroestrogen levels during aging.

title: CABHI takes part in funding round for technology to detect Alzheimer's through retinal imaging (Enterprise)
content: RetiSpec secured $10 million in Series A financing to advance its technology for early detection of neurodegenerative diseases through an eye test.

title: Cooley appoints chief innovation officer (Business Service)
content: David Wang will lead Cooley's innovation department and collaborate with various teams and firm leadership on new and ongoing initiatives.

title: Kalogon, Etac win design award for smart air cushion to help prevent pressure injuries (Startup)
content: The Star Sentinel smart seating solution adjusts cushion pressure based on ambient conditions and provides leak detection alerts.

title: Right at Home to exceed franchising, hiring goals for 2024 (Testbed)
content: The in-home care franchise awarded 19 new franchises in 2024, aiming for a year-end goal of 24, it was also recognized by Entrepreneur's Franchise 500 for the 21st consecutive year and received a Culture100 Award from Franchise Business Review.

title: NIA-funded research sheds light on Parkinson's disease process (Investor)
content: Weill Cornell Medicine researchers have developed a new preclinical model for studying Parkinson's disease, which may offer a simpler method for its detection. The model involves knocking out a protein transport component in mice, leading to retinal accumulation of alpha-synuclein protein aggregates, similar to those found in human Parkinson's patients. The study, which could impact about one million Americans diagnosed with Parkinson's, was led by Dr. Ching Hwa Sung and included contributions from Drs. Cheng Fu, Nan Yang, Nobuyuki Nakajima, Satoshi Iraha, Jen Zen Chuang, and Neeta Roy.

title: Walgreens chosen to conduct COVID vaccine study (Enterprise)
content: Walgreens received up to $25 million to assess correlates of protection and will enroll up to 4,000 participants across 20 pharmacy locations.

title: Fidelity Investments suggests older single people build a social network (Enterprise)
content: Fidelity's Meredith Stoddard emphasized the importance of social support and safety nets for older singles and suggested joining online communities or considering home-sharing services for companionship and support.

title: Lutheran Senior Services unveils memory support community (Testbed)
content: Featuring visual elements such as bright-colored doors for easy navigation and soothing sounds, the Assisted Living Memory Support community at Towne Plaza at the Bluffs will be the first of its kind in the region.

title: National Institute on Aging, Johns Hopkins Medicine find intermittent fasting, healthy diet could benefit brain health in older adults (Investor)
content: The study indicates that both ways of eating can lead to cognitive improvements, with intermittent fasting showing slightly stronger benefits.

title: CVS Health Ventures leader shares how corporate venture capital drives healthcare innovation (Investor)
content: Vijay Patel discusses his transition to corporate venture capital and how CVS Ventures aims to foster innovation and drive strategic value in the healthcare ecosystem.

title: Michael J. Fox Foundation for Parkinson’s Research among stakeholders in partnership seeking biomarkers for Parkinson's disease (Enterprise)
content: The Foundation for the National Institutes of Health (FNIH) launched the Accelerating Medicines Partnership in Parkinson’s Disease and Related Disorders (AMP PDRD) to identify biomarkers for Parkinson's to enable earlier diagnosis and personalized treatment plans.

title: Wave Therapeutics founder aims to create cushion to improve lives of wheelchair users (Startup)
content: The cushion under development delivers almost twice as much oxygen to affected cells as the current market-leading product.

title: Proto, AWS partner to allow users to generate holographic content from text input (Startup)
content: This serverless solution uses AWS and the Amazon Titan Image Generator AI to create visual representations that are transformed into videos for Proto's holographic displays.

title: Windham Venture Partners takes part in $23M funding round for Neuspera Medical (Investor)
content: The funding will support the company through the expected FDA premarket approval of the Neuspera System, a minimally invasive implant for urinary urge incontinence treatment.

title: Ziegler arranges $76.2M bond financing for seniors' housing in N.C. (Investor)
content: Carolina Meadows is planning to develop a new nursing facility with a progressive care model featuring 90 beds across seven 12-person households.

title: Samsung launches Galaxy Ring health wearable (Enterprise)
content: It features various sensors for 24/7 health tracking, including sleep analysis, menstrual cycle tracking, energy level insights and heart rate monitoring.

title: Freddie Mac pilot allows homeowners to access equity by purchasing second mortgages (Enterprise)
content: SAFE Credit Union's Chief Lending Officer, Tiffani Vargas, highlighted the potential benefits for long-time homeowners with significant equity, especially those on fixed incomes who are sensitive to refinancing first mortgages.

title: Walgreens debuts 'Nice! For You' line offering healthier food options (Enterprise)
content: The range includes over 150 products, such as organic and gluten-free items, without artificial flavors, sweeteners, synthetic dyes, or high fructose corn syrup.

title: Onward expanded service area to Southern California, Arizona (Startup)
content: The expansion broadens access to Companion Rides, Onward's assisted Door-Through-Door transportation service, to these two markets.

title: Xandar Kardian featured in BBC Storyworks' Human Component Series (Startup)
content: This film showcases how Xandar Kardian's contactless, continuous health monitoring technology is making a significant impact for individuals with Intellectual and Developmental Disabilities.

title: Fannie Mae, Freddie Mac release 10 years of loan data to help transition to modern credit score models (Enterprise)
content: The modernized scores aim to improve loan performance and reduce lender risk of repurchases due to underwriting flaws.

title: Walgreens names former Humana medical chief to join board (Enterprise)
content: Dr. William Shrank, a partner at Andreessen Horowitz and former healthcare executive at Humana and CVS Health, is expected to help Walgreens enhance the role of community pharmacy and develop long-term strategic opportunities.

title: Imago Rehab co-founder, chief clinical officer receives innovation award (Startup)
content: The National Board for Certification in Occupational Therapy (NBCOT) awarded Kristin Nuckols with the 2024 NBCOT Innovation Award for her work in stroke rehabilitation.

title: SilverBills, SustainAble Exchange partner on EnAble SilverBills Tokens (Startup)
content: This new class of EnAble Tokens will provide options to support SilverBills and track the support provided to older adults and their independence.

title: Flint Capital takes part in $31M Series B round for Sensi.AI (Investor)
content: This funding will help Sensi AI enhance its audio AI platform for home care, which detects and predicts care events while maintaining privacy.

title: NIA grant allows Wake Forest University to continue MESA MIND study (Investor)
content: The $27-million grant will support further investigation of how cardiovascular factors contribute to brain abnormalities and Alzheimer's in participants of European, African, Hispanic and Chinese descent.

title: Healthworx launches accelerator for healthcare startups (Enterprise)
content: The twelve-week program aims to provide startups with the necessary tools to enter healthcare markets, offering education, mentorship, and networking opportunities.

title: Fintech Sandbox announces dates for Boston Fintech Week (Business Service)
content: The event will take place from Oct. 14-18 and will include the Fintech Sandbox Innovation Forum and focus on the theme 'Fintech at Full Throttle: The Rapid Advance of Innovation.'

title: The Mather Group celebrates fourth year on Crain's Chicago Fast 50 (Business Service)
content: TMG attributes its success to a client-first approach, offering one-stop wealth management services including financial planning, investment management, tax strategy and estate planning with a transparent fee structure.

title: GaitBetter system installed at Christian Care Communities and Services (Startup)
content: Christian Care Communities and Services in Dallas installed the system, which uses virtual reality to turn any treadmill into a personalized motor-cognitive training device.

title: United Church Homes communities receive quality award (Testbed)
content: Seven of the communities were recognized with the 2024 Silver Achievement in Quality Award by the American Health Care Association and National Center for Assisted Living which honors long-term care organizations that enhance the lives of residents and staff.

title: Study finds Intuition Robotics' ElliQ provides companionship (Enterprise)
content: According to a study that introduced the CoBot I 7 scale, 56% of users felt an increase in their connections with others.

title: The Michael J. Fox Foundation for Parkinson's Research awards $1.49M to Kannalife Sciences (Enterprise)
content: The grant will support preclinical research of KLS-13019, which focuses on neuroinflammation and mitochondrial dysfunction.

title: Luxembourg Research Centre joins Michael J. Fox Foundation Parkinson's Progression Markers Initiative (Enterprise)
content: Parkinson's Progression Markers Initiative aims to develop biological markers for Parkinson's disease and has contributed to the development of a novel biological test, the alpha-synuclein seed amplification assay which shows high diagnostic accuracy, differentiates molecular subtypes and can detect the disease before the onset of movement symptoms.

title: Samsung reportedly developing AGEs index for Galaxy Watches to estimate biological aging (Enterprise)
content: The Galaxy Watch 7 series is expected to introduce health monitoring features, including blood glucose monitoring and tracking cardiovascular and diabetes risks through the AGEs index.

title: CareYaya introduces virtual reality experience to allow hospice patients to virtually visit places of worship (Startup)
content: SpiritAI aims to provide spiritual care through technology, addressing the shortage of chaplains for the growing number of hospice patients in the U.S.

title: Montclair Gateway to Aging in Place received $20K AARP Community Challenge Flagship grant (Testbed)
content: The grant will expand the SmartSeniors SmartTech program, providing skill-building exercises with state-of-the-art devices like smartphones and smartwatches to help older residents navigate the digital age.

title: Flint Capital participates in funding round for Sensi AI (Investor)
content: The AI-based virtual care company that offers aging-in-place solutions raised $31 million in Series B funding.

title: AARP Foundation Connect2Affect Connected Communities aims to enhance seniors' ability to connect with others (Enterprise)
content: The initiative is addressing social isolation among older adults living in affordable senior housing by leveraging technology to foster connections.

title: New York state distributed thousands of robot companions, including ElliQ, to combat loneliness among older adults (Enterprise)
content: These robots help users connect to and monitor loved ones and show potential benefits in reducing depression and loneliness.

title: Ōmcare Home Health Hub seeks to help seniors take medications on schedule (Startup)
content: Ōmcare, which raised $12 million to date and recently secured $8.2 million, is focusing on senior care providers and has Ecumen, a senior housing company, as part of its customer base.

title: NIA gives five-year, $8.2M grant to USC researchers building dementia cost model (Investor)
content: The model aims to provide comprehensive annual estimates of the cost of dementia in the U.S., in hopes of aiding patients, families and policymakers with budgeting, treatment, caregiving options and healthcare policy.

title: Flint Capital aids in Sensi.AI's $31M funding round to address caregiver shortage, soaring care costs (Investor)
content: The Series B financing round co-led by Zeev Ventures and Insight Partners, will support Sensi AI's advanced audio platform that detects and predicts care events, providing insights for home care agencies to improve senior health outcomes.

title: Voiceitt Chrome extension allows people with speech differences to better engage with digital world (Startup)
content: This tool integrates with various online platforms, allowing for voice-to-text content creation and independent internet engagement.

title: Koda Health completes oversubscribed Seed + funding round to expand care planning platform (Startup)
content: The funding round, with investments from Memorial Hermann Health System, AARP and the Texas Medical Center Venture Fund, aims to streamline proactive healthcare planning and document completion.

title: Rock Health invests in Pear Suite to support community health workers (Startup)
content: In a push to support community health workers, Rock Health Capital invested in Pear Suite, whose SaaS platform enables the workers to standardize the data they collect, improve care navigation and access reimbursement from the health plans that cover their services.

title: Zendesk Ventures to invest millions in early-stage AI startups (Business Service)
content: In a push to keep the company at the forefront of AI advancements, expand its marketplace of app and partner integrations and potentially identify acquisition opportunities, the venture arm of Zendesk is set to invest tens of millions of dollars in early-stage AI startups.

title: Xander Kardian among 30 companies to receive funding from CABHI to improve quality of life for older persons (Startup) (Enterprise)
content: The Centre for Aging + Brain Health Innovation announced the support of companies with $9.5 million through its MC2 Program which aims to mobilize innovation in line with Canada's National Dementia Strategy.

title: Sage Stream joins RAZ Club (Startup)
content: Sage Stream, a live, interactive, real-time music video streaming solution for older adults joins the program which includes discounts and privileges on AgeTech products and services.

title: Rendever, Lenovo partner to bring VR platform to Carolina Caring facilities (Startup)
content: The collaboration integrates Rendever's VR experiences with Lenovo's ThinkReality VRX headset, aiming to enhance the lives of older adults by providing immersive experiences.

title: Freddie Mac to offer housing social bonds for people with intellectual, developmental disabilities (Enterprise)
content: The issuance of $186 million in social bonds will support 641 rental homes across 26 states, with 79% being affordable for very low-income individuals.

title: Element introduces regulatory intelligence platform for medical devices (Business Service)
content: RegNav simplifies the regulatory pathways for Class I, II and III medical devices, integrating AI with expert insights to enhance safety and efficiency in market access.

title: Braze Mobility chosen for Mobility Unlimited Hub cohort (Startup)
content: MaRS Discovery District and the Toyota Mobility Foundation selected the startup, which offers blind spot sensors for wheelchairs to help users avoid obstacles, as part of its inaugural cohort.

title: Koda Health secures oversubscription of Seed+ funding round (Startup)
content: This round was led by Ecliptic Capital, with strategic investment from Memorial Hermann Health System, AARP and the Texas Medical Center Venture Fund.

title: CareYaya, Lotus named as finalists for business plan competition at What's Next Longevity Venture Summit (Startup) (Business Service)
content: Mary Furlong Associates and the AgeTech Collaborative announced the finalists for the $10,000 Business Plan Competition and the AgeTech After Dark Pitch Challenge which aim to promote agetech startups and innovative solutions for aging-related challenges.

title: Centers Health Care receives IPRO Quality Award (Testbed)
content: The company was recognized for implementing the SMART goals from the IPRO Anticoagulation Action Plan and collecting data for the action plan using its electronic health record system, Point Click Care.

title: Lighthouse Guild appoints Jamie Ridout as director of GuildCare (Testbed)
content: GuildCare is New York State's only adult day health care program specializing in services for people with vision loss.

title: Care Daily, ONSCREEN partner on caregiving capabilities to engage seniors through TV (Enterprise) (Startup)
content: The integration offers features like prioritized support, automated health assessments by an AI companion named Joy, timely alerts and video chat engagement for remote family members.

title: Angel Capital Association recognizes Deep Blue with life sciences innovation award (Enterprise)
content: Deep Blue Medical Advances won the 2024 Luis Villalobos Award for its innovative surgical devices, including the T-Line Hernia Mesh, which aims to transform soft tissue surgery and prevent failures in such procedures.

title: Microsoft for Startups Founders Hub seeks to help startups leverage AI (Enterprise)
content: The "Build with AI" initiative offers pre-built templates and an AI assistant to support startups seeking to integrate AI features into their applications, connect ChatGPT to their app's data using common coding languages and create ChatGPT plugins.

title: TUYA Global Developer Summit showcases AI hardware, smart solutions (Business Service)
content: The AI-integrated technology is designed to enhance user experience by executing commands based on daily habits and actual scenarios.

title: Ōmcare CEO discusses challenges, strategies of starting, scaling business on podcast (Startup)
content: Lisa Lavin emphasized the importance of perseverance in fundraising, the value of mentorship, understanding the core of product development and the potential for seizing secondary opportunities.

title: NIA aims to enhance early detection of Alzheimer's, related disorders (Investor)
content: The NIA is focusing on improving early detection and prediction of Alzheimer's and related dementia by encouraging research on diverse data sets and offering monetary awards for innovative early detection strategies.

title: MapHabit receives Commercialization Readiness Pilot grant from NIA (Investor)
content: The $3.8-million grant will support the enhancement of the Atlanta-based digital health company's platform infrastructure, user experience, and customer care processes, with the aim of increasing its commercialization and marketing potential.

title: Walgreens SVP discusses the company's pharmacy-first strategy, vision for value based care (Enterprises)
content:
Rick Gates highlighted how this approach could unlock profitable growth and relieve stress on the healthcare system as the population ages. 
Related:
Home Health Care News

title: TUYA Global Developer Summit presents blueprint for AI advancement (Business Service)
content: Keynote speakers from Lenovo, Haier, Alibaba Cloud, Amazon, Silicon Labs, Tencent Cloud, Texas Instruments, Google Cloud and Tuya Smart shared insights on AI innovations and applications across industries.

title: Proto launches hologram concierge service in hotel (Startup)
content: The Beverly Wilshire, a Four Seasons Hotel, installed the service in its penthouse and presidential suites, enabling guests to interact with hotel staff through holographic projections.

title: Austin Area Obstetrics, Gynecology, and Fertility clinic installs RightHear System (Startup)
content: This ensures the clinic is fully accessible to people who are blind or have low vision by providing real-time audio assistance, orientation services and event information.

title: CareYaya connects University of Michigan pre-med students with local seniors (Startup)
content: The students provide companionship and caregiving, offering services like meal prep, dog walking and fall prevention at a lower cost than traditional in-home care.

title: Mighty Health's CEO discusses its digital platform which offers exercise, nutrition coaching (Startup)
content: James Li says the company's vision includes weight loss, mobility, pain reduction and content development for aging well.

title: Accenture Federal Services launches automated text messaging service for VA health centers (Enterprise)
content: Dubbed 'Annie,' the service assists with medication reminders, surgery preparation and self-care health data monitoring.

title: Kalogon secures $1.2M to fuel product, team expansion (Startup)
content: The funding will support the development of products using the startup's Advanced Pressure Management system, which is clinically proven to improve blood flow for people who sit for extended periods.

title: Labrador Systems included on list of startups improving lives of the elderly (Startup)
content: The startup's assistive robots handle everyday tasks like meal delivery and laundry assistance that are controlled through user-friendly options like apps or voice commands.

title: NIA-funded study finds cognitive declines preceding Alzheimer's diagnosis lead to credit card, mortgage delinquencies (Investor)
content: Georgetown University-led research, released by the Federal Reserve Bank of New York, indicates that credit scores begin to deteriorate and payment delinquency increases prior to an Alzheimer's or other memory disorder diagnosis.

title: CenterLight Healthcare selects Nonnatech for PACE participant care (Startup)
content: Nonnatech will support CenterLight's high-risk participants, including dual-eligible beneficiaries with multiple chronic health conditions, focusing on improving health outcomes, creating an engaging participant experience, achieving cost savings and reducing avoidable hospital admissions and hospital utilization.

title: Rendever VR allows seniors to travel virtually, relive memories (Startup)
content: The technology has helped reduce feelings of loneliness and isolation among residents in a Pacific Springs community.

title: HomeZada helps consumers manage house inventory, maintenance, projects, finances (Startup)
content: The startup integrated AI applications to enhance its capabilities in reducing losses and maximizing home values. The AI component focuses on inventory management and provides maintenance reminders and home improvement project guidance.

title: Selfhelp collaborates with Studio Libeskind on affordable housing project (Testbed)
content: The $132 million project offers 190 residential units for seniors; the design emphasizes an 'Age In Place' philosophy, catering to the evolving needs of the aging population.

title: CABHI receives over $39M from Strategic Science Fund (Enterprise)
content: The company received the funds to continue accelerating the development of products and services that support aging and brain health.

title: Samsung shows off the Galaxy Ring at Health Partner Day (Enterprise)
content: Health Partner Day was the company's first such event and aimed to collaborate with partners in the medical industry to enhance its health platform.

title: Rendever expands partnership with Leisure Care to deploy VR platform across 24 senior living communities (Startup)
content: The technology aims to improve the lives of residents, especially those with cognitive impairments, by offering immersive experiences such as virtual travel and interaction with animals.

title: QED Investors led $13M Series A round in Footprint (Investor)
content: The company offers a platform that unifies KYC, security, and authentication to streamline consumer onboarding and reduce identity fraud.

title: Models using data from NIA-funded sources may predict need for nursing care among older adults with dementia (Investor)
content: Researchers used computational modeling to predict the need for nursing home level of care in older adults who have dementia.

title: NIA awards University of New Mexico's Center for Memory Aging a five-year, $21.7M grant (Investor)
content: The grant, given to support the Alzheimer's Disease Research Center, aims to enhance multidisciplinary research into Alzheimer's and related dementias.

title: Angel Capital Association presents Deep Blue Medical with Luisa Villalobos Award (Enterprise)
content: Deep Blue Medical's technology addresses the high failure rate in abdominal hernia repairs, aiming to reduce the $10 billion annual cost associated with these failures.

title: Execs from Unum, Fidelity discuss how automation can help underserved communities save for retirement (Investor) (Enterprise)
content: During the Employee Benefits Research Institute 2024 Spring Policy Forum, Ben Roberge, director of financial and retirement programs at Unum, discussed the benefits of auto-enrollment in a 401(k)-linked emergency savings vehicle while Jason Jagatic, head of global and workplace thought leadership at Fidelity, pointed to the automatic porting of workplace savings to another account when an employee moves jobs and providers.

title: Review of NIA-funded studies, highlights need for investment in Alzheimer's treatments (Investor)
content: At the 2024 American Geriatrics Society meeting, Kavya Shah said despite $3.5 billion spent annually on federally sponsored research, only two disease-modifying treatments have been marketed.

title: NIA-funded study finds brain stimulation treats depression, anxiety in older adults (Investor)
content: The treatment, known as transcranial direct current stimulation, showed the greatest improvements in depression and anxiety symptoms among patients who reported higher symptom levels before treatment.

title: Digital speech analysis may provide warning of frontotemporal degeneration, NIA-funded study finds (Investor)
content: Recognizing early changes in speech may help identify people with genetic risk for frontotemporal degeneration (FTD) before they have symptoms, according to the study.

title: ADT uses facial recognition to arm, disarm system for people granted conditional home access (Enterprise)
content: The Trusted Neighbor feature can create custom automation based on time and events, such as allowing a dog walker access during a specific timeframe or granting entry to a trusted person during an emergency.

title: Ōmcare, PharMerica partner to combat medication non-adherence (Startup)
content: This collaboration will provide senior care and home health operators with a more efficient service model, especially important as the aging population grows and caregiver access decreases.

title: Right at Home completes nine new signings as demand for in-home care grows (Testbed)
content: The in-home care franchise is experiencing growing demand nationwide and is focusing on states with the highest need for senior care.

title: John Hancock, Manulife, MIT AgeLab launch longevity collaboration (Enterprise)
content: The collaboration will focus on research and thought leadership to address the challenges of an aging population, including the potential for hybrid life and retirement insurance solutions.

title: Walk With Path, Tufts Medical School, Arizona State University win a2 pilot award
content: Their project enhances fall prediction and treatment with pressure sensing insoles.

title: GaitBetter partners with Aligned Orthopedic and Sports Therapy (Startup)
content: The physical therapy provider in Washington D.C., Maryland, and Northern Virginia, will use GaitBetter to provide motor-cognitive training tailored to each client.

title: U.K.'s NHS Lancashire and South Cumbria adds 500 Nobi Smart Lamps in seniors' rooms (Enterprise)
content: The Digital Social Care Team at the NHS Lancashire and South Cumbria Integrated Care Board will assess 50 care homes in the area to identify where the lights could have the greatest impact.

title: RightHear systems in place at Rocky's Hot Chicken Shack in Asheville, N.C. (Startup)
content: Visitors to Rocky's can utilize RightHear's technology to navigate the restaurant using their smartphones, receiving audio instructions in up to 26 languages.

title: Prisidio names Chris Harrison as its Chief Advocate (Startup)
content: The TV host, producer and podcaster will promote managing essential personal information through Prisidio’s secure digital vault.

title: CareYaya CEO says AI-powered NeuroTech could revolutionize dementia care (Startup)
content: Neal K. Shah discussed how emerging neurotechnology, such as mobile EEG devices paired with customized AI and machine learning models, is poised to transform the fight against dementia.

title: CEO of ianacare says family caregivers often invisible to healthcare system (Startup)
content: The caregiver support company provides tools, support and education for at-home care as part of its employment benefits.

title: OATS to receive grant from Microsoft, OpenAI fund to fight AI misinformation (Testbed)
content: The $2-million Societal Resilience Fund aims to further AI education and literacy among voters and vulnerable communities by supporting organizations that deliver AI education and support.

title: Nobi to showcase AI Smart Lamp at AI for Good Global Summit 2024 in Switzerland (Enterprise)
content: The lamp is designed to revolutionize elder care and aligns with the U.N. Sustainable Development Goals.

title: Walgreens expands specialty pharmacy business to gene, cell therapy services (Enterprise)
content: The retailer will work directly with drugmakers to bring cell and gene therapies to U.S. patients as part of a broader expansion of its specialty pharmacy services.

title: Walgreens, DoorDash partner to offer in-store, delivery options for SNAP customers (Enterprise)
content: The collaboration with DoorDash allows shoppers across the nation to use SNAP/EBT at any Walgreens location, regardless of where they live, and even have them delivered to their front door.

title: Fintech Sandbox receives $150K grant from Global Atlantic Financial Group (Business Service)
content: The grant will help the nonprofit provide support to early-stage FinTech startups and their communities.

title: Sana Health receives $3.4M grant from Department of Defense for PTSD study through Q1 2026 (Startup)
content: The startup's Neuropathic Pain Pivotal study is set to be submitted as a De Novo application to the FDA in May 2024 with approval expected by the second quarter of 2025.

title: SingFit becomes DTAC certified (Startup)
content: The digital health platform complies with clinical safety, data protection, technical security, interoperability, usability, and accessibility regulations in both the U.K. and the U.S.

title: Artifcts now offers in-app audio, video recording (Startup)
content: In addition, the company now offers Artifcts QR code stickers to help bridge the digital-analog divide.

title: Lutheran Senior Services receives over $73K from the Evangelical Lutheran Church in America (Testbed)
content: This grant will support LSS Aging Answers' Care Management services for 165 low-income older adults living in the St. Louis metropolitan area.

title: Kinto acquired by Rippl, a dementia-focused specialty care provider (Startup)
content: The move aims to leverage AI architecture and technology to scale access to expert dementia care for patients and families.

title: Lighthouse Guild receives grant from American Macular Degeneration Foundation (Testbed)
content: The $75,000 AMDF Thrive Award was given to study the effectiveness of assistive technology devices for people with vision impairment.

title: Artisight chosen for Microsoft for Startups Pegasus Program (Enterprise)
content: Artisight's Smart Hospital Platform features AI sensors for computer vision, voice recognition, and vital sign monitoring, aiming to enhance its capabilities and growth opportunities through this collaboration.

title: Wisconsin reimburses residents for FallCall app (Startup)
content: Wisconsin residents enrolled in the Independent Living Support Pilot can download FallCall Detect or FallCall Lite on their Apple Watch, iPhone or Android device to access the service, which is nearly half the cost of conventional subscriptions.

title: Tembo Health partners with Springwell Senior Living to provide telemedicine for residents (Startup)
content: The partnership grew out of Tembo Health’s participation in 1501 Health, a business incubator for healthcare startups, which is a partnership between Healthworx and LifeBridge Health, the majority owner of Springwell.

title: CardioSignal detects heart failure with a cell phone (Startup)
content: Researchers from the University of Turku, working with the medical device company, succeeded in using a smartphone to detect heart failure, according to research.

title: Center for Elders' Independence supports older transgender adults (Testbed)
content: CEO Maria Zamora and client Buddy Wolf discuss the resources available for supporting older transgender adults.

title: Montereau Senior Living partners with Sentrics (Testbed)
content: The partnership aims to enhance resident experiences through the Sentrics360 suite which integrates resident engagement, TV services, life safety and data analytics.

title: Demand for sleep apnea machines gives ResMed a boost (Enterprise)
content: ResMed reported a 7% increase in revenue to $1.2 billion in the third quarter, attributed to heightened demand for sleep devices and significant growth in its mask product portfolio.

title: Walgreens expands specialty pharmacy business to gene, cell therapy services (Enterprise)
content: The retailer will work with drugmakers to bring cell and gene therapies to U.S. patients as part of a broader expansion of its specialty pharmacy services.

title: Samsung aims to creating 'Circle of Care' using wearables, AI (Enterprise)
content: The Galaxy Watch tracks several health metrics, and the company plans to use AI to help interpret health data for better clinical management along with using social connections to encourage healthy lifestyle changes.

title: Trust & Will forms strategic partnership with LPL Financial (Startup)
content: As part of LPL's Vendor Affinity program, Trust & Will allows financial advisors to streamline their clients' estate planning and probate needs, creating ready-to-execute documents in all 50 states.

title: CareYaya hosting free digital literacy workshop for Ann Arbor seniors (Startup)
content: The workshop will see University of Michigan students educate older adults on using digital tools like virtual reality to enhance their health and quality of life.

title: OATS wins two 2024 AVA Digital Awards (Testbed)
content: It received Platinum for 'Aging with Attitude and Gratitude,' a short web video showcasing a couple's journey in providing free tech training to seniors, and Gold for an article by Executive Director Tom Kamber titled 'Solving for X at the End of Life,' which explores societal approaches to death and advocates for more meaningful end-of-life experiences.

title: Zeal Capital Partners leads $5.2M funding round for Auxa Health (Investor)
content: The AI-driven benefit navigation technology provider aids in clarifying benefits and medication coverage, streamlining eligibility and prior authorization processes and enrolling patients in various health benefits from different plans and programs.

title: Boomerang Ventures leads $2.32 funding round for Pelvital (Investor)
content: The funds will accelerate the launch of Flyte, an FDA-cleared device for treating stress urinary incontinence (SUI) and weakened pelvic floor muscles.

title: Walgreens partners with Door Dash to provide access for SNAP Customers (Enterprise)
content: The collaboration enables SNAP customers to make purchases directly from Walgreens using their SNAP/EBT cards.

title: Canopy says senior care facilities can use data to optimize programmatic display advertising (Business Service)
content: Facilities should use data to inform ad messaging and visuals, test different ad formats and incorporate responsive design.

title: DeepLook Medical receives second patent (Startup)
content: This new patent protects the unique radiomic data derived from the use of DL Precise on digital imaging.

title: Happitech included on list of European startups shaping future of healthcare (Startup)
content: The Dutch startup built an app that uses smartphone sensors to measure cardiac health indicators, including heart rate, heart rate variability, and atrial fibrillation.

title: CareYaya CEO says seniors struggle with health technologies due to lack of digital literacy (Startup)
content:
In addition to its 'Joygiver' program, which trains college students to conduct digital skills workshops for seniors, the company launched AI-powered digital health tools for elders with dementia and Alzheimer's, backed by the National Institutes of Health and Johns Hopkins School of Medicine.
Related:
NeurologyLive

title: As part of CareYaya's social enterprise innovation program, North Carolina tech innovator developing AI-powered tool to help those with dementia communicate (Startup)
content: This tool uses mobile EEG technology and AI to interpret brainwave patterns and aims to improve the quality of life for dementia patients and their caregivers.

title: At CABHI Summit, Dr. Rosanne Aleong interviewed AI-powered robot regarding ethical considerations for using AI to care for older people, those with dementia (Enterprise)
content: Topics in the interview with Ameca included consent and autonomy, privacy and security, bias and fairness.

title: Onward Partners with HonorHealth in Arizona (Startup)
content: This service aims to remove transportation barriers to healthcare, especially for disabled individuals and older adults.

title: Zinnia joins the RAZ Club (Startup)
content: The RAZ Club includes discounts and privileges on AgeTech products and services. Zinnia TV's research-backed videos are built to engage people living with dementia, provide caregivers with respite, and reduce stress.

title: Lucid featured in article about how music affects brain rehabilitation (Startup)
content: Lucid aims to deliver music as a therapeutic tool for older adults experiencing agitation and anxiety, which can be caused by cognitive decline or dementia.

title: Jessica Kim of ianacare says hospital-at-home programs need to support family caregivers (Startup)
content: The company, influenced by Kim's caregiving journey, offers a smartphone application that provides resources for family caregivers and connects them with care providers and other family members.

title: Baptist Retirement Communities of Georgia unveils HaloIR (Testbed)
content: The HaloIR Therapy Suites combine the power of halotherapy, chromotherapy and infrared heat therapy.

title: Moderne Ventures' 2024 Spring Passport Class includes Abodu (Investor)
content: The startup focuses on transforming backyard spaces into livable homes for multi-generational households and aging in place.

title: The Smarter Service partners with BHI Senior Living (Business Service)
content: The partnership aims to improve digital literacy and technology engagement for residents and employees, starting with The Barrington of Carmel and Four Seasons in Indiana.

title: Kinto named a2PilotAward recipient (Startup) (Testbed)
content: The startup uses sentiment analysis and generative AI algorithms to enhance dementia caregiver interventions in home care environments.

title: Trust & Will launches new features on advisor platform (Startups)
content: The updates include an estate summary, estate reports and personalized insights.

title: Lighthouse Guild video highlights vision friendly environments (Testbeds)
content: The video provides tips for creating an environment that is safe, easy to navigate and welcoming for people with vision impairment.

title: NIA promotes Butler-Williams Scholars Program (Investor)
content: The program can help new researchers gain insights into aging research.

title: Tuned wins award for OSHA-compliant hearing conservation platform (Startups)
content: Tuned's STAR program integrates scheduling, testing, analytics and reporting in a single platform accessible from any device.

title: Artifcts earns gold at Mom's Choice Awards (Startup)
content: The startup was named among the best in family-friendly media, products and services by the MCA.

title: Technology developed by CardioSignal and University of Turku uses smartphone sensors to detect heart failure (Startup)
content: Over a decade of development by researchers at the startup and university resulted in a technique called gyrocardiography, which uses the smartphone's motion sensors to detect cardiac vibrations in the chest, including those undetectable by a stethoscope.

title: OATS onboards new partners to Senior Planet Licensing Program (Tesbeds)
content: Fourteen new partners were onboarded, expanding the reach of its technology classes for older adults across 13 states.

title: NIA awards $2.5M Small Business Innovation Research grant to BetterAge (Investor)
content: The grant will support the development of a web-based platform designed to enhance the quality of life for older adults and their caregivers.

title: EyeClick develops interactive learning platform (Enterprise)
content: In Nov. 2023, Education Technology Insights featured the company, which paved the way for the development of EyeWiz, an all-inclusive platform revolutionizing interactive learning.

title: Foundation for Social Connection highlighted during LeadingAge member policy update (Business Service)
content: The foundation is the nonprofit arm of the Coalition to End Social Isolation & Loneliness, which focuses on education, increasing public awareness and promoting research and evidence-based models to promote social connection.

title: CardioSignal provides clinical modality for heart failure detection using smartphones (Startup)
content: The multicenter study found highly accurate results for using smartphones as a measuring device in the detection of heart failure.

title: Alzheimer’s Association and MATTER select Onward as winner of pitch competition (Startup)
content: Capturing the $15,000 top prize, Onward is a door-through-door companion rideshare service and transportation management solution.

title: Trust & Will CEO appears on financial advice podcast Rethink (Startup)
content: Cody Barbo discusses all aspects of estate planning from how advisors can help to the lack of education around the issue.

title: Neurotrack partners with Midi Health to offer women tool for testing cognitive impairment (Startup)
content: The partnership will help women who experience midlife "brain fog" determine whether their symptoms are linked to menopause or indicative of more severe cognitive impairment.

title: Pear Suite partners with Zero Overdose to train people, providers, communities to prevent overdoses (Startup)
content: The objectives of the partnership are to enhance motivational interviewing and counseling skills, improve job satisfaction and expand access to important health information.

title: Rubitection CEO gets conference attention after asking for guest spot on Sherri show (Startup)
content: Sanna Gaspard, whose company is developing an AI-enabled platform for the assessment and management of wounds and dermatological conditions, made the request from the audience at the Black Enterprise Women of Power Summit.

title: Epsilon Health Investors participates in funding round for Praia Health (Investor)
content: The health tech startup, which developed a platform for patient portals, raised $20 million in new funding after spinning out from the Providence health tech incubator.

title: Microsoft for Startups-affiliated companies Life365, Canary Speech partner to scale proactive care technologies (Enterprise)
content: This collaboration aims to improve remote care, especially in rural and underserved areas, by integrating wearables, sensors and AI-driven voice biomarkers.

title: Intuition Robotics uses AI to improve ElliQ with conversation, personalization (Enterprise)
content: Researchers have developed a scale to measure their robot's impact on users' health, and doctors are prescribing companion robots to combat loneliness among older adults.

title: Canopy's dashboard can enhance marketing efforts for senior care facilities (Business Service)
content: A case study from a Florida senior care facility shows a 60% increase in website traffic and a 45% increase in online inquiries over six months.

title: Artifcts partners with Susan G. Komen (Startup)
content: The partnership aims to support ongoing cross-sectional work in research, community health, global outreach and public policy to find a cure for breast cancer.

title: Addition Wealth chosen for Accenture, Partnership Fund for New York City's innovation lab (Startup) (Enterprise)
content: The 12-week FinTech Innovation Lab New York 2024 accepted 10 early and growth-stage FinTechs to help develop their product and accelerate business development through collaboration with financial service providers and venture capital managers.

title: Kinsome partners with Fluent Research (Startup)
content: The collaboration launched in Feb. with sessions at Research Camp, where campers formed design teams to create ways for kids and grandparents to stay close when they are not together.

title: UNC students from CareYaya teach older adults to use VR, AI tools (Startup)
content: The initiative, supported by an NIH grant, aims to provide therapeutic benefits and cognitive engagement for seniors.

title: Fast Company says Together by Renee improving wellness by developing community (Startup)
content: The article features a new wave of wellness and personal care companies that understand meaningful connections are key to good health.

title: Lutheran Senior Services enters senior living agreement with Diakon  (Testbed)
content: Diakon, a Lutheran organization that offers a continuum of senior lifestyle and healthcare services, signed an agreement to bring it's senior living operations and four life plan communities under LSS.

title: Nationwide Ventures participates in funding round for NewRetirement (Investor)
content: The digital-first financial planning platform for consumers and enterprise partners closed its Series A round with $20 million in funding to expand its enterprise offerings, scale onboarding and support for new partners, enhance R&D efforts aimed at helping its user base, integrate LLMs and AI to provide more personalized recommendations and build capacity to meet the demand.

title: Comcast Ventures, Acronym Venture Capital invest in HealthSnap (Investor)
content: HealthSnap is seeking to accelerate the access and quality of proactive patient care through remote patient monitoring and chronic care management.

title: Comcast Ventures participates in funding round for Hume AI (Investor)
content: The $50M round will support the debut and development of Hume’s emotionally intelligent voice interface that is optimized for human well-being and can be built into any application.

title: ElliQ by Intuition Robotics improves voice with Azure Text to Speech (Enterprise)
content: The company selected the voice 'Sara,' which improved ElliQ's intonation and inflection, which enhanced empathy and overall sound quality.

title: CareYaya featured on 7 News Boston (Startup)
content: A Boston woman with Cerebral Palsy and her mother shared how the startup, which connects student caregivers with those who need them, makes a difference in their lives.

title: a2 Pilot Awards to include focus on biology of aging (Testbed)
content: The deadline for the 4th annual awards is Apr. 30.

title: LeadingAge 2024 Leadership Summit to take place April 15 to 17 (Enterprise)
content: The summit will offer over 25 sessions and two keynotes from over 70 speakers.

title: Xandar Kardian's XK300-H Gen-2 home health monitor wins 2024 iF DESIGN AWARD in the Medical Health category (Startup)
content: The iF DESIGN AWARD is decided by a 132-member jury, this year almost 11,000 entries were submitted from 72 countries.

title: XRHealth named one of Fast Company’s Most Innovative Companies in AR, VR (Startup)
content: The company uses virtual reality to provide FDA-registered prescription health treatments guided by medical professionals - from shoulder motion exercises for physical rehabilitation to mental health therapy.

title: Together by Renee named one of Fast Company's Most Innovative Companies in Wellness and Personal Care (Startup)
content: The app helps older Americans fill out health forms, send appointment reminders and even take their blood pressure from home.

title: Together by Renee launches the Together Companion to help users follow care plans, achieve better health (Startup)
content:
The Together Companion is an AI-powered, personal chatbot, that provides conversational, personalized answers and guidance to users based on their care plans, recordings, vitals, medications and more.
Related:
WSBT

title: Intuition Robotics' ElliQ being integrated into Western Home Communities' services (Startup)
content: Western Home Communities CEO Kris Hansen contributed insights on senior lifestyles during ElliQ's development, the technology is seen as a way to extend services, especially in rural areas with connectivity challenges.

title: Pear Suite partners with community-based organizations to launch training initiative in California (Startup)
content: The company is participating in the California Department of Health Care Access and Information’s training program, Caring4Cal, which is aimed at expanding, enhancing, and strengthening the state's Home-and-Community-Based Services workforce.

title: Penny Finance CEO featured by Bentley University (Startup)
content: Crissi Cole left a corporate job and founded the digital-first financial well-being and education platform to help close the pay equity and wealth gap for women.
