title: CVS Health Ventures invests in WellBe Senior Medical expansion (Investor)
content: The company, which offers home-based care to older adults, is expanding into N.Y. through a partnership with Excellus BlueCross BlueShield.

title: CVS Health Ventures takes part in funding round for Abridge (Investor)
content: The latest funding will be used to accelerate R&D, enhance machine learning models, and expand the team.

title: Kinsome co-founder discusses being a father, starting companies on Startup Dad (Startup)
content: Eben Pingree is a serial startup founder who is building Kinsome, focused on helping grandkids better connect with their grandparents.

title: Jumpstart Foundry announces Q1 portfolio additions focused on enhancing healthcare (Investor)
content: The eight companies focused on enhancing healthcare through AI-enhanced devices, digital tools, and novel care models, each received a $150,000 investment and will participate in Jumpstart's Insight program.

title: LeadingAge supports legislation including permanent telehealth funding (Enterprise)
content: The Telehealth Modernization Act of 2024, introduced in the House of Representatives, aims to make federal Medicare reimbursements for telehealth permanent and expand access to qualified health clinics, especially in rural areas.

title: Wave Therapeutics named finalist in AgeTech Atlanta, the American Society on Aging AgeTech Challenge Innovation Showcase 2024 (Business Service) (Startup)
content: Finalists will pitch to venture capitalists for a chance to win $10K during the On Tech On Aging 2024 summit, part of the On Aging conference.

title: Rosy Wellness expands to provide more comprehensive support for women’s health (Startup)
content: This expansion targets areas such as endometriosis, fibroids, menopause, migraines, and more, aiming to provide comprehensive support for women across all stages of life.

title: Blue Heron Capital participates in funding round for Tava Health (Investor)
content: The mental health platform completed a $20 million Series B funding round, which will be used for product development, expansion of the provider network and developing partnerships with employers and health insurance carriers.

title: Senior Savvy merges with The Smarter Service (Business Service)
content: Abbie Richie says The Smarter Service has the infrastructure to serve on a larger scale through its subscription-based model, enterprise solution and leadership team.

title: Argentum launches seniors resource hub (Business Service)
content: The Standing with Seniors website will feature resources, including research reports, white papers, legislative updates, advocacy resources, policy briefs, news articles, blog posts and multimedia content.

title: Concha Labs plans to offer replacement part subscriptions (Startup)
content: The replacement parts will include batteries, ear tips and wax filters to make hearing aid maintenance easier.

title: Vivo helps Clayton County Senior Services earn innovation award (Startup)
content: Clayton County Senior Services is the first department in Ga. to offer VIVO Fitness which consists of small-group, interactive Zoom classes taught by live instructors.

title: 11TEN shares takeaways from the ViVE 2024 conference (Testbed)
Pivotal Ventures says it supports funds led by women of color to increase diversity, equity in venture capital (Investor)
content: This story features two Pivotal-backed fund managers who exemplify the impact meaningful diversity and inclusivity at leadership levels can have on the industry.

title: Mitsubishi Electric adapts self-driving robots for Uber Eats Japan deliveries (Enterprise)
content: The robots are powered by AI that allows them to self-drive as well as be operated remotely.

title: Samsung Health builds health platform with Galaxy Ring, wearables (Enterprise)
content: The company is connecting different devices and partners within one platform, making it simpler to track health conditions on a Galaxy wearable, which provides a more holistic understanding of a person's health.

title: TriNet hosts pitch competition for entrepreneurs and innovators at SXSW (Business Service)
content: In addition to the TriNet PeopleForceX Pitch Competition where the winner will receive a credit of up to $5,000 toward TriNet PEO administrative services fee, the organization will host a panel on how AI is changing HR through automating benefits.

title: DeepLook Medical's DL Precise received clearance for use in the U.K. (Startup)
content: DL Precise, a visual enhancement software, unveils hidden data through its shape-recognition technique, presenting segmented and measured target masses with speed, accuracy and uniformity.

title: RAZ Mobility introduces benefit program featuring Prisidio as first offering (Startup)
content: RAZ Club's purpose is to introduce customers to AgeTech solutions that will make a positive difference in customers' lives, the first benefit is provided by digital valut company Prisidio.

title: CareYaya hosted digital literacy program at Azalea Estates Gracious Retirement Living (Startup)
content: UNC Chapel Hill students/CareYaya Ambassadors deliver the training sessions as part of its initiative to empower seniors with the knowledge and skills necessary to navigate the digital landscape.

title: Morehouse School of Medicine wins Cancer Grand Challenges award to tackle racial disparities (Testbed)
content: The $25-million grant funded by the National Cancer Institute and Cancer Research UK is a major achievement for the school which is the first historically Black medical school to receive one of these awards.

title: Goodwin Living featured in short documentary film showcased at D.C. International Film Forum (Testbed)
content: The Test captures Goodwin Living team member Eric Frimpong's journey to obtain his U.S. Citizenship and reunite with his wife and children in Ghana after eight years of separation, including his relationship with Goodwin House Alexandria residents Jill and Carl Miller, who tutored him in preparation for the citizenship exam.

title: NIA-funded study finds regular online conversations can help prevent cognitive decline in socially-isolated older adults (Investor)
content: Scientists at Oregon Health & Science University led the Internet-based Conversational Clinical Trial (I-CONECT), which linked socially-isolated older adults with trained conversationalists for regular, 30-minute video chats to stimulate brain function and cognition.

title: Elidah CEO discusses solutions for bladder leaks on Femtech World Podcast (Startup)
content: After eight years of research and development, Elitone became available as the first FDA-cleared external treatment to help women live leak-free.

title: Bold Journey magazine features RightHear CEO (Startup)
content: The magazine interviewed Idan Meir regarding his life journey, the skills he uses and challenges he has faced.

title: OATS featured in Nonprofit Quarterly story on digital literacy in seniors (Testbed)
content: A multiyear partnership between OATS and the Humana Foundation to develop evidence-based digital literacy training and support models for older adults has shown the impact these programs can have on better connection, health and wellbeing.

title: WRF Capital funds prize for Hollomon Health Innovation Challenge (Investor)
content: For its organ cryopreservation and rewarming innovation, BioLegacy took home $15,000 from WRF Capital.

title: Amicus Brain's digital advisor apps available anytime, anywhere, in almost any language (Startup)
content: The advisor app locates dementia resources and provides insights and recommendations while the Well-being Advisor app helps monitor and improve the caregiver's mental state and track cognitive changes in their loved one.

title: Givers blog explore challenges and solutions for rural caregivers (Startup)
content: It covers challenges, such as accessibility issues, financial strain and isolation, alongside practical solutions like telehealth, community support initiatives and educational programs designed to alleviate the burdens faced by rural caregivers.

title: Blue Heron Capital invests in Redi Health (Investor)
content: It led the $14M Series B funding round for the digital health company that aims to address the gap in patient support for those navigating complex, high-cost medications.

title: NIA names six winners of start-up challenge and accelerator (Investor)
CABHI showcases aging technology including ElliQ from Intuition Robotics (Enterprise)
content: The television segment covers some innovations designed to reduce the risk of dementia and improve the lives of older adult.

title: Defy Dementia global virtual summit from CABHI takes place March 26 (Enterprise)
content: The event will feature thought leaders in the field of aging and brain health with the goal of improving the quality of life for older adults.

title: Caring.com study finds the number of Americans with a will has decreased (Enterprise)
content: In 2024, only 32% of Americans have a will, the survey reports - a 6% decline from last year, even though 64% of Americans say having a will is very or somewhat important.

title: Evolving Homes to attend World Ageing Festival in Singapore (Business Services)
content: In a Facebook post, Evolving Homes shared that the festival will feature speakers, a startup pitch contest and an exhibition expo that will showcase aging innovations under the theme of “Redefining Care: Activating Communities of the Future."

title: Attn: Grace awarded Good Housekeeping's Most Sustainable Innovation Award for 2024 (Startup)
content: The panel of experts and judges evaluated products and services that embrace a "people, purpose and planet" approach to sustainability.

title: Lutheran Senior Services expands home and community based services (Testbed)
content: LSS acquired the New Horizons Program for All-Inclusive Care for the Elderly (PACE) from St. Louis-based senior living provider Christian Horizons.

title: Comcast Ventures, Acronym Venture Capital participate in funding round for HealthSnap (Investor)
content: The Miami-based Remote Patient Monitoring (RPM) and Chronic Care Management (CCM) solution for healthcare providers raised $25 million in Series B financing.

title: NIA-funded research finds AI predicts Alzheimer's risk seven years in advance
content: Researchers at the University of California, San Francisco reported their AI models predicted Alzheimer's up to seven years in advance with 72% accuracy.

title: The Michael J. Fox Foundation announces 123 grants totaling over $85.9M (Enterprise)
content: The supported projects aim to advance the understanding of Parkinson’s disease and improve diagnostic tools and treatments.

title: Verizon Business to showcase healthcare technology at ViVE 2024 (Enterprise)
content: The company will utilize a series of demos showing how 5G, dependable connection, collaboration tools and other features are facilitating the future of connected patient care.

title: The Gerontechnologist discusses the threat of deepfakes for older adults (Business Services)
content: Utilizing deepfake detection technology, startups can offer user-friendly solutions such as a smartphone app for monitoring phone calls or a plugin compatible with video chat apps like Zoom, FaceTime or WhatsApp.

title: Artifcts featured in TIME article on decluttering (Startup)
content: The app helps preserve memories through a combination of images, audio, video and text.

title: CareYaya shares how VR can improve the lives of dementia patients (Startup)
content: It says VR is a beneficial therapeutic treatment for dementia and can reduce agitation, stimulate the brain, enhance social connections and provide a sense of independence.

title: Right at Home to hire 26,000 caregivers in 2024 (Testbed)
content: The strategies for the hiring initiative align with the company's efforts around cultivating an appealing culture for caregivers, according to CEO Margaret Haynes.

title: Bryn Mawr Rehab Hospital recognized for patient care innovation (Testbed)
content: The organization competed against others of a similar size for the Optimal Operations Award during the Hospital and Healthsystem Association of Pennsylvania with 2024 Achievement Awards.

title: ThriveWell Tech CEO highlights increase in cyber threats during the COVID-19 pandemic (Testbed)
content: Nick Patel attributes the problem to the industry's rapid digitization necessitated by the pandemic.

title: Comcast Ventures, Acronym Venture Capital participate in funding round for HealthSnap (Investor)
content: The provider of remote patient monitoring and chronic care management solutions closed a $25M Series B funding round.

title: Atento Capital takes part in funding round for Fabric (Investor)
content: The developers of a care enablement system that automates clinical and administrative work, will use the funding to bolster its technology and team, accelerating the development of innovative solutions that serve patients across urgent, emergency, surgical and primary care.

title: Microsoft for Startups attending HIMSS 2024 (Enterprise)
content: It will introduce startups it says are transforming healthcare with innovative solutions.

title: HTD shares A deep dive into AgeTech with AI solutions (Business Services)
content: Erkin Ötleş, AI practice lead at HTD Health, sheds light on the intricacies of this groundbreaking intersection of technology and geriatric care.

title: Argentum’s Senior Living Executive Conference takes place April 29 to May 1 (Business Service)
content: The official meeting of Argentum offers a place to learn, connect and come together to improve the resident experience.

title: Elidah secures Series A funding (Startup)
content: Known for developing FDA-cleared non-invasive, wearable treatments for urinary incontinence in women, the funding is set to support the company's mission to expand its outreach and improve the distribution of Elitone and Elitone URGE.

title: Wave Therapeutics participates in NBA All-Star Pitch Competition (Startup)
content: CEO Jessica Bussert will be pitching along with six other amazing Indiana founders representing the future of tech and innovation.

title: LivNow Relocation partners with Artifcts (Startup)
content: The companies aim to ensure clients' belongings are curated and the memories, histories and stories are preserved, regardless of what they decide to keep, donate or sell.

title: Center funded by NIA and led by UIC focuses on equity in dementia care (Testbed)
content: The Center for Health Equity in Cognitive Aging, co-led by the College of Applied Health Sciences and the School of Public Health, will focus on care for people with dementia, as well as their providers while supporting the research of underrepresented faculty.

title: NIA-funded research develops epigenetic clock that accurately predicts biological age (Investor)
content: Brigham and Women's Hospital led the development of CausAge which identifies biomarkers causal to aging while evaluating the efficacy of anti-aging interventions.

title: Rendever Health receives a2 Pilot Award (Startup) (Testbed)
content: Their project involves a VR fitness platform designed to remotely assess cognitive and physical function in older adults.

title: Walk With Path receives a2 Pilot Award for project with Tufts University, Arizona State University (Startup)
content: Their project aims to enhance fall prediction and treatment using pressure sensing insoles.

title: Embodied Labs a sponsor at ViVE 2024 Los Angeles (Startup)
content: The company will be showcasing its immersive training solution.

title: Samsung's Galaxy Watch line receives FDA approval for sleep apnea detection (Enterprise)
content: The move is a big one for the smartwatch category, where health and fitness now comprise a majority of new features. For the last several years, the industry has focused on heart monitoring and blood oxygen detection as it’s looked for the next big thing.

title: Intuition Robotics included on Fierce Healthcare's 'Fierce 15 of 2024' list (Enterprise)
content: CEO Dor Skuler believes the compnay's robot companion named ElliQ offers a solution to the loneliness epidemic in older adults.

title: Argentum industry forecast predicts 2024 will bring “rich opportunities” and “daunting challenges” in senior living (Business Service)
content: Among the insights are an expectation the economy will cool, employment will improve, household income will increase, but so will inflation, senior living wages will continue to surge and the industry work week will return to normal.

title: DeepLook Medical raises $1.7M in funding (Startup)
content: DeepLook Medical developed the first AI technology platform designed specifically for the visualization of suspicious masses in dense breasts.

title: ByteDance offers employees VR therapy benefits via XRHealth (Startup)
content: The employees will have access to XRHealth's physical, occupational and behavioral therapies from home or at ByteDance clinics.

title: CardioSignal included in article on methods to monitor heart health (Startup)
content: It says the heart-health smartphone app, which can read cardiac conditions by laying the phone on one's chest could be available in the U.S. soon

title: Curql Collective forms fintech accelerator cohort (Investor)
content: The first Curql Accelerate cohort consists of five fintech companies: Casap, Peacefully, Privacy Lock, Ranqx, and Spiral.

title: Scrum Ventures takes part in funding round for Stellar Sleep (Investor)

content: Potential homebuyers earning 50% of area median income or less are eligible for a $2,500 credit that may help with down payment and other costs at closing.

title: Fintech Sandbox adds Morrison Foerster, MCS Group, Rise as sponsors (Business Service)
content: Sponsors unlock opportunities that bolster their business development initiatives, elevate brand visibility and enhance talent management, while gaining a front-row seat to the latest FinTech trends and insights.

title: Zoog helps grandparents create animated videos for grandkids (Startup)
content: The app offers a library of ready-to-record songs, stories and jokes enhanced with personalization and augmented reality features that were designed to enhance communication between grandparents and their grandchildren.

title: RightHear CEO talks about the company on the 'Internet of Senses Institute' podcast  (Startup)
content: CEO Idan Meir discusses the genesis of RightHear, its universal utility, the role of other senses and the global mission driving the company.

title: Right at Home CEO named Home Care Association of America Board President (Testbed)
content: CEO Margaret Haynes was chosen to serve as the 2024 president of the association that represents home care agencies across the country and advocates for services to help people live successfully wherever they call home.

title: Intuition Robotics brings generative AI capabilities to ElliQ 3 (Enterprise)
content: ElliQ 3.0 can fuse conversational context and memory, learning users' preferences to nurture its personalized relationship over time.

title: LeadingAge LTSS Center at UMass Boston and Community Catalyst to develop HCBS measures that reflect beneficiary preferences (Enterprise)
content: They hope the resulting report, Centering Perspectives of Dually Eligible Older Adults of Color, will inform local, state and national policies about priorities in Medicaid home- and community-based services for older adults.

title: Mary Furlong & Associates podcast features Lotus Laboratories (Business Service) (Startup)
content: Lotus CEO Dhaval Patel discusses the company's ring that allows users to control lights by pointing at them.

title: MindMics gets patent for cardiovascular monitoring through headphones (Startup)
content: The patent unveils an advanced cardiovascular monitoring system that incorporates acoustic sensors from noise-canceling earbuds; the system facilitates continuous, non-invasive monitoring of heart functions.

title: CardioSignal's technology uses smartphone to detect heart disease (Startup)
content: The technology offers a non-invasive, accurate one-minute measurement for detecting atrial fibrillation signs by placing a smartphone on the patient’s chest to gather data, and a clinically validated algorithm analyzes the data.

title: RightHear's podcast discusses the effect of accessibility, technology on inclusive world (Startup)
content: On The Two Blind Mice Show podcast, RightHear CEO Idan Meir discusses his vision for a more inclusive world through accessibility and technology.

title: Lutheran Senior Services recognized by National Affordable Housing Management Association (Testbed)
content: Through the Communities of Quality National Recognition, affordable multifamily rental properties can be certified based on six criteria: Physical Inspections, Employee Credentials, Financial Management, Programs and Services, Endorsements and Photographs and Reports.

title: OATS develops Best Day Ever research methodology (Testbed)
content:
The method has seniors describe what their best day ever would be to help the organization develop programs that reflect the needs and desires of older adults.
Related:
McKnight's Senior Living

title: Primetime Partners takes part in funding round for Isaac Health (Investor)
content: The digital health company, which provides virtual brain health and memory clinic services to improve access to brain health resources, secured a $5.7 million seed funding round.

title: Intuition Robotics ready for year of the robot, AI companions: Forbes (Enterprise)
content: It introduced ElliQ 3.0 at CES 2024 while in the AgeTech Collaborative booth - a lighter, smaller version that enhances ElliQ’s interactions by incorporating generative AI for more open-ended and natural conversations.

title: Twilio names honorees of 2024 AI Startup Searchlight Awards (Business Service)
content: The awards recognize startups creatively using Generative Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Twilio to enhance digital communications and experiences for their customers.

title: FallCall Solutions partners with Kwikset on Kwik-Unlock (Startup)
content: FallCall will automatically unlock the Kwikset Halo Lock when an ambulance is dispatched and once EMS leaves, the door will be locked again.

title: Together by Renee founder shares how AI can help patients, caregivers (Startups)
content:
Dr. Renee Dua says Together by Renee uses generative AI to manage various healthcare tasks such as measuring vital signs like blood pressure through simple actions such as taking a selfie or using voice recognition to detect early symptoms of depression and anxiety.
Related:
Fox 26 Houston

title: a2 Collective funds second cohort of pilots in AI, AgeTech innovation across the U.S. (Testbed, Investor)
content: Funded by the National Institute on Aging, the awards will distribute $40 million over five years to fund pilot projects developing technologies and algorithms with the potential to improve the lives of older adults.

title: Lutheran Senior Services CEO named to St. Louis Titan 100
content: Adam Marles was recognized as one of the region’s top 100 CEOs for the second year in a row.

title: United Church Homes podcast discusses LGBTQ+ Inclusivity in elder care
content: Rev. Beth Long-Higgins chats with SAGE USA CEO, Michael Adams.

title: Sundberg-Ferar shares the most captivating design, industry trends at CES 2024 (Business Service)
content: CES 2024: The Design Scoop shares the most fascinating design and industry trends from CES 2024 with a focus on AARP's AgeTech Collaborative booth.

title: CardioSignal closes $10M in Series A funding (Startup)
content: CardioSignal develops digital technologies and software-as-medical-devices to provide early detection of heart diseases and provides the only technology to detect several major heart diseases with high accuracy using just one clinical modality without any specialized medical equipment.

title: Xandar Kardian and Ceragem partner to enhance business operations (Startup)
content: The partnership will seek to optimize cross-channel exposure for both companies across each business' core audience, expand into a broad range of new markets and conduct joint R&D for the creation of collaborative products that leverage the innovative technologies of both parties.

title: Lotus Ring named finalist in the Smart Cities, Transportation & Sustainability category for SXSW Pitch (Startup)
content: Out of 670 companies, Lotus was selected as one of 45 finalists across nine different categories.

title: CareYaya provides AI Art Therapy program (Startup)
content: The goal is to help those with dementia and memory loss issues create personalized art projects, said CEO Neal Shah.

title: Proto Hologram demonstrates tabletop display (Startup)
content: The Proto-M display stands 29” tall and can be used via touchscreen and gesture control.

title: Intuition Robotics, De Oro Devices, Xander Kardian featured on list of innovations for seniors (Startup)
content: The XK300 sensor, ElliQ and NexStride are included on the list.

title: Samsung aims to develop blood sugar monitor that doesn't break skin (Enterprise)
content: The health push also includes the Galaxy Ring and future earbuds.

title: Discover Live to take part in Brain Week 2024 (Enterprise)
content: It will lead the session on 'A Virtual Voyage for Brain Wellness.'

title: CABHI to host Summit 2024: Defy Dementia (Enterprise)
content: It will be a virtual, one-day event on March 26.

title: Senior living must foster inclusive environments, Senior Living DEIB Coalition finds (Business Service)
content: A significant number of senior living companies have implemented diversity, equity, inclusion and belonging programs in the past year, indicating that more owners and operators are "leaning in" to those initiatives to meet strategic goals, according to a survey conducted by Ferguson Partners and sponsored by the Senior Living DEIB Coalition, a partnership among Argentum, the American Seniors Housing Association and the National Investment Center for Seniors Housing & Care.

title: Last Gameboard featured in CES roundup from AdWeek (Startup)
content: This 22-inch touchscreen device brings together the physical and digital worlds, featuring a high-resolution SenseScreen display that’s compatible with both digital and physical game pieces.

title: Hearing Tracker includes Concha Labs, Xander, MindMics, Tuned on list of most exciting hearing-related tech at CES (Startup)
content:
Over the past three years, over-the-counter aids, captioning glasses and innovations in hearables, processing strategies, sensors for health and fitness monitoring and components have taken the stage of the CES show floor.
Related:
MedTech Insight

title: SingFit expands into the U.K. market (Startup)
content: The company credits Nexus Leeds and Health Innovation Yorkshire & Humber for guiding them on "how the #NHS works and, more importantly, how it doesn't work," says CEO Rachel Francine.

title: Trust & Will makes several executive team hires (Startup)
content: These hires include Dale Sperling as Chief Marketing Officer, Doug Luftman as Chief Legal Officer, Stephany Bader as VP of Product, Michael Jones as VP of Engineering and David Weisman as VP of Sales & Partnerships.

title: Argentum Leadership Advancement & Development Program announces cohort for 2024 spring class (Business Service)
content: The cohort of 10 senior living professionals at the regional or corporate level is nominated by senior living executives and given opportunities for development in support of their career goals.

title: Irrational Labs increased prescription drug information recall by 17% (Business Service)
content: It found the ‘kitchen sink’ strategy, which included elements of other tested strategies such as adding 'gist' summaries, reformatting labels and leaflets to make them more patient-friendly and including a 'commitment card,' worked best.

title: XRHealth helps patients with brain injuries recover (Startup)
content: The Sheba Medical Center Rehabilitation Hospital in Israel is using the immersive approach to help patients recover from brain injuries.

title: DeepLook Medical highlighted by FemTech World (Startup)
content: The AI tool could offer hope for millions of women whose dense breast tissue masks cancer on mammograms.

title: MedTech's CES roundup includes Proto Hologram, Intuition Robotics (Startup)
content: This second roundup from CES shines the light on Proto Hologram’s many use cases in healthcare and the ElliQ robot helping the elderly feel less lonely.

title: Lighthouse Guild receives John and Jane Shalam Award for its efforts in combating social isolation (Testbed)

title: Right at Home featured in article on companies assisting seniors remain in their homes in Richmond, VA (Testbed)
content: The company is looking to expand to the northern, western and eastern parts of the area, with each territory having more than 35,000 seniors.

title: Samsung unveils The Galaxy Ring (Enterprise)
content: It is one part of the company's goal to create a network of devices that can feed information into the Samsung Health app.

title: Older seniors living with AI with Intuition Robotics' ElliQ (Enterprise)
content: CEO Even Dor Skuler says he is surprised by how easily older seniors have integrated the robot into their lives.

title: UKNICA is a scientific partner in the AC75 Startup Accelerator (Enterprise)
content: Next Age is the first acceleration program in Europe that is specifically investing in Silver Economy startups.

title: ECHAlliance takes part in xShare project (Enterprise)
content: The project is a three-year Horizon Europe project envisioning everyone sharing their health data in EEHRxF with a click-of-a-button, the "yellow button".

title: Mary Furlong and Associates podcast discusses what’s next in living longer, better, smarter from CES (Business Service)
content: Recorded live at the AgeTech Collaborative from AARP studio, the guests are Heather Nickerson, CEO of Artifcts and Andy Tubman, co-founder of SingFit.

title: RAZ Mobility, Voiceitt partner on phone to allow people with impaired speech to be understood during video calls (Startup)
content: Rather than typing responses or tapping symbols to communicate over the phone, individuals with non-standard speech will be able to use their own voice, relying on the speech recognition technology to translate their non-standard speech into speech that can be understood.

title: Carallel, myFloc partner to make financial management easier for caregivers (Startup)
content: Caregivers on the Carallel platform can access myFloc to help ease the financial burdens out of caregiving for family, friends and other non-kin caregivers.

title: Trust & Will signed earned equity investment deal with Comcast's venture arm (Startup) (Investor)
content: Under today's agreement, Trust & Will will benefit from non-monetary resources from Forecast Labs which will promote Trust & Will nationally via TV advertisements to gain brand awareness in markets where consumers may be less likely to have a will.

title: XRHealth raised $6M in funding (Startup)
content: XRHealth's platform allows patients with stress and anxiety, chronic pain, fibromyalgia and neurological conditions to connect with a provider via telehealth and receive recommended therapies on a virtual reality headset that's sent to the patient's home.

title: Lisa Cini highlights AgeTech at 2024 CES including Proto, Xandar Kardian, Zibrio, NexStride (Startup)
content:
The CEO of Mosaic Design Studio and author of several books on aging says these technological advancements, ranging from the Proto's holographic communications to the NexStride's mobility enhancement, are life-changing tools, set to revolutionize the concept of aging in place.
Related:
Medriva
UPI
OATS Facebook
Prisidio Facebook
RAZ Mobility Facebook
care.coach
Concha Labs

title: Second Century Ventures provides $1M in equity financing to Downpayments (Investor)
content: The real estate FinTech startup, is emerging from stealth with the mission of helping investors purchase properties with interest-free down payments.

title: CVS Health Ventures participates in funding round for Vita Health (Investor)
content: The provider of clinically validated suicide prevention through care management closed a $22.5M Series A funding round to support the expansion of life-saving services targeting youth and adults nationwide.

title: NIA-funded research finds videos help communicate care goals for hospitalized older adults (Investor)
content: The study expanded testing of a library of short, evidence-based, plain-language videos to help hospital patients better understand the different care options in cases of serious illness and more clearly communicate their goals of care to physicians and family members.

title: Intuition Robotics unveils new version of ElliQ robot companion (Enterprise)
content:
ElliQ 3 contains enhanced hardware that embeds a large language model, making ElliQ 3 better at mimicking human conversation across any topic.
Related:
McKnight's Senior Living
NoCamels

title: Verizon, Samsung, AT&T partner with Elevance Health on smartphones for Medicaid enrollees (Enterprise)
content: With funding from the FCC's Affordable Connectivity Program, the devices will provide unlimited data, talk and texting service at no cost to eligible individuals enrolled in some of its affiliated Medicaid health plans and give individuals access to digital and virtual healthcare tools.

title: Asha AI CEO takes part in Women Inspiring Network panel (Startup)
content: Rashmi Joshi will speak at Davos on the panel titled Women & AI - Two Powerful Forces Changing the World.

title: RAZ Care app aims to simplify routines for people with Alzheimer's, dementia (Startup)
content: Through the management of their RAZ Memory Cell Phone, the app manages complex care routines and medication schedules as well as enabling the person to stay connected and reduce loneliness.

title: CVS Health Ventures invests in WellBe Senior Medical (Investor)
content: WellBe is an in-home value-based care provider to the Medicare Advantage population, the investment will help accelerate its national expansion.

title: SpringTime Ventures takes part in funding round for Credo Health (Investor)
content: The company, which combines digital and manual medical record retrieval, secured $5.25 million in funding.

title: RAZ Mobility updates RAZ Memory Cell Phone (Startup)
content: The updates include missed call notifications, a call confirmation screen and providing a caregiver with the ability to see if the phone is currently being charged.

title: Vivalon Healthy Aging Campus opened on Jan. 2 (Testbed)
content: The campus includes a medical clinic combining traditional medical services with coordinated care, as well as social engagement, learning opportunities, nutrition services, a café and activities and programs designed to promote healthy aging. Additionally, it includes 66 units of 100% affordable homes for older adults in partnership with Eden Housing.

title: Caavo helps seniors continue to enjoy television (Enterprise)
content: The Jubilee TV app allows people to operate a senior's television remotely.

title: Mary Furlong and Associates podcast discusses CES 2024 (Business Service)
content:
Sasha Spellman from the AARP AgeTech Collaborative and Steve Ewell from the Consumer Technology Association Foundation discuss AI, robotics and other AgeTech innovations that will appear at CES 2024.
Related:
AARP Blog

title: CareYaya Health Technologies' online marketplace matches college students with elderly clients (Startup)
content: CareYaya has partnered with healthcare institutions, attracted backing from investors and fostered relationships with policymakers while expanding nationwide.

title: Tuned, JVCKenwood develop self-fitting hearing aids (Startup)
content: Using the Tuned app, guided by an AI Hearing Assistant, users complete an in-app hearing evaluation, and the app tailors the hearing aids to their specific needs.

title: WheelPad chosen as awardee for VCRD Climate Catalyst Innovation Fund (Startup)
content: The award will be used to help fund a product called BathPad, which will allow homes to add an accessible bathroom without the need for a full renovation.

title: Intuition Robotics' talking robot ElliQ a hit with seniors (Enterprises)
content: The tabletop device was created to help seniors living alone alleviate loneliness, and data from the New York State Office for the Aging, which has given the device to hundreds of seniors, indicates it reduces loneliness by 95%.

title: Proto Hologram allows guests to interact with virtual concierge at Hotel X Toronto (Startup)
content: The holographic platform acts as if they were in the lobby having a two-way conversation with a real person, providing relevant, interactive content and communications to enhance a visitor's stay.

title: Deeplook Medical aims to improve cancer screenings, starting with mammograms (Startup)
content: This startup developed DL Precise, an FDA-cleared tool that can take existing regions of interest - like a developing cancerous lesion - and segment and measure those regions as well as colorize them based on density allowing cancerous masses to show up as a different color on the image.

title: Humana Foundation CEO Tiffany Benjamin cites OATS in the Philanthropy News Digest (Testbed)
content: The foundation has supported OATS work in digital equity for many years, helping to raise awareness of low-cost internet options and technology training for older adults.

title: Samsung Health adds medication tracking feature to app (Enterprise)
content: Users will be able to use the new feature to track both prescription and OTC medications while receiving information and tips about the medications.

title: Candoo Tech, CareFirst BlueCross BlueShield partner on digital literacy pilot (Startup)
content: CareFirst's BlueCross BlueShield Advantage DualPrime members in the Baltimore area will have access to a U.S.-based tech concierge to receive help with everything from learning how to use a smartphone to installing a new app.

title: Elidah rebrands ELITONE (Startup)
content: The brand has been reimagined to embody empathy, innovation, trust, and freedom.

title: OATS VP of Program Operations discusses helping older adults thrive in digital age (Testbed)
content: Alex Glazebrook joins Comcast Newsmakers to discuss how OATS helps older adults learn skills that can be applied to accomplish goals and address needs, and the expansion of innovation in Senior Planet programs.

title: Applications open for CABHI's Mentorship, Capital, Continuation Program - Capital (Enterprise)
content: Organizations can apply to receive up to $500,000 CAD in investment and acceleration services from CABHI to validate or grow their business.

title: MiiCare receives patent for tool that uses the sound of footsteps to analyze gait patterns linked to fall risks, dementia (Startup)
content: The company's home hub uses a Large Language Model (LLM) powered virtual companion named Monica, which includes a network of wireless infra-red sensors and smart wearables to analyze behavior and health indicators.

title: MindMics earbud technology shows promise in detection of aortic stenosis, heart murmurs (Startup)
content: The results of a clinical study indicate that its non-invasive infrasonic hemodynography (IH) technology can detect aortic stenosis by capturing in-ear acoustic vibrations throughout the cardiac cycles.

title: CareYaya named finalist in a2 Pilot Awards (Startup)
content: The YayaGuide, an AI-enabled app that provides training for caregivers of people with Alzheimer's and related dementia, was chosen as a finalist for the awards, which are hosted by  Johns Hopkins University's Artificial Intelligence and Technology Collaboratory (AITC) for Aging Research.

title: Xandar Kardian recognized by Fast Company's 'Next Big Thing In Tech' List, 2024 CES Innovation Awards (Startup)
content: The XK300-H home health monitor was selected by Fast Company in the North America category. At the 2024 CES Innovation Awards, the company received honors in the Digital Health category for the XK300-H, XK-Slim Sensor and the XK-FD (Fall Detection Sensor).

title: Lutheran Senior Services to acquire St. Louis Home Health (Testbed)
content: The nonprofit housing, care, and support provider for older adults in MI and IL agreed to acquire the privately held home health agency specializing in orthopedics.

title: Right at Home franchises recognized with Caring.com's "Caring Star 2024" award (Testbeds)
content: The company was recognized for having the highest number of local franchise offices to receive "Caring Stars" awards based on reviews and ratings from clients and their families, making it first in the nation for the sixth consecutive year.

title: OATS Senior Planet Center in Miami could be model for training, hub for tech-savvy seniors (Testbed)
content: The hub will provide free Wi-Fi and have dozens of screens and computers for residents to use; multilingual classes will begin at the center in Jan.

title: NIA-funded research finds AI model could revolutionize screening for atrial fibrillation (Investor)
content: Scripps Research scientists developed an AI model aimed at enhancing clinicians' ability to screen patients for the condition characterized by an irregular, rapid heartbeat linked to stroke and heart failure.

title: Holland Home shares positive impact of resident engagement platform Welbi (Testbed)
content: About the partnership that began in early 2022, Holland Home says the benefits of using the platform include resident preference analysis, programming planning and measurable engagement.

title: Ziegler advises Opal Senior Living on financing for acquisition of St. Elizabeth Manor (Investor)
content: Ziegler provided structuring advice and loan placement services for acquiring the 72-unit assisted living and memory care community in WI.

title: Strategic Science Fund renews funding for CABHI's efforts to improve the lives of older Canadians (Enterprise)
content: Recipients of the SSF were selected for their goals to put research and knowledge into action, to grow the economy while improving the quality of life of Canadians.

title: CareYaya accepted into Harvard Innovation Labs (Startup)
content: Inclusion in the accelerator will help with the development of TapestryAI, an AI-powered platform set to transform legacy preservation and reminiscence therapy for elderly populations.

title: Livindi named 'Most Comprehensive' home monitoring systems for older adults (Startup)
content: It says the system works well for people who want to participate in their own health monitoring, as some of the devices, like the weight scale and blood pressure monitor, require users to take daily measurements.

title: Jumpstart Foundry unveils latest portfolio additions (Investor)
content: The JSF Fall 2023 Cohort comprises eight companies dedicated to enhancing various facets of the healthcare sector, such as home health, healthcare AI and digital tools.

title: Second Century Ventures opens applications for 2024 REACH U.S. Program (Investor)
content: The U.S. REACH program focuses on solutions supporting the residential real estate sector, including innovations from adjacent industries such as banking, finance, home services, title, mortgage and insurance.

title: Scrum Ventures, Hakuhodo launch AgeTechX (Investor)
content: It's a visionary open innovation program dedicated to helping scale and grow startups working to revolutionize the field of aging-related technology and services by collaborating with Japanese corporations.

title: Walgreens launches tool for prescription drug discounts (Enterprise)
content: The Rx Savings Finder is a digital marketplace designed to find free, third-party discount cards on prescription medications and enable customers to compare prices on many medications.

title: CABHI supports 22 organizations adopting innovation to enhance the lives of older Canadians (Enterprise)
content: CABHI's Discover and Adopt program provides funding and trains long-term care, retirement and home healthcare organizations to introduce, implement and sustain innovations that address their pain points.

title: InsideTracker's Epigenetic Age Acceleration score can reveal how genetic predispositions show up in health (Enterprise)
content: Users can determine the risk of their body aging faster than their chronological age.

title: VA collaborates with Wareologie to provide portable parallel bars to veterans (Startup)
content: The goal of the collaboration is to co-design, develop and test the prototype with VA clinical subject matter experts.

title: Vt. Rep. Becca Balint visits WheelPad facility (Startup)
content: During the visit, staff showed the progress towards a local manufacturing facility, their successes with WheelPad users across the country, and what they have in store for the future, including a local labor program.

title: Embr Labs included in FemTech section of tech predictions for 2024 (Startup)
content: The start-up is among companies showing the potential of leveraging data and predictive analytics to provide individualized care and meet patients where they're comfortable.

title: Labrador Systems, iRobot CTO discuss creating domestic robots (Startup)
content: CEO Mike Dooley and Chris Jones, CTO of iRobot, share the challenges of bringing robots from the laboratory to the unpredictable environments of people's homes and ensuring manufacturers meet actual user needs.

title: Attn: Grace shares potentially harmful ingredients it refuses to use in it products (Startup)
content: Phthalates are included on the list of "Never-Evers" - ingredients commonly used in incontinence, feminine hygiene, and other personal care products that are associated with significant health risks for women, which the startup is committed to keeping out of its products.

title: Adaptive Equipment & Caregiving Corner review Springrose adaptive bra (Startups)
content: The review includes techniques for putting the bra on and off.

title: Casana looking for innovative partners for pilot study (Startups)
content: The study will explore the use of Casana's smart toilet seat in senior living communities.

title: COO Steven Lee of ianacare spoke on a panel at the Gerontological Society of America conference (Startups)
content: Topics covered at the conference included opportunities and drawbacks of utilizing AI in tackling social determinants of health.

title: Trust & Will partners with USAA (Startups)
content: USAA is a leading financial services brand for members of the military and their families.

title: CABHI partners with Velocity on AgeTech Innovation Challenge (Enterprises)
content: During a 10-day event, with Velocity’s AgeTech Innovation Challenge and CABHI, 70 students split into 16 teams displayed their solutions for the aging populations showcasing ways to enhance older adult's health and wellness, empowering caregivers, and improving the healthcare system.

title: Proto display appears on episode of the Kardashians (Startup)
content: When Kris Jenner appeared on the holographic display it was the first appearance of the technology on an unscripted television show.

title: Embr Labs, JoyLux featured on sheknows (Startup)
content: The startups appear on the list of "some of the most innovative new tech devices" to help treat menopause symptoms.

title: WDIO features Ōmcare Home Health Hub (Startup)
content: ABC station says the telehealth solution is aimed at helping people live independently for longer.

title: Trust & Will featured in story on will planning (Startup)
content: The WKMG report says the startup is considered one of the top 10 online will services of 2023, according to Caring.com.

title: MiiCare introduced to support older adults (Startup)
content: CEO Kelvin Summoogum explains how, using an AI-based voice assistant, the home hub collects data and can analyze the sounds of footsteps or voice to detect frailty, risk of falling or lung diseases.

title: Goodwin Living Health Care Centers named to U.S. News & World Report Best Nursing Homes list (Testbed)
content: Goodwin House Bailey's Crossroads and Goodwin House Alexandria each received the highest ratings in both short-term and long-term care on the 2023-24 Best Nursing Homes list.

title: OATS to open new Senior Planet center (Testbed)
content: The center is set to open in Miami, December 4.

title: ElliQ featured in list of innovative tech for seniors (Enterprise)
content: It says the AI companion is redefining companionship for seniors.

title: VoltSafe named one of Canada's Most Investable Cleantech Ventures (Startup)
content: As a Foresight 50 Honoree, VoltSafe will be showcased over the next 12 months, opening doors to corporations, government and investors.

title: Center for Elders' Independence co-hosts 2023 Senior Health Policy Forum (Testbed)
content: The one-day biennial conference brings together advocates, policymakers, care providers and leaders in aging and healthcare.

title: LeadingAge names Roger Myers, Melanie Johnson as 2023 award winners (Enterprise)
content: Myers, president and CEO of Presbyterian Villages of Michigan, is the 2023 Award of Honor winner, and Johnson, Director of Nursing at Carol Woods Retirement Community, is the 17th Annual Joan Anne McHugh Award for Leadership in Long-Term Services and Supports Nursing winner.

title: The SCAN Foundation CEO says policymakers can improve behavioral health conditions (Enterprise)
content: Twenty million older adults suffer from behavioral health conditions like depression and anxiety.

title: XRHealth VR headset sent to International Space Station (Startup)
content: The headset will be used to treat astronauts for mental health conditions

title: Trust & Will named to 2023 Deloitte Technology Fast 500 List (Startup)
content: The list provides a ranking of the fastest-growing technology, media, telecommunications, life sciences, FinTech and energy tech companies in North America.

title: 'Together by Renee' uses AI to assist doctors (Startup)
content: The app uses AI to detect signs of anxiety or depression by analyzing the user's face.

title: Goodwin Living Medical Director explains home hospice care (Testbed)
content: On WUSA-TV, Dr. Margaret Gloria discussed the hospice care options and benefits available to people in their homes in recognition of National Hospice and Palliative Care Month.

title: OATS expands into Miami, Fla. (Testbed)
content:
Executive Director Tom Kamber discusses the history of OATS and its expansion on What's Next...Living Longer Better Smarter! with Mary Furlong and Associates and Fred Fishkin.
Related:
KOAA News5

title: Archetype leads $25M funding round for decentralized AI platform (Investor)
content: Ritual aims to create an "incentivized network" that will pave the way for distributed computing devices to power different aspects of AI.

title: QED Investors leads funding round for Real Estate startup Summer (Investor)
content: The PropTech startup, which seeks to streamline second home ownership, completed a $68 million fundraise, including an $18 million Series A funding round and a secured debt facility of up to $50 million.

title: Salveo Innovations named semi-finalist in HITLAB Breakthrough Alliance Challenge (Startup)
content: The startup aims to spark change in digital health delivery.

title: Healthworx explains how Mighty Health, Tembo Health help seniors age at home (Startup) (Enterprise)
content: Both startups use technology to help seniors remain independent; they have different methods but approach the work with similar philosophies.

title: UCF researcher receives grant to develop speech therapies for stroke survivors (Testbed)
content: Lauren Bislick, a College of Health Professions and Sciences researcher, is exploring alternative, cost-effective practice opportunities to help people with post-stroke AOS continue speech rehabilitation beyond clinical settings.

title: Hosted by a2 Collective, funded by NIA, a2 Pilot Award applications open March 1 (Testbed) (Investor)
content: Through the Artificial Intelligence and Technology Collaboratories for Aging Research program, NIA earmarked $40 million to fund demonstration projects using AI and technology to improve care and health outcomes for older Americans.

title: NIA funds National Dementia Workforce Study (Investor)
content: The University of Michigan is leading the study and the information collected will create a large data research infrastructure to assist efforts to improve dementia care.

title: SingFit partners with Longevity Health (Startup)
content: Longevity Health is an Institutional Special Needs Plan (ISNP) that serves people living in skilled nursing facilities.

title: ​Lotus Labs appears on The Pitch (Startup)
content: A reel features the CEO discussing his journey from crutches to creating the patented ring that turns any home into a Smart Home without requiring an app.

title: QED named to Inc.'s 2023 list of founder-friendly investors (Investor)
content: The list recognizes firms that remain actively involved with the businesses in which they invest and that have earned the trust of the entrepreneurs they support to help drive growth.

title: WRF Capital takes part in funding round for AdaptX (Investor)
content: The Seattle tech company uses AI to help healthcare providers analyze medical data to improve patient care.

title: Ziegler closes financing for Shenandoah Valley Westminster-Canterbury (Investor)
content: The $52,500,000 Series 2023A and 2023B Bonds will be used to complete an independent living villa apartment expansion project with an additional 49 independent living villa apartments.

title: Beyond the Billion launches in Australia (Investor)
content: The oversubscribed launch was hosted by Goldman Sachs in Sydney with the collaboration of Dell Women’s Entrepreneur Network and brought out some of Australia's leaders in both venture capital and entrepreneurship.

title: EyeClick hosts booth at 2023 LeadingAge Annual Meeting (Enterprise)
content: It will showcase how Obie for Seniors' interactive games and immersive experiences can bring meaningful engagement and boost cognitive stimulation for senior care home residents.

title: Goodwin Living named Partner of the Year by Encore Creativity for Older Adults (Testbed)
content: For Encore, the nation’s largest choral arts organization for adults ages 55 and over, the award recognizes the joint creation and launch of a program geared toward those with moderate to late-stage dementia.

title: NIA-funded study to examine how virtual care can improve care coordination after ICU discharge (Investor)
content: Vanderbilt University researchers are using the $3.6-million federal grant to study how hospitals can coordinate care after ICU discharge with primary care physicians to reduce post-intensive care syndrome and boost care management.

title: LeadingAge California's CNA training program halfway to goal after one year (Enterprise)
content: Launched in Oct. 2022, the statewide Gateway-In Project has graduated more than 1,200 CNAs and has a goal of developing a total of 2,700 CNAs by 2026.

title: UIC College of Applied Health Sciences researchers receive grant to develop resources, services for Asian American elderly (Testbed)
content: Funded by a three-year, $620,000 grant from the Administration for Community Living in the Department of Health and Human Services, ASIAAN (Aging Services Inclusive of Asian American Networks) is a technical assistance and resource development center for caregivers, service organizations and community groups.

title: Right at Home ranked 100th in the Franchise Times' Top 400 List (Testbed)
content: The ranking is based on Right at Home's global system sales, recognizing the brand’s growth.

title: NIA-funded study suggests assessing frailty in older adults should be done on a continuum (Investor)
content: The results, from a team led by a University of Pittsburgh School of Public Health epidemiologist, can guide clinicians in evaluating older adults by using tests of endurance, strength and speed to better monitor their patients' health or assess their need for medical care or ability to recover from surgery.

title: Accenture to acquire healthcare marketing agency ConcentricLife (Enterprise)
content: The full-service digital healthcare marketing and communications agency aims to help brands answer rising consumer demands in rare diseases, health and wellness.

title: LeadingAge Maryland awarded nearly $300K to improve well-being of older residents (Enterprise)
content: It will use the funds to implement a two-year project that will provide training and resources to frontline staff at 16 affordable senior housing communities in Baltimore city, Baltimore County and Harford County.

title: Vi Senior Living collaborates with Rendever to evaluate the firm's VR platform on social health of residents (Startup)
content:
In the eight-week experiment:

	
100% of residents significantly improved their overall social network score;
83% significantly increased the size of their social networks and attended more social events; and
67% significantly improved their depression index scores and showed significant improvements in the quality of life and thriving indices.

title: At HLTH 2023 11TEN Innovation Partners aimed to connect with people, organizations to advance ideas, projects, realizing innovation (Testbed)
content: Throughout sessions, meetings and ad-hoc conversations, the company said it was clear that a wave of unparalleled innovation is sweeping healthcare, emphasizing the urgency for ecosystem collaboration, strategic convergence, and technological integration.

title: SCOR, Microsoft collaborative hackathon focuses on using generative AI in (re)insurance (Investor)
content: The hackathon featured eight multidisciplinary teams working over three days to leverage Microsoft expertise in applying generative AI tools to solve real challenges faced by the insurance industry.

title: Freddie Mac expands educational tools to improves consumer financial empowerment (Enterprise)
content: The expansion of CreditSmart into English and Spanish will help more individuals establish their credit, build generational wealth and access housing opportunities.

title: Samsung conducted 2023 Global Sleep Health Insights, the world's biggest sleep study (Enterprise)
content: Because of the scale of the study, which examined 716 million nights of sleep from June 2021 to May 2023, Samsung was able to delve deeper into demographics than other studies, noting age and gender differences as well as geographical ones. It found people in their 50s and 60s sleep more sporadically.

title: MindMics to participate in HeartX digital health accelerator (Startup)
content: Powered by HealthTech Arkansas and MedAxiom, along with eleven cardiology practices, HeartX is a healthcare accelerator that facilitates guaranteed hospital pilot projects and clinical trials for early-stage companies bringing cardiovascular innovations to market.

title: CardioSignal, Mehiläinen's population health program for earlier detection of atrial fibrillation extended (Startup)
content: The startup and provider of social and healthcare services in the Nordics, will continue with the population health model for another 10,000 individuals, with the goal of further researching how early intervention and digital health engagement affect seeking care for heart rhythm disorders.

title: Lighthouse Guild receives $10K grant for innovative Tech Pals program (Testbed)
content: The intergenerational technology training program has tech-savvy, blind or visually-impaired young adults mentor visually-impaired older adults (aged 55+) who want to become proficient in the use of their mobile phones and tablets.

title: CVS Health Ventures takes part in funding round for Medicaid provider enablement company (Investor)
content: Waymark raised $42 million in new financing to scale technology-enabled, community-based care for primary care providers and their patients enrolled in Medicaid programs.

title: Accenture, Partnership Fund for New York City open applications for 2024 FinTech Innovation Lab New York (Enterprise)
content: The 12-week program helps early- and growth-stage FinTech companies accelerate product and business development through collaboration with top financial services and venture capital firms.

title: Comcast NBCUniversal LIFT Labs launches Enterprise AI Accelerator (Enterprise)
content: The accelerator welcomes startups at various stages in their entrepreneurial journeys. The 10 selected startups will spend six weeks working alongside leaders from Comcast to explore advancements in AI for large-scale businesses.

title: NBA Star Lamar Odom assumes role as chief creative officer at Znest.com (Startup)
content: The SaaS platform joins forces with the two-time NBA champion and former reality TV star to elevate the senior living search experience for families and operators.

title: Penny Finance partners with Marble to offer free guide for empty nesters (Startup)
content: The guide offers suggestions on steps empty nesters can take to put their best financial foot forward in this next phase of life.

title: XRHealth donates VR headsets to hospitals (Startup)
content: The headbands, installed with PTSD, stress and anxiety relief software, will be given to medical centers across Israel.

title: Proto deploys hologram truck at South Korean film festival (Startup)
content: The vehicle, constructed by Proto Korea and Creative Mut, incorporated two hologram devices that depicted the stars of a new TV series.

title: 11TEN Innovation Lab aims to accelerate the future of healthcare (Testbed)
content: The lab is a collaborative space where partners and the broader healthcare community can come together to ideate, design, develop, and showcase the next generation of healthcare solutions.

title: Argentum hosts Senior Living Leadership Summit (Business Service)
content: The event speakers include industry leaders on future technology and data, value-based care, dynamic partnerships and workforce evolution.

title: Matt Hermann joins Zemplee's advisory board (Startup)
content: With nearly three decades in finance, venture capital and healthcare, Hermann will collaborate with Zemplee's executive team to provide strategic guidance and insights aimed at furthering Zemplee's goal of providing leading-edge solutions to senior health, wellbeing and safety.

title: Right at Home's SVP of strategic operations named 2023 Future Leader by Home Health Care News (TestBed)
content: Emily Undajon was recognized under the program, which is designed to recognize up-and-coming industry members who are shaping the next decade of home health, hospice care, senior housing, skilled nursing and behavioral health.

title: Montage Ventures takes part in $16.5M for Carefull (Investor)
content: The startup is a fintech platform that aims to help banks protect older customers from fraud, scams and "money mistakes."

title: ElliQ makes shortlist for Dezeen Awards (Enterprise)
content: The project, a collaboration between Fuseproject and Intuition Robotics, has been shortlisted in the product design (health and wellbeing) category.

title: Crayon expands partnership with Google Cloud (Business Service)
content: It aims to deepen its expertise on Google Cloud generative AI through Crayon's Centers of Excellence in Europe, Asia Pacific, and the Middle East and Africa region.

title: Trust & Will achieves B Corporation certification (Startup)
content: Based on the B Impact Assessment, the startup earned an overall score of 97.7, outperforming the required score of 80.

title: Lotus Labs participates in startup competition at TechCrunch Disrupt 2023 (Startup)
content: Being selected for Startup Battlefield200 meant it could share its technology and mission with attendees.

title: OATS Regional Program Manager recognized by Colorado Department of Labor and Employment  (Testbed)
content: Dayton Romero was recognized as a Digital Inclusion Champion who has made an impact in his community through dedication to digital equity work.

title: WheelPad Accessible Modular Home to be displayed at HUD's Innovative Housing Showcase (Startup)
content: The SuitePAD home attachment module demonstrates its inclusive, universally accessible housing design.

title: RightHear featured on App of the Day (Startup)
content: CEO Idan Meir discusses creating the app which aims to turn public spaces into inclusive environments for those with spatial orientation challenges, particularly individuals who are blind or visually impaired.

title: Angel Capital Association received $123K from the National Science Foundation's Directorate for Technology, Innovation and Partnerships (Enterprise)
content: This project is designed to better educate the early stage investor community on the benefits of Deep Tech investments with the intention of increasing the amount of private capital available for deployment in the Deep Tech sector.

title: Argentum, LeadingAge join coalition to support federal bill requiring use of Alzheimer's detection tools (Enterprise) (Business Service)
content: The Concentrating on High-Value Alzheimer’s Needs to Get to an End Act would direct CMS to require the use of cognitive impairment detection tools approved by the National Institute on Aging during initial "Welcome to Medicare" exams and Medicare annual wellness visits.

title: Homecare Hub raises $2.5M in funding (Startup) (Enterprise)
content: The funders included the Center for Aging + Brain Health Innovation and AARP.

title: Zinnia TV partners with Relish (Startup)
content: People in the U.S. who subscribe to the Relish newsletter will receive a 30% off code.

title: ThriveWell Tech appoints Mark Lacerra as virtual chief information officer (Testbed)
content: CEO Nick Patel said Lacerra will strategize, implement and manage technology solutions tailored to the needs of senior living organizations.

title: NIA-funded study finds hearing aids reduce cognitive decline for people at risk of dementia (Investor)
content: The study found, for those at high risk of dementia, wearing hearing aids had an almost 50% reduction in cognitive decline compared to another group.

title: N.Y.'s Office for the Aging says ElliQ pilot has been effective (Enterprise)
content: Acting Director Greg Olsen says, on average, program participants have 33.6 separate interactions with ElliQ per day, and 95% of the robot's users report a reduction in loneliness and an overall improvement in health.

title: National Innovation Centre for Ageing discusses plan to promote healthy longevity in urban environment (Enterprise)
content: The City of Longevity Global Conference brought together city leaders, researchers and the industry to consider the role of cities in suggesting and supporting healthier lifestyles for residents and visitors through day-to-day touchpoints.

title: Senior Savvy CEO hosts panel discussion on Auracast technology (Business Service)
content: Abbie Richie and the panel discuss Bluetooth capability that will make broader deployment and increased availability of ALS for people with hearing loss possible while also expanding this to consumers with all levels of hearing health.

title: Argentum releases 2023 Largest Provider Report (Business Service)
content: The report examines the senior living industry and details data on U.S. assisted living, independent living, memory care and CRCs, as well as timely information on market changes, inflation disruption, technologies revolutionizing the industry, workforce outlook, progress for women in leadership positions and insight into the Argentum strategic plan.

title: Springrose among brands investing in adaptive fashion (Startup)
content: After gathering feedback from 500 women, meeting with 35 physical and occupational therapists and holding user testing and focus groups, the company launched its first product in September.

title: Goalsetter partners with Reseda Group, MSU Federal Credit Union on education-first family finance app (Startup)
content: The platform aims to empower families with smart spending, saving, investing and financial education tools and resources to enhance their financial knowledge.

title: Zinnia TV shared free resources to support dementia caregivers to mark World Alzheimer's Day (Startup)
content: The resources include an ebook, a series of monthly caregiver support webinars and a YouTube channel.

title: Rendever aims to combat staff burnout in senior living (Startup)
content: RendeverLive is built to reduce planning time, improve activity management and provide high-quality programming.

title: OATS research cited in the Benton Institute for Broadband & Society's report (Testbed)
content: Published with support from The Humana Foundation, the Visions of Digital Equity report cited research that quantified the size and degree of the digital isolation crisis among older adults in the U.S.

title: LeadingAge, Ziegler release 20th Annual LeadingAge Ziegler report (Enterprise, Investor)
content: The report shows not-for-profit senior living providers have grown through community expansions from existing campuses as well as affiliation and acquisition activity, with nearly 30% of the total units for all senior living systems represented by the 10 largest providers.

title: Foundation for Social Connection, others launch Action Guide for Building Connected Communities (Business Service)
content: In conjunction with Harvard University's Human Flourishing Program, Healthy Places by Design and Einhorn Collaborative, the guide was issued as part of the Building Connected Communities initiative, to provide a framework to involve local leaders and community members in implementing social connection initiatives.

title: HTD Health examines Waterfall and Agile methodologies of software development for medical devices (Business Service)
content: It concludes that Agile is often the better choice for software as it allows developers to keep up with changes while following rules and guidelines.

title: RAZ Mobility partners with Mind&Melody on music sessions for dementia patients (Startup)
content: The one-on-one sessions will be provided over the video calling feature of the RAZ Memory Cell Phone, a device designed for seniors with cognitive decline.

title: Tuned receives FDA clearance for self-fitting hearing aid tech (Startup)
content:
The technology, which integrates audiology and psychology to elevate satisfaction and adoption rates while minimizing product issues and lowering service costs, will be used in some hearing aids, developed and manufactured by Intricon.
Related:
Hearing Tracker

title: Walk With Path, SHAPES develop IntellAge connected insoles (Startup)
content: The insoles and complementary app are designed to improve balance and enhance social connectedness.

title: Designed In collaboration with Selfhelp Community Services, Rosenberg Residences open in Long Island (Testbed)
content: Located in Freeport, N.Y., the residences offer 44 one-bedroom units that serve low-income people aged 55 and over.

title: Holland Home discusses brain health for residents living with dementia (Testbed)
content: Rosemary Apol-Hoezee, director of quality and education, talks about brain health.

title: care.coach takes part in webinar about global opportunities in AgeTech (Startup)
content: CEO Victor Wang along with Jillian Walker, Unmesh Lal, Neha Anna Thomas of Frost & Sullivan shared their thoughts on how AI, machine learning and other technologies can enhance offerings to the elderly.

title: Kinoo renamed Kibeam (Startup)
content: The company has "changed its name but not its mission."

title: CareYaya expands to Boston (Startup)
content: The startup introduced its new campus ambassador, Jennifer Kim, at Harvard University.

title: One-quarter of older, low-income Americans are uninsured, NIA-funded research finds (Investor)
content: Many of the uninsured seniors are Hispanic Americans who aren't eligible for Medicare or lower-income people who may be unable to afford Medicare premiums.

title: NIA funds study regarding how health technology could boost Alzheimer's, dementia care (Investor)
content: The $3.2-million grant will support a University of Maryland study of whether online patient portals, telemedicine and other hospital-based health information technology can improve care and reduce expenses for treating Alzheimer's and related dementias.

title: Kinsome wins competition at longevity conference presented by Mary Furlong & Associates, AgeTech Collaborative from AARP (Business Service)
content: During the What's Next Longevity Venture Summit in June, Kinsome by Ophelia captured both the $10,000 judge's award and the most votes from the audience during the pitch competition for its AI-driven solution to the loneliness issue for older adults by creating meaningful multigenerational connections between grandparents and grandchildren.

title: AuraSense Tech Corporation, MiiCare part of TechCrunch Disrupt 2023 cohort (Startup)
content: While early in their company lifespan, these companies are tackling some of the biggest problems across biotech, MedTech and climate, according to TechCrunch.

title: Embr Labs, UMass Amherst develop technology to predict hot flashes (Startup)
content: The consumer wearable utilizes temperature sensations to predict a menopausal hot flash before it occurs and then activates cooling on the Embr Wave to mitigate or alleviate a hot flash.

title: CareYaya CEO discusses the creation of the home care startup (Startup)
content: Neal Shah aims to connect families with trustworthy caregivers through a marketplace platform.

title: Proto Inc. will debut ProtoGPT, ProtoBot in Europe at IBC 2023 (Startup)
content: ProtoBot is included with the software in the company's hologram devices and is being customized for clients in media, finance, telecommunications, education, healthcare and retail.

title: ThriveWell Tech president discusses how AI, language processing programs are transforming senior living (Testbed)
content: Nick Patel says senior living communities are embracing AI to enhance resident satisfaction and improve care.

title: Primetime Partners takes part in $17M funding round for healthy aging platform (Investor)
content: Bold seeks to improve older adults' health through personalized exercise programs designed to prevent falls, decrease musculoskeletal pain and boost physical activity levels.

title: NIA grants funded creation of CareMobi app to manage care for older adults (Investor)
content:
Tina Sadarangani, an assistant professor at NYU Rory Meyers College of Nursing, created the free smartphone app to help connect caregivers of older adults with healthcare providers.
Related:
The New York Times Opinion (sub. req.)

title: Walgreens partners with Pearl Health to expand value-based care delivery (Enterprise)
content: Pearl's technology, designed to help clinical teams deliver value-based, quality-focused care, will be combined with Walgreens' services, including prescription fulfillment and medication adherence.

title: Zendesk Showcase to feature AI in CX (Business Service)
content: The event will feature new CX product offerings and include keynote speaker sessions, including AI influencer Allie Miller.

title: LUCID partners with University of Southern California to investigate using music as therapy for dementia patients (Startup)
content: This collaboration aims to build upon research that examines whether music-based interventions, particularly those that leverage familiar music, can provide a non-pharmacological intervention to alleviate the neuropsychiatric symptoms associated with Alzheimer's and other dementias.

title: Attn: Grace named among best sanitary pads for sensitive skin (Startup)
content: The startup's heavy incontinence pads for women ranked fourth on the list of 10.

title: RightHear aims to convert public spaces into inclusive environments for visually impaired (Startup)
content: RightHear's app offers real-time audio descriptions, enabling the visually impaired to navigate their surroundings confidently.

title: Walmart considers acquiring majority stake in ChenMed (Enterprise)
content: The deal would value the operator of primary care clinics for seniors at several billion dollars.

title: Argentum names Gloria Johnson-Cusack as keynote speaker at Senior Living Leadership Summit (Business Service)
content: Johnson-Cusack will share her expertise and insights on why leaders in the senior living industry must engage more authentically with diverse populations - both inside their businesses and externally with existing and potential customers - in order to be current and relevant in a changing landscape.

title: Springrose bras set to launch in Sept. (Startup)
content: The adaptive bras are officially going live on Sept. 12.

title: Holland Home discusses the needs, wants, expectations of aging Baby Boomers (Testbed)
content: Chief Strategy Officer David Tiesenga joins Grand Valley State University Professor Priscilla Kimboko on This Day & Age podcast.

title: Center for Elders' Independence discusses Inflation Reduction Act (Testbed)
content: CEI's Medical-Chief-Officer Dr. Jim Mittelberger was interviewed by KTVU Fox News about how lower and negotiated drug prices would have a positive impact on senior healthcare.

title: Right at Home plans expansion in Providence, R.I. (Testbed)
content: The in-home health care franchise is looking to tap into unmet demand in Providence.

title: Accenture acquires U.K. digital healthcare consultancy (Enterprise)
content: Nautilus Consulting specializes in Electronic Patient Record (EPR) solutions.

title: Mitsubishi Electric, Okayama University, Osaka University develop magnetic particle imaging device (Enterprise)
content: The high-sensitivity imaging device is capable of operating at low frequencies with a compact power supply and will allow imaging-based assessments regarding the likelihood of Alzheimer's developing prior to the onset of the disease.

title: Centre for Aging + Brain Health Innovation invests $5M in companies including Careteam Technologies, LUCID, Zinnia Technologies (Enterprise) (Startup)
content: The companies will receive up to $400,000 each to support their early-stage innovations aimed at improving the quality of life for older adults, people living with dementia and caregivers.

title: University of Newcastle research reveals human-following robots help older adults maintain mobility, wellbeing (Enterprise)
content: The robots are being tested by the National Innovation Centre for Ageing team, where they study human experiences and interactions with the robots and explore user acceptance.

title: Together by Renee unveils mental health detection tool (Startup)
content: Mental Vitals is a mental health detection tool designed to screen for symptoms of depression and anxiety through voice analysis.

title: care.coach partners with WestMass ElderCare (Startup)
content: The start-up will support WestMass's mission of preserving the dignity, independence and quality of life of elders and persons with disabilities in our community.

title: Flowly addresses chronic pain with VR, biofeedback (Startup) (Enterprise)
