content: Flowly, who participated in the second cohort of Healthworx and LifeBridge Health's 1501 Health, looks at the full spectrum of chronic pain, and all the comorbidities that come with it.

title: Xandar Kardian reaches 50 deployments with healthcare facility partners (Startup)
content: This accomplishment came within the first months of its technology that helps providers identify patients and residents at risk of deterioration.

title: Casana executives named to American Heart Association boards (Startup)
content: Dave Borkholder, co-founder and chief research officer, joined the Rochester AHA Board and Olivia Lew, COO, joins the Boston AHA Board.

title: Atento Capital leads $8M round for medication adherence company (Investor)
content: PatchRx, a smart pill bottle cap, uses data-driven technology to enhance prescription adherence.

title: NAR's Second Century Ventures named Productive.ai as 'Pitch Battle' winner (Investor) (Enterprise)
content: The startup, based in San Mateo, Calif., utilizes AI to enhance phone calls and will be awarded $15,000 and a booth at NAR's annual conference.

title: Intuition Robotics receives $25 million in funding (Enterprise)
content: The round, including $20 million in venture capital and $5 million in venture debt, was led by Toyota's Woven Capital growth funding and participation from Toyota Ventures, OurCrowd and Western Technology Investment.

title: Inside Tracker's Longevity By Design explores the importance of monitoring insulin levels (Enterprise)
content: Dr. Mitch Roslin discussed different factors that cause insulin resistance, he explained that some are within a person's control (diet and lifestyle) while others are not (age and genetics).

title: William Shatner introduces ProtoBot through philosophical discussion (Startup)
content: To introduce Proto's hologram AI chatbot Reuters witnessed the actor's discussion with Protobot, which will launch Sept. 8.

title: Israeli VR tech companies, like Gaitbetter, focus on preventive care solutions (Startup)
content: All Israel News says Israeli start-up companies specializing in VR technologies are providing a cost-effective solution to a strained American healthcare system.

title: Lighthouse Guild launches blind baseball team in New York City (Testbed)
content:
At a clinic at Central Park, the organization, along with the U.S. Blind Baseball Association, introduced new players to an adaptive version of the sport where each base makes a different sound to signal which direction to run.
Also:
Buffalo Healthy Living

title: UIC College of Applied Health Sciences helps produce presentations highlighting disability culture (Testbed)
content: The Chicago Reader featured a series of live gallery activations by Chicago dance artists in collaboration with Bodies of Work, co-directed by UICAHS' Carrie Sandahl and Sandie Yi, The Art Institute of Chicago and the Museum of Contemporary Art Chicago.

title: Camino Robotics, Tellus included in UP by Shibuya Startup Support program (Startups) (Business Services)
content: Shibuya Startups seeks early-stage startups working on issues such as an aging society, anime and game content IP, street fashion culture, food culture and disaster prevention.

title: ZIBRIO named runner-up for NASA Commercial Invention of the Year for 2023 (Startup)
content: ZIBRIO's Stability scales, launched commercially in 2022, use technology invented while assessing balance disturbances in astronauts returning from missions to outer space.

title: AuraSense, Wave Therapeutics graduate from 2023 mHUB Accelerator (Startup)
content: After nearly six months of programming, workshops and mentorship, the accelerator's cohort teams are preparing for their grand finale showcase at Demo Day.

title: RendeverLive expands to offer full-time live, interactive programming for senior living communities (Startup)
content: Rendever is also launching beta access for individuals who are aging-in-place.

title: Prisidio begins marketing digital document-storage app (Startup)
content: The one-stop product for digital storage of personal documents and a place to inventory valuables launched last Fall.

title: Lighthouse Guild leads panel on accessible entertainment (Testbed)
content: Panelists in music production, communications and a professional DJ shared their insights on making entertainment accessible for visually-impaired people.

title: Meeranda becomes part of Microsoft for Startups Founders Hub (Enterprise)
content:
The AI solutions provider, which serves small and medium businesses and global multinational corporations, says its acceptance into the program will help it reach its mission of delivering "the new personalized customer experience."
Also:
EIN News

title: Penny Finance wins Smart Money award by Real Simple (Startup)
content: It was listed in the Financial Literacy category where it was called "An Online Community of Smart People."

title: HomeZada featured in Pulse 2.0 (Startup)
content: It interviewed co-founder John Bodrozic about the online and mobile platform that manages information during the entire homeowner cycle, including owning, selling and buying a home.

title: CareYaya's CEO discusses the service on Patients Rising Podcast (Startup)
content: Neal Shah discusses how his experience pushed him to create the company, which he calls the "Uber of caregiving."

title: 11Ten Innovation Partners, Trust & Will, Rendever named to 2023 Inc. 5000 list (Testbed) (Startup)
content: The list is a ranking of the fastest-growing independent businesses in America.

title: LIFT Labs alumni discuss the benefits of the accelerator (Enterprise)
content: They explain how it helped secure partnerships with Comcast NBCUniversal and other benefits.

title: Flowly for teams aims to redefine how payers think about pain (Startup)
content: Flowly's approach to addressing non-structural chronic pain drives positive impacts on multiple fronts.

title: Voiceitt, RAZ Mobility launch Voiceitt2 to assist individuals with speech disabilities (Startup)
content: The application converts non-standard speech into standard speech, while also enabling features such as transcription, dictation and integration with AI assistants like ChatGPT.

title: Holland Home receives $3.5M to retain, recruit nurses (Testbed)
content: The grant from the Michigan Department of Health and Human Services is the largest in the provider's 132-year history.

title: OATS participates in listening session about digital equity obstacles (Testbed)
content: With the prevalence of digital discrimination among older adults, the FCC invited OATS to gather panelists to participate in a virtual listening session about obstacles related to digital equity.

title: Montage Ventures takes part in $15M funding round for Caden (Investor)
content: The data intelligence startup aims to change how enterprises access and use consumer data by paying people for what they share.

title: Homeward Health CEO shares vision for rural health (Enterprise)
content:
In a Reuters report, Jennifer Schneider shared her vision for more equitable and efficient care in rural America.
Also:
Medical Economics

title: NCPDP Foundation Awards $79K to Digital Therapeutics Alliance (Enterprise)
content: The grant will support research into health plans' criteria for determining coverage pathways of DTx products and develop pharmacy and medical benefit workflows to illustrate how clinically validated digital therapeutic products can be integrated into benefit designs.

title: National Association of Realtors names 12 companies taking part in 'Pitch Battle' (Investor)
content: NAR's venture capital arm, Second Century Ventures, will present the Pitch Battle competition, where each entrant will conduct a live, four-minute pitch about its product or service followed by a four-minute, rapid-fire question-and-answer session from a panel of judges.

title: SCAN Foundation CEO named to Forbes '50 Over 50' (Enterprise)
content: Sarita Mohanty, CEO of The Scan Foundation was named to the list of innovative women.

title: NICA, EMOTIV to explore connection between emotions, longevity through technology (Enterprise)
content:
The partnership will be formalized under a high-visibility pilot project called 'Project City Vibes', which will see NICA harness the potential of EMOTIV's smart headphones, the MN8, to measure brain activity in the real world while minimizing the impact on user experience.  
Also:
NICA

title: Homeward Health SVP joins American Telemed Healthy Aging Collaborative webinar (Enterprise)
content: Stephanie Gutendorf will discuss the evolving healthcare landscape and innovative care models focused on expanding access to those who need it.

title: Mighty Health chosen for 2023 UnitedHealthcare Accelerator (Startup)
content: Chosen startups have the opportunity to work with UnitedHealthcare executives and subject matter experts from across the healthcare industry to evolve their businesses while participating alongside a growing community of their peers.

title: Rendever part of Mass. assisted living facility's regular schedule (Startup)
content: The programming director at the facility has been using Rendever for three years with the residents in both group classes and one on one.

title: De Oro Devices CEO featured on Invest in Her podcast (Startup)
content: Sidney Collin started the company while studying Biomedical Engineering at Cal Poly.

title: Prisidio shares how it can help protect information during a hurricane (Startup)
content: Sarah Mitchell discussed how the features of the app can help during emergencies.

title: Onward, Zinnia Technologies, CareYaya chosen for MATTER's Accelerating Innovation in Aging cohort (Startup)
content: The members of the cohort will receive mentorship, resources and a curriculum from subject matter experts to build their solutions and refine their value propositions. They will also have the opportunity to win a $10,000 cash award.

title: Embr wristband tops list of 14 products to help stay cool while sleeping (Startup)
content: The Embr Wave 2 Thermal Wristband emits a cooling (or heating) sensation that can be adjusted with its app.

title: Givers podcast discusses better communication in dementia caregiving (Startup)
content: Speech Language Pathologist Adria Thompson talks about how to communicate better with those living with dementia.

title: Right at Home SVP recognized as Future Leader in Home Care (Testbed)
content: Emily Undajon, SVP of Strategic Operations, received national recognition as a 2023 Future Leader in Home Health and Home Care from Aging Media Network.

title: Verizon, Metropolitan Museum of Art launch AR app (Enterprise)
content: Users can download the Replica app, visit The Met to access the in-app map to guide them to artworks around the Museum, learn about different works of art and digitally collect elements of the works to be used in the Roblox platform.

title: ECHAlliance's Global Health Connector Partnership to host HLTH 2023 (Enterprise)
content: Andy Bleaden, communities director, explains how business can be showcased internationally by participating in the Global Village at HLTH 23.

title: Study finds XRHealth's VR Technology reduces stress, anxiety in patients by 34% (Startup)
content: XRHealth's VR technology was used for the therapeutic intervention, which resulted in a decrease of stress in 73% of patients, more so in female patients and those in the 18-24 age bracket.

title: Joylux to offer women's intimate health products through Nordstrom (Startup)
content: Customers will be able to purchase vFit Gold and other women's health products on Nordstrom's platform.

title: RAZ Mobility launches smartphone for those who are blind, visually impaired (Startup)
content: The SmartVision 3 is a fully functional Android smartphone that allows people with vision loss to control all aspects of the phone with a tactile keypad.

title: Pear Suite establishes office in Okla. with help from Atento Capital (Startup)
content: This will allow Pear Suite to serve clients, starting with LIFE Senior Services, an organization specializing in home and community-based services for over 80,000 seniors in Oklahoma. Atento Capital bolstered Pear Suite's expansion in the region with strategic investment.

title: Minn. state senator completes first eWill with Trust & Will (Startup)
content: Using the trustandwill.com platform and electronic signing with a mobile notary, Sen. Bonnie Westlin completed the eWill on Aug. 1, 2023, creating the state's first end-to-end-digital-estate plan.

title: United Church Homes welcomes two VPs to leadership team (Testbed)
content: Megan Kelley has joined as the VP of General Counsel and Kevin Deegan has been appointed as VP of Corporate Ventures.

title: New York State Office for the Aging found 95% reduction in loneliness among older adults with Intuition Robotics AI companion ElliQ (Enterprise)
content:
The results from the AI companionship program have been hailed as exceeding expectations, with users interacting with ElliQ over 30 times per day on average, six days a week.
Also:
N.Y. renews deal for Israeli-made robot companion for elderly - No Camels

title: ECHAlliance partners with Task Force Health Care (Enterprise)
content: Although both non-profit organizations have a global scope, the focus of the collaboration is to intensify joint activities within Europe.

title: Zemplee competes in Startup World Cup Silicon Valley (Startup)
content: The winner of the 15 startups taking part in the regional competition will compete at the Grand Finale in Sept. for a chance to win a $1,000,000 investment prize.

title: Last Gameboard CEO named finalist in Wonder Women Award (Startup)
content: Shail Mehta is a finalist for award from Women in Toys, Licensing & Entertainment which recognizes outstanding women who have made a significant and lasting impact on the toy, consumer products, licensing and entertainment industries.

title: Casana COO joins BOD of American Heart Association - Massachusetts (Startup)
content: Olivia Lew, COO from Casana is joined by Jaime Butler, CEO of Brand 21 and Allison McClain, chief communications officer at Nixon Peabody.

title: Primetime Partners participates in $8M funding round for Peppermint (Investor)
content: New York-based startup Peppermint introduced a virtual community, the Peppermint Clubhouse, designed for adults aged 55 and above.

title: Symposium brings attendees from across three Ziegler Link•age Funds together (Investor)
content: Roughly 180 attendees, inclusive of Limited Partners, Portfolio Companies and other strategic partners, participated in a day-long event that featured innovation, technological advancement, creative partnerships and solutions to challenges within the sector

title: Flowly to launch non-structural pain program (Startup)
content: The 12-week program will introduce and reinforce techniques and training to help participants heal from non-structural pain.

title: Together by Renee uses Binah.ai to check, share vital signs (Startup)
content: The app helps patients and caregivers manage their medications, appointments, refills, doctors and more just by using their smartphone camera and voice, eliminating the need for typing.

title: Voiceitt endorses Communications, Video and Technology Accessibility Act (Startup)
content: This legislation will help ensure the FCC can ensure technologies like Voiceitt will help people with disabilities communicate.

title: Ziegler-Linkage Fund invests in K4Connect (Investor)
content: K4Connect, a provider of enterprise technologies for senior living communities, raised $8.9 million in the investment round.

title: Accenture, ServiceNow, NVIDIA partner to accelerate generative AI adoption (Enterprise)
content: AI Lighthouse will assist pioneering customers across industries in the design, development and implementation of new generative AI use cases.

title: N.Y. Office for the Aging brings Intuition Robotics to seniors (Enterprise)
content: The New York State Office for the Aging implemented ElliQ in the homes of 800 older adults across the state.

title: HomeZada's AI chat assistant aims to help homeowners manage their home (Startup)
content: The platform is adding the AI Chat Assistant "Zada" to its suite of apps designed to help homeowners simplify the ownership, maintenance, management and equity growth of their home.

title: myBiometry wins $10K innovation award at challenge administered by M2D2 (Testbed)
content: myBiometry won MeHI's $10,000 cash award at Boston Scientific's Connected Patient Challenge VII for its platform designed to remotely monitor and manage patients with asthma using software and biomarker data generated from proprietary sensors.

title: WRF Capital takes part in Series A round for KayoThera (Investor)
content: KayoThera, an early-stage therapeutics company developing oral, small molecule inhibitors of the retinoid pathway, announced the expansion of its Series A financing with an additional $5.2 million in new investments.

title: Microsoft, Conviction Partners to support AI incubator, Embed (Enterprise)
content: Conviction Embed is an eight-week program for early (pre-seed, seed-stage) founding teams which harnesses a network and knowledge on software company-building, while creating a community for shared learning about AI-native challenges.

title: Zendesk recognized as 'Best Place to Work for Disability Inclusion' (Business Service)
content: Presented by the 2023 Disability Equality Index, the company says the award recognizes that it aspires to be an employer of choice for diverse talent.

title: Attn: Grace's incontinence products land national placement at Walmart, Target (Startup)
content: Married co-founders Mia Abbruzzese and Alexandra Fennell launched the line of sustainable incontinence products for women that aims to destigmatize the common condition.

title: Parks Associates virtual sessions feature speakers from NIA, Thrive Center, Zemplee (Startup)
content: The Smart Spaces proptech virtual session includes insight on how technology is leveraged in senior living environments and the CONNECTIONS session "New Era of Home Services," features insights on current developments in the smart home industries.

title: T. Rowe Price, Principal extend retirement planning, product solution distribution divisions (Enterprise)
content: The retirement recordkeepers have expanded their retirement planning and product distribution capabilities with internal promotions and outside hiring.

title: Rehabilitation Innovation Center co-hosts Healthy Aging Fair to help seniors age in place (Testbed)
content: Co-hosted by the College of Health Professions and Sciences, the fair showcased assistive devices and technologies aimed at enhancing various aspects of daily life such as medical alert systems, memory aids, communication aids, visual aids, screen readers, hearing aids and amplifiers.

title: NIA-funded research helps produce tool capable of counting brain lesions in seconds (Investor)
content:
The UT Health Science Center San Antonio uses AI to precisely quantify and map brain lesions.
Also:
Alzheimer's Association International Conference

title: Eight startups in Comcast NBCUniversal LIFT Labs accelerator secured pilots, proofs of concepts with Comcast, NBCUniversal, Sky (Enterprise)
content: During the six-week Generative AI Accelerator, the startups worked side-by-side with teams at Comcast, NBCUniversal and Sky to share insights and scope out projects that demonstrate the power and relevance of their technology to large enterprises.

title: VICHY Laboratoires partners with Embr Labs to bring care to menopausal women (Startup)
content: Embr customers will receive a sample of Neovadiol Meno 5 Serum with all orders, plus a discount and gift on VICHY's site. In return, VICHY customers will receive a promo offer on Embr Labs' site, and Embr will be featured in VICHY's Neovadiol Video Diary Series Campaign.

title: Attn: Grace gets $2M to grow incontinence products category (Startup)
content: Attn: Grace received $2 million in funding to fuel growth after launching in nearly 1,600 Walmart stores nationwide as well as on Walmart.com and Target.com. Led by For Later, the round also saw participation from Flybridge as well as existing investors including Kapor Capital, Portfolia, Ingeborg Investments and Commonwealth.

title: SCOR developing life insurance product with CancerCARE (Investor)
content: SCOR Life & Health in the U.S. and INTERLINK Care Management are developing a concierge-style CancerCARE program for life insurance policyholders.

title: CVS Health Ventures supports startup to help launch other startups (Investor)
content: The venture capital arm of CVS Health participated in a $65-million funding round in Sept. for Redesign Health, which provides research, technology and branding for aspiring digital health companies because it believes the company can have a "multiplier" effect on digital health.

title: Disability:IN names Walgreens Boots Alliance Employer of the Year (Enterprise)
content: Walgreens redesigned its employee bonus plan to include a disability representation metric to drive this commitment, making it the first company in the S&P 500 to include disability representation as a separate, standalone metric within a disclosed incentive plan.

title: Lifespace Communities partners with Candoo Tech (Startup)
content: Candoo Tech will provide technology support, education and training to all 17 Lifespace Communities. The services include unlimited remote one-to-one tech training and support, group lessons and a library of on-demand content.

title: RightHear installs Wayfinding System at Columbia Lighthouse for the Blind (Startup)
content: In June, RightHear visited the CLB to complete the installation of its Indoor Wayfinding System, to advance accessibility and independence for the organization's employees and clients.

title: Joylux's coldHER bra inserts featured on Today Show (Startup)
content:
Lifestyle expert Chassie Post shared products to help beat the heat, including Joylux's coldHER.
Also:
The U.S. Sun

title: Prisidio offers secure digital storage for important items, info (Startup)
content: Users can download the app and then add their documents, people, places and things to the digital vault.

title: NIA celebrates FDA approval of Leqembi to treat Alzheimer's (Investor)
content: The NIA said it is grateful to the research community and clinical trial participants who have helped advance Alzheimer's knowledge, data and discoveries.

title: LeadingAge shares Clinical Procedure Manual for care providers (Enterprise)
content: From activities of daily living to infection control to hospice and end-of-life care, this manual (for purchase) covers a wide range of procedures that home and community-based providers deliver.

title: In 2022, 14% of homebuyers turned to multigenerational housing: National Association of Realtors (Enterprise)
content: Nearly one in five Americans live in a multi-generational home, quadrupling stats from the 1970s.

title: FallCall Solutions named Innovator of the Month (Startup)
content: U.S. Senator Chris Murphy (D-Conn.) highlighted that the company's flagship app, FallCall Detect, was the first app to bring 24/7 emergency monitoring to Apple Watch, iPhone and Android devices and can determine the severity of a fall and who should be contacted.

title: Pear Suite partners with OutCare Health (Startup)
content: The nonprofit will utilize Pear's platform to empower employers, health plans and healthcare organizations to address the needs of the LGBTQ+ community.

title: Morehouse School of Medicine's HEAL clinic receives $140K to help underserved communities (Testbed)
content: The investment will be used to provide care to underserved populations in the Atlanta metro area and surrounding rural communities.

title: SCOR names new BoD chair (Investors)
content: SCOR’s Board of Directors appointed Fabrice Brégier as non-executive Chairman.

title: Microsoft for Startups seeks second cohort AI-first startups (Enterprise)
content: Applications are open for the AI Grant program through July 10, 2023.

title: Careteam Technologies CEO discusses AI, digital healthcare tools (Startup)
content: Careteam Technologies founder, CEO and CMO Dr. Alexandra T. Greenhill presented at "CityAge: The Data Effect," to discuss how AI can be implemented into digital healthcare tools to benefit health systems and the people within them.

title: Startups pitch healthy aging tools at Mass. digital health competition (Testbed)
content: Seven companies pitched their digital products to promote healthy aging at the finale of the Healthy Aging Sandbox Challenge. Four firms were selected to receive $50,000 awarded by MeHI as part of its work under the MassDigitalHealth Initiative.

title: NIA-supported study determines lifestyle 'sweet spot' for aging brain health (Investor)
content: An NIA-funded study of two indigenous South American groups, published in Proceedings of the National Academy of Sciences, supports the idea of a lifestyle "sweet spot" for healthy aging.

title: ICBA ThinkTECH Accelerator Demo Day celebrates FinTech solutions for community banks (Enterprise)
content: The two-day event showcased the innovations of graduating companies, which have developed FinTech solutions to address the needs of community banks over a 10-week intensive boot camp.

title: FellowshipLIFE executive named to LeadingAge N.J., Del. board of trustees (Enterprise)
content: Elizabeth Fandel, Chief Marketing and Innovation Officer at FellowshipLIFE will use her extensive experience in the field of senior living and aging services to support older adults in N.J. and Del. while working to promote quality stewardship and choice in aging services.

title: TriNet series follows stories of CEOs, prominent SMB entrepreneurs (Business Service)
content: The interview series, "Leading with Passion," includes seven, 40-minute episodes of discussions with CEOs and entrepreneurs who used their business expertise to improve people's lives.

title: Rendever, RiverSpring partner to provide VR to elderly (Startup)
content: The two have teamed to use VR to reintegrate the elderly into their homes after rehabilitation stays using videos and images taken of the home environment.

title: NIA funds leg heat therapy study to remedy pain while walking (Investor)
content: A study funded with a grant from the NIA will involve participants with peripheral artery disease wearing heat trousers daily for 90 minutes over eight consecutive weeks to determine if it helps alleviate pain while walking.

title: Primetime Partners, CEOc participate in $10M raise for DUOS (Investor)
content: CEOc is making its first investment from the Aging Innovation Fund, joining Primetime Partners and SFJ Ventures in a $10-million raise for Duos Living as it expands its tech platform and engagement services.

title: AARP grants will help communities become more livable (Enterprise)
content: AARP is investing $3.6 million in 310 Community Challenge grants for quick-action projects to help communities become more livable for people of all ages.

title: LeadingAge Florida supports bill strengthening CCRCs (Enterprise)
content: HB 1573, supported by Leading Age Florida and the Florida Life Care Residents Association, includes reforms designed to benefit operators and residents of the continuing care retirement / life plan community model.

title: Twilio, Frame AI partner to uplevel contact centre experiences with AI (Business Service)
content: Frame AI will enable Flex to train an AI model to define, identify and categorize customer intents they're interested in monitoring.

title: Lush praises Zendesk for increasing agent productivity, savings (Business Service)
content: Lush says its implementation of Zendesk produced a 369% ROI and generated sustained impactful business benefits in productivity.

title: Givers explores how expectant caregivers can prepare (Startup)
content: In a discussion with Danielle Miura of Spark Financials, Givers reviews the additional challenges and potential disparities in accessing financial resources and the steps people can take to start planning ahead and building a solid financial foundation.

title: Amicus Brain highlights Lancet Commission findings risk factors for dementia (Startup)
content: Roughly 40% of dementia cases could be prevented or delayed by targeting 12 modifiable risk factors throughout life.

title: United Church Homes partnership expands, combines hospice, palliative care, senior living, payer assets (Testbed)
content: Nonprofit health plan CareSource is partnering with Radiant Alliance, an entity formed by Metta Healthcare and United Church Homes. Radiant Alliance, Metta Healthcare and United Church Homes will remain independent companies within CareSource.

title: Springbank raises $35M venture fund for caregiving economy (Investor)
content: Suggesting a more than $650-billion caregiving market, Springbank Collective revealed a $35-million venture capital fund to target care-focused startups.

title: Mary Furlong and Associates podcast explores what's next in tech (Business Service)
content: With guests Sean Liu of Ping, Akshita Iyer of Ome and University of Waterloo researcher Ali Ayub, co-hosts Mary Furlong and Fred Fishkin discuss a robot that remembers where a person puts things, a smart stove knob that can turn itself off, a watch to monitor health and connect to caregivers.

title: UMass Medical School to study how Casana's Heart Seat can help patients with chronic diseases (Startup)
content:
The study led by researchers at UMass Chan Medical School's Program in Digital Medicine will test how the smart toilet seat can help patients with chronic diseases better manage their health.
Also:
Casana

title: Trust & Will to provide estate planning through UBS Workplace Wealth Solutions (Startup)
content: The program will make simple, affordable estate plans available to employees of certain UBS corporate clients

title: Together by Renee uses generative AI to manage healthcare tasks for aging adults (Startup)
content: Together aims to help patients and caregivers manage medications, appointments, refills and doctors just by using their smartphone camera and voice.

title: MiiCare, Amicus Brain Innovations named semi-finalists in Longitude Prize on Dementia (Startup)
content: They have been awarded one 24 Discovery Award grants worth over $100,000 as part of the Longitude Prize on Dementia, an international competition funded by Alzheimer's Society and Innovate UK.

title: OndeCare matches families with experienced caregivers via on-demand platform (Startups)
content: Clients create a "job" describing who is in need of care, as well as when, the OndeCare platform uses an algorithm to match top-ranked, vetted "Heroes" with clients who are best suited to each other's needs.

title: MeHI Healthy Aging Challenge Pitch Event to take place June 28 (Testbed)
content: Eight digital health companies will pitch for the chance to win one of four $50K grants from cutting edge R&D centers in Mass.

title: CABHI funds over $1.9M of healthcare innovations for older adults, caregivers (Enterprise)
content: The funding is offered through CABHI's Spark Program, which supports the development of innovations by frontline healthcare workers and researchers to solve care challenges, in addition to financial support it offers coaching, mentorship and networking opportunities.

title: Zendesk acquires workforce management solution Tymeshift (Business Service)
content: Built for Zendesk customers, Tymeshift simplifies the management of customer experience workloads.

title: XRHealth receives patent for closed loop biofeedback in VR, AR (Startup)
content: XRHealth's platform allows patients on the autism spectrum and those with stress, anxiety, chronic pain, fibromyalgia and neurological conditions to connect with a provider and receive recommended therapies on a VR headset.

title: Casana names new chief medical officer (Startup)
content: Dr. Shikha Anand brings more than 20 years of experience in healthcare.

title: Careteam Technologies CCO to take part in panel at NHS Confederation ConfedExpo (Startup)
content: Jeremy Smith will represent the Canadian delegation as a part of the UK-Canada AgeTech Innovation Exchange.

title: Students from Morehouse School of Medicine part of Diversity for Health Care, Innovation and Medicine Summer Learning Opportunity (Testbed)
content: Throughout June, UMass Chan Medical School will be training students underrepresented in medicine from host programs in Ga. and N.Y. through clinical rotations in dermatology, orthopedic surgery, OB-GYN, internal medicine, pediatrics and radiology.

title: NIA funds UCF project to increase diversity among researchers of aging populations (Investor)
content: The $1.85-million grant will be use to pilot a five-year, multidisciplinary program to increase diversity among student researchers focused on health disparities in aging.

title: Walgreens, Freenome partner to increase diversity in research on the early detection of cancer (Enterprise)
content: Walgreens will combine its national footprint, patient insights, compliant recruitment technology and local infrastructure to engage diverse patient populations in Freenome’s multi-cancer research program.

title: MiiCare named finalist in MassChallenge Switzerland's AI Accelerator in UK (Startup)
content:
Ailuna, Ignota Labs, Kestrix and Insurevision.ai join MiiCare as finalists that will accelerate both in London and Switzerland.
Also:
MiiCare Twitter

title: Automated live captions, provided by Xander, becoming transformative for hearing impaired (Startup)
content: Alex and Marilyn Westner, the co-founders of the Boston-area startup share their company's augmented-reality live-captioning glasses with writer and disability advocate.

title: Careteam Technologies to attend 'The Data Effect: Our HeathData Opportunity' (Startup)
content: On June 21, CEO and Chief Medical Officer, Dr. Alexandra T. Greenhill will attend The Data Effect: Our HeathData Opportunity to discuss how AI applications have been contributing to health innovation and benefiting health systems.

title: The UK National Innovation Centre for Ageing launches global initiative to promote healthy aging, longevity (Enterprise)
content: The City of Longevity project is the first of its kind and aims to create an inclusive, accessible and equitable urban environment that supports the older population while enabling younger people to thrive as they age.

title: Digital Therapeutics Alliance, Healthware Group launch DTx Policy Report, website (Enterprise)
content: The report and website aim to advance equitable access, adoption of safe, effective DTx, digital medical devices.

title: Einhorn Collaborative, the Foundation for Social Connection, Harvard University's Human Flourishing Program, Healthy Places by Design launch 'Building Connected Communities' (Business Service)
content: The initiative will focus on identifying, developing and deploying evidence-based tools, best practices and resources local leaders can use to strengthen social connection across all ages and stages of life.

title: Careteam Technologies acquires Trillium Health Partners' Care Connector (Startup)
content: Developed by the team at Trillium Health Partners' Institute for Better Health (IBH), Care Connector aims to streamline and integrate experiences for patients as they move between acute home and community care settings.

title: Casana's chief scientific officer explains inception of Heart Seat (Startup)
content:
Nicholas Conn discusses how getting the right data, in the right ways can fuel a company's success.
Also:
Casana

title: Health Transformer Showcase will feature care.coach (Startup)
content: care.coach will share its moonshot story and progress, as well as participate in a Q&A.

title: Parkinson's Foundation receives grant supporting research collaboration with Morehouse School of Medicine (Testbed)
content: The grant from the Robert W. Woodruff Foundation will be used to expand genetic testing, genetic counseling and educational research opportunities for Black and African American people with Parkinson's disease.

title: Route 66 Ventures takes part in $20M round for Yuvo Health (Investor)
content: Yuvo Health is a technology-enabled administrative and managed-care solution for Federally Qualified Health Centers.

title: Inflect Health participates in funding round for Karoo Health (Investor)
content: Karoo Health, a provider of cardiac value-based care enablement, closed a seed funding round of $3.4 million. It intends to use the funds to launch and expand its value-based cardiac care model.

title: Hearst Ventures helps fund 500K round for RxLightning (Investor)
content: RxLightning's software platform is designed to reduce the time it takes for healthcare providers to get patients started on specialty medications to minutes or hours.

title: Jumpstart Foundry expands portfolio with spring 2023 companies (Investor)
content: The Nashville-based healthcare innovation fund reveals its largest cohort to date, consisting of 20 companies working to improve the healthcare space.

title: GaitBetter to attend Digital Therapeutics Alliance Inaugural Summit (Startup)
content: It will be demonstrating its digital neurotherapeutic solution at the 2023 Digital Therapeutics Alliance on June 8th.

title: Prisidio provides 'virtual vault' for personal information (Startup)
content: The cloud-based platform provides a secure place for people to store and organize confidential and vital information, which they can share digitally with those who are "central to their lives," CEO Glenn Shimkus explained.

title: Candoo Tech aims to help seniors improve digital literacy (Startup)
content: CEO Liz Hamburg says Candoo Tech works with Medicare Advantage plans and senior housing developments to increase seniors' digital health literacy.

title: care.coach participated in discussion of AI, chatbots on healthcare at ViVE 2023 (Startup)
content: At ViVE 2023 in Nashville, StartUp Health's Unity Stoakes sat down with founders from Mediktor, Renalis Health, care.coach and IndyGeneUS-AI to discuss the impact of AI and chatbots on healthcare.

title: Attn: Grace available at Target.com, Walmart.com and Walmart Supercenters (Startup)
content: Attn: Grace can now be found on Walmart.com and in 1,500+ Supercenters across the country.

title: OndeCare expands in-home dependant care services (Techstars)
content: A provider of in-home dependant care services, OndeCare is now available to families in the Washington, D.C. metro area.

title: Verizon Forward for Good Accelerator focuses on health equity-based startups (Enterprise)
content: Seven organizations completed the third cohort of the Verizon Forward for Good Accelerator, focused on Health Equity to scale solutions that address the barriers to health access and quality care. In partnership with the innovation agency, CoLab.

title: Prisidio co-founder discusses organization's mission (Startup)
content: Glenn Shimkus promotes the cloud-based vault for essential documents and information.

title: XRHealth adopted Snapdragon Spaces XR Developer Platform for the Lenovo ThinkReality VRX (Startup)
content: The integration will enable XRHealth developers to create immersive experiences in AR/VR/MR for the healthcare industry.

title: MiiCube Showcase shares information about health monitoring system (Startup)
content: The MiiCube helps service providers monitor the health of their users.

title: ZIBRIO's stability scale aims to combat ageism in fall prevention (Startup)
content: Originally developed in the U.S. Space program, ZIBRIO's technology focuses on understanding how the body handles gravity and its impact on falls, rather than relying on age as a determining factor.

title: CVS Health Ventures invests in Strive Health (Investor)
content: Strive Health, a national leader in value-based kidney care, raised $166 million in Series C funding.

title: MassRobotics, Festo, Mitsubishi Electric Automation, Novanta, MITRE seek healthcare startups for third Healthcare Robotics Startup Catalyst program (Enterprise)
content: This program provides healthcare startups with the opportunity to showcase innovative healthcare and robotics solutions.

title: The Last Gameboard CEO's efforts to raise funds, bring product to market featured in Forbes (Startup)
content: Forbes reports Shail Mehta, CEO of The Last Gameboard, raised $6 million in venture capital through cold calls, perserverence. The company came out of beta testing at the end of February, and the tablet began shipping in March.

title: United Church Homes communities recognized in 2023 Long Term Care Equality Index (Testbed)
content: Sixty-seven United Church Homes communities were recognized with High Performer or Leader status.

title: Hyundai signs MoU for strategic partnership with Israel Innovation Authority (Enterprise)
content: The MoU will enable the partners to discover innovative Israeli startups that can collaborate with the group through a startup competition and share project costs for initial technology validation.

title: CABHI-supported Virtual Gym featured on CTV News (Enterprise)
content: The exercise platform provides personalized game-like exercises for older adults.

title: The Mather Group acquires Clear Perspectives Financial Planning (Business Service)
content: The Clear Perspectives team will continue to operate out of its Cincinnati office as it becomes TMG's first brick-and-mortar location in Ohio

title: SingFit CEO takes part in Human Brain Expo (Startup)
content: SingFit CEO Rachel Francine discussed singing for better brain health and the SingFit platform at the Human Brain Expo.

title: FallCall Solutions is a finalist for the Fundación MAPFRE social innovation awards (Startup)
content: FallCall Solutions is a U.S. finalist in the "Silver Economy" category.

title: QED Investors raised $925 million for two new funds (Investor)
content: The firm said it has closed on $650 million for its early stage fund and $275 million for what it calls an early growth-stage fund.

title: Second Century Ventures opens applications for REACH Canada (Investor)
content: The strategic investment arm of NAR opened applications for the fourth cohort of its Canadian technology growth program.

title: Best Buy Health, Atrium Health join McDermott Will & Emery at Digital Health Forum 2023 (Business Service)
content: As healthcare grows more consumerized, retailers and providers are launching collaborations that put access and patient experiences front and center.

title: Trust & Will partner with financial services firm Carson Group (Startup)
content: Through this partnership, Carson advisors will be able to streamline their clients' estate plan and probate needs, creating ready-to-execute documents in all 50 states.

title: Voiceitt, Cisco partner to offer speech recognition for virtual meetings (Startup)
content: Webex by Cisco will integrate Voiceitt's technology into its platform for people to make virtual meetings more accessible for individuals with speech impairments.

title: a2 Collective is featured in white paper on technological disruption (Testbed)
content: The white paper on rapid technological disruption says age-related industries are leveraging AI to improve care management, automate check-ins and prevent falls.

title: Prudential study reveals connection between physical, mental health (Enterprise)
content: The study, conducted with health-tech platform NeuroFlow, found a connection between depression and anxiety and the physical health of disability claimants.

title: United Church Homes podcast discusses VR for older adults with Rendever (Startup)
content: Kyle Rand, CEO and Co-Founder of Rendever, discusses his work with virtual reality technology for older adults and explains how Rendever's products can help combat social isolation and loneliness among older adults.

title: Homecare Hub board member said agencies have difficult time finding caregivers (Startup)
content: Dr. Michael Apkon, a member of the board for Homecare Hub, said "Not only are we in the peak of the Baby Boomer aging wave, but we also began to have a lot more people that needed some sort of post-acute care setting as they were recovering from COVID."

title: GaitBetter's mobility training showcased at LeadingAge MD (Startup)
content: GaitBetter is a new approach to resident mobility, cognitive health and fall prevention.

title: Thirteen companies selected to develop healthy aging solutions as part of U.K. and Canada AgeTech Innovation Exchange (Enterprise)
content: Eight U.K. companies and five Canadian companies were invited to take part in an in-person exchange, they will be supported by experts with in-depth knowledge of the healthy aging innovation ecosystems within each country, from national healthcare providers, academia and industry.

title: LeadingAge CAST tool helps remedy isolation, loneliness in older adults (Enterprise)
content: Loneliness and isolation is recognized as a public health crisis, and LeadingAge CAST updated its tool to find solutions for organizations.

title: Digital Therapeutics Alliance to host summit, June 7-9, 2023 (Enterprise)
content: The three-day summit will be facilitated by leaders from all facets of the digital therapeutics (DTx) ecosystem, including policymakers, manufacturers, payors and other experts to guide innovation and equity in healthcare.

title: The Mather Group named to Inc.'s Best Workplaces list (Business Service)
content: The list is a measurement of American companies that have excelled in creating exceptional workplaces and company culture.

title: RAZ Mobility adds video calls to cell phone for seniors (Startup)
content: RAZ Mobility updated the RAZ Memory Cell Phone that adds video calling capability, and other features, to enhance the device for both seniors and caregivers.

title: Embr Labs raises $35M for thermoregulating wristband for menopausal women (Startup)
content: The company raised $35 million via IP-based dept financing to support its consumer growth strategy via retail and geographic expansion.

title: Embodied Labs CEO to speak at AWE 2023 (Startup)
content: Carrie Shaw will speak at the event, running in Santa Clara, Calif. from May 31 to June 2.

title: Trust & Will named to Inc's Best Workplaces list (Startup)
content:
The startup made the list for the thrid year in a row.
Also:
The Financial Revolutionist

title: RAZ Mobility designs phone for those with Parkinson's, hand tremors, arthritis (Startup)
content: The RAZ Memory Cell Phone focuses on simplicity, making it a great option for seniors with mild cognitive impairment, Parkinson's disease, stroke or arthritis.

title: Dentity reminds consumers to be wary of romance scams (Startup)
content: The company highlights many of the phrases being used to entrap people in romance scams, reminding them it's best to take the time to verify the identity of those on the other line, despite how pressing the matter may appear.

title: Litesprite mobile mental health video game selected at innovation event (Startup)
content: Coordinated Behavioral Care's Innovative iChoose Event identified solutions that improve access and engagement for individuals with complex behavioral health and medical needs within the Bronx, NY community. Litesprite's mobile mental health video game, Sinasprite, was selected as one of four finalists.

title: QED co-founders named among best venture capitalists in Forbes list (Investor)
content: Nigel Morris and Frank Rotman were named to Forbes' annual Midas List honoring the best 100 venture capitalists in the world. Rotman was named to the list for the sixth consecutive year, while Morris appeared for the third time in a row.

title: Poll: Most voters want more support for family caregivers (Enterprise)
content: A majority of voters (78%) are either a current, past or future family caregiver. Over 70% in the AARP poll said they would be more likely to support a candidate who backed proposals to support family caregivers, such as a tax credit, paid family leave and increased support and respite services.

title: ECHAlliance reveals funding competition for skin cancer detection using AI (Enterprise)
content: The aim of the competition is to improve existing AI algorithms for skin cancer to accelerate detection and diagnosis. Companies will be expected to understand the performance of their algorithm prior to the challenge.

title: F4SC tweets about loneliness, mental health during Mental Health Awareness Month (Business Service)
content: This Mental Health Awareness Month, the Foundation for Social Connection is joining the Surgeon General in his efforts to address loneliness and improve mental health.

title: Givers wins Fast Company’s 2023 World Changing Ideas Award (Startup)
content: The awards are given to companies for making the world more equitable, accessible and sustainable.

title: Casana receives FDA clearance for heart health smart toilet seat (Startup)
content: The clearance marks a significant milestone for Casana in its pursuit to enable effortless home health monitoring.

title: Thriving.ai offers one year of service for free (Startup)
content: The offer is available for people who join its Facebook focus group and provide feedback.

title: Bryn Mawr Hospital is one of four acute care hospitals to receive A for patient safety (Testbed)
content: The Lankenau Medical Center, Bryn Mawr Hospital, Paoli Hospital and Riddle Hospital each received a Hospital Safety Grade of A.

title: United Church Homes tool helps caregivers, older adults navigate aging (Testbed)
content: NaviGuide helps connect adult children and other caregivers, as well as their older adult parents, to the aging services best for them, said Terry Spitznagel, chief growth officer at United Church Homes.

title: QED Investors projects FinTech will become a $1.5T industry by 2030 (Investor)
content: FinTech revenues are projected to grow sixfold from $245 billion to $1.5 trillion by 2030, according to the QED report.

title: NIA issues request for applications to develop real-world data platform for Alzheimer's research (Investor)
content: The initiative is led by NIA in collaboration with the National Institute of Neurological Disorders and Stroke.

title: Twilio research shows most businesses are using AI-driven personalization to drive growth (Business Service)
content:
According to the report, 92% of global businesses are using AI-driven personalization to drive business growth. Four in five (81%) organizations also believe recent AI technology has the potential to positively impact customer experiences.
Also:
Accenture

title: Litesprite Joins AWS Health Equity Initiative to promote health equity, accessibility (Startup)
content: The startup is part of a $40-million, three-year commitment from Amazon Web Services to address health inequities by supporting organizations dedicated to improving healthcare outcomes for underserved communities.

title: SingFit in article about utilizing therapeutic music in dementia care (Startup)
content: The publication covers how the company developed a music memory platform to help caregivers and occupational therapists deliver therapeutic music activities.

title: Main Line Health included on Best Employers for Diversity list (Testbed)
content: Main Line Health was included on Forbes' list of America's Best Employers for Diversity in 2023.

title: Walgreens partners with Prothena (Enterprise)
content: The partnership aims to boost patient enrollment in an Alzheimer's clinical trial, aiming to hasten the approval process for its anti-amyloid antibody.

title: ADT, State Farm begin pilot program in three states (Enterprise)
content: State Farm customers can participate in the ADT Home Security Program which includes getting ADT at a discounted rate and receiving a Command alarm system at no cost.

title: Ankara University, International Consortium for Health Outcomes Measurement join ECHAlliance (Enterprise)
content: Ankara University and the International Consortium for Health Outcomes Measurement are the latest members to join the global network in ECHAlliance.

title: The SCAN Foundation CEO talks plans for aging across the country (Enterprise)
content: Dr. Sarita Mohanty, CEO of The SCAN Foundation, discusses multisector plans for aging in different states.

title: TriNet wins four Stevies from the American Business Awards (Business Service)
content: The awards were given for the company's annual conference TriNet PeopleForce.

title: Walk With Path wins Roche HealthBuilders challenge with smart insole 'Path Feel' (StartUp)
content: With Path Feel, foot health for people with diabetes can be monitored remotely, without the need for as many appointments, while keeping people and their feet safe. Specifically, the insoles track pressure and temperature, which are established biomarkers for ulcers, and based on seeing changes, can provide alerts to the user and their clinician.

title: a2 Pilot Awards applications open on May 1 (Testbed)
content: The a2PilotAwards issued its request for applications. It also announced a webinar with PIs and pilot leads from JH AITC, MassAITC for Connected Care in Aging & Alzheimer's Disease and the Penn Artificial Intelligence and Technology Collaboratory for Healthy Aging.a2

title: Atento Capital launches $100M fund for early-stage tech startups (Investor)
content: Atento aims to support the next generation of tech founders and help enable a more inclusive economy.

title: Homecare Hub appoints Dr. Michael Apkon to Board (Startup)
content: Apkon is a physician executive and physician scientist who most recently served as the CEO at Tufts Medical Center in Boston. Since 2021, Apkon served as an advisor to Homecare Hub.

title: LeadingAge suggests many couldn't afford care without Medicaid (Enterprise)
content:
Research from the LeadingAge, LTSS Center and NCO Aging finds 80% of Americans over 60 would struggle to pay for a nursing home even if they spent all their savings. 
Also:
LeadingAge Twitter

title: CABHI included in Technology's Golden Age for BBC Storyworks (Enterprise)
content:
CABHI's Dr. Allison Sekuler is featured in a video on Technology's Golden Age which explores how technology could play a pivotal role in keeping aging populations healthy, empowered, mobile and living full lives.
Also:
CABHI Blog
MindMics Twitter

title: Crayon ranks #5 on the 2022 SHE Index (Business Service)
content: Crayon scored 96 out of 100 on the SHE Index, 23 points above the average for the technology sector.

title: XRHealth plans to merge with Amelia Virtual Care (StartUp)
content: The new company, which will continue to be called XRHealth, aims to become the largest XR therapeutics platform in the world, capable of addressing both physical and mental health issues.

title: Film about SingFit included in Technology’s Golden Age series (StartUp)
content: The film captures what co-founders and sister-brother duo, CEO Rachel Francine and Chief Clinical Officer Andy Tubman, describe as the multi-generational development of the SingFit digital health platform and its impact on people with various health conditions.

title: Podcast features Vivo's head trainer, scientific advisor (StartUp)
content: Kevin Snodgrass and Dr. Joe Nocera discuss the physical and cognitive benefits of dual-task exercise.

title: Dr. Calvin Roberts' considers the Lighthouse Guild as a leader in assistive technology (Testbed)
content: The organization's Technology Center, which features high-tech devices, training and a model Smart Home for clients to try innovations, increases the Lighthouse Guild's status in the field, as Roberts envisions.

title: Mitsubishi Electric's technology uses biometrics to detect drivers' physical conditions (Enterprise)
content: The company's technology focuses on physical changes typically caused by heart disease, epilepsy and cerebrovascular disease. It uses proprietary AI to estimate biometric data which are collected from the driver using a contactless Driver Monitoring System.

title: SCAN Foundation initiative aims to reduce health inequities, improve lives of older adults (Enterprise)
content: The Advancing Health Equity in Aging initiative seeks to reduce health inequities and improve the lives of older adults from historically marginalized communities.

title: AcuityAds Holdings rebrands to illumin (Business Service)
content: While the company retains its legal name, AcuityAds Holdings Inc., it will be doing business as illumin to reflect the platform’s success and adoption in the market.

title: Joylux included on menopause 'hot list' (Startup)
content: The list highlights nine wellness and beauty brands working to de-stigmatize menopause and help women navigate midlife.

title: Addition Wealth named company to watch by Tech:NYC (StartUp)
content: Female founders featured including Ana Mahony of Addition Wealth, Alyse Nicole Dunn of CarePilot, Priyanka Jain of Evvy, Sarah Nagy of Seek AI and Tiya Gordon of itselectric.

title: Art of Aging podcast features Dhaval Patel, CEO of Lotus Laboratories (Testbed)
content: The conversation includes how reliability and simplicity are the cornerstones of good technology, the challenges of creating technology in the space and how to give users the product-handshake experience.

title: CABHI invests $4.55M in AgeTech companies (Enterprise)
content: The investment will support early-stage innovations to improve the quality of life for older adults, people living with dementia and their caregivers.djacent teeth.

title: Intuition Robotics' ElliQ is a tabletop robot designed as helpful companion (Enterprise)
content: It consists of a lamp-like "face" with microphone and speakers, that lights up and swivels to face people. The second is a touchscreen tablet, used to display pictures, additional information and conduct video calls. Intuition Robotics' claims ElliQ can project empathy and form bonds with users.

title: Research from Accenture finds generative AI, other technologies merge physical, digital worlds (Enterprise)
content: The Accenture Technology Vision 2023, When Atoms Meet Bits: The Foundations of Our New Reality, explores the technology trends underpinning the convergence of the physical and digital, as businesses look to accelerate enterprise reinvention in the here and now.

title: Right at Home names Rod Roberts as COO (Testbed)
content: Right at Home named Rod Roberts as its Chief Operating Officer. In his role, Roberts is responsible for leading core operational functions and supporting teams to scale operations.

title: ThriveWell Tech hires Majd Alwan to lead strategy, growth (Testbed)
content: ThriveWell Tech named Majd Alwan as Chief Strategy and Growth Officer. He was previously the Executive Director of LeadingAge Center for Aging Services Technologies

title: CVS Health Ventures participates in $30M financing for Oshi Health (Investor)
content: Oshi Health, a virtual specialty care gastrointestinal health company, raised $30 million in a Series B financing round with participation from CVS Health Ventures.

title: NIA to discuss aging research at American Geriatrics Society Annual Scientific Meeting (Investor)
content: The NIA will attend the American Geriatrics Society Annual Scientific Meeting to discuss innovations and updates in geriatrics, clinical care and aging research.

title: NAR investment arm names 14 companies to scale-up program, including Prisidio (Enterprise)
content: Second Century Ventures, the investment arm of the National Association of Realtors, accepted 14 companies to the 2023 REACH and REACH Commercial programs. AARP AgeTech Collaborative startup Prisidio was included in the REACH cohort.

title: Accenture invests in company to accelerate time to market for medical devices (Enterprise)
content: Accenture Ventures invests in Virtonomy, a provider of data-driven simulations that use existing patient data and digital twin technology to bring life-saving medical devices to market more quickly.

title: LeadingAge awards over $270K in vaccine grants to promote education, increase uptake of COVID vaccines (Enterprise)
content: LeadingAge awarded grants totaling more than $270,000 from the agency's We Can Do This public education campaign, with more to be distributed in the near future. The funds, available through the association's collaboration with HHS, are being distributed to LeadingAge members who serve older adults in a variety of care settings and communities.

title: CABHI-supported research looks at digital ageism (Enterprise)
content: This CABHI-supported research examines digital ageism, data disparities of older adults, long term care and exergaming.

NIA awards grant to UMaine for research on robotic gait training for older adults (Investor)
content: The Biorobotics and Biomechanics Laboratory in the University of Maine Department of Mechanical Engineering received a grant of more than $432,000 from the NIA to create a wearable robotic system and intelligent methods to enable home-based and independent walking training for older adults.

title: Comcast NBCUniversal LIFT Labs accelerator focuses on Generative AI (Enterprise)
content: LIFT Labs is focused on finding a cohort of AI startups and helping them grow.

title: HTD partners with MedTech company Extra Horizon (Business Service)
content: Extra Horizon's medical BaaS allows teams to configure a compliant medical backend, shortening development timelines.

title: Pueblo Regional Center uses Embodied Labs tech to train staff (Startup)
content: Pueblo Regional Center started a pilot program that uses VR tech from Embodied Labs to allow staff to virtually experience the daily activities of people with intellectual and developmental disabilities.

title: Rendever adds two executives to help with expansion, growth (Startup)
content: Rendever's two new executive leadership members are Catherine Day, VP of Product Strategy and Nathan Myers, VP of Global Healthcare Partnerships.

title: Pivotal Ventures supports Techstars' Future of Longevity (Investor)
content: Techstars' Future of Longevity Class of 2023 will participate in a demo day marking the culmination of the 13-week accelerator program that began in Jan. Categories include preventive health, aging-in-place and financial wellness. The longevity accelerator is supported by Pivotal Ventures.

title: Comcast NBCUniversal LIFT Labs' to focus on shorter, thematic accelerators for the next cohort (Enterprise)
content: LIFT Labs is accepting six to eight startups in each cohort to develop programming tailored to each startup’s growth goals. Centered around a certain vertical or theme, the smaller cohort will be non-competitive.

title: Rose Health chosen for AWS Healthcare Accelerator (Startup)
content: Rose Health was chosen for the AWS Healthcare Accelerator: Global Cohort for Workforce to advance solutions for addressing urgent challenges facing the healthcare workforce.

title: Casana says data supports shift to in-home healthcare (Startup)
content:
Casana shared data from clinical study participants it says validates the preference for home-based vital sign monitoring. It found:

	
70% considered blood pressure as the most crucial health parameter that should be monitored; and
88% expressed their preference for monitoring their health from home rather than visiting a doctor's office or medical facility.

title: NYeC News shares whitepaper on challenges of data exchange between CBOs, healthcare sector (Testbed)
content: The newsletter includes the whitepaper by the SHIN-NY Policy Committee and Manatt Health about the challenges of data exchange between CBOs and the healthcare sector. Registration for the upcoming SHIN-NY Impact on Public Health Webinar.

title: QED Investors lead Series A funding for financial wellness products provider (Investor)
content:
QED Investors and Invus Opportunities led the Series A for Rain, a provider of financial wellness products that engage employees. It raised $116 million, encompassing $66 million in equity and $50M in debt. The funding will be used to support Rain's expansion in the U.S.

kin.

title: NIA to host Geroscience Summit  (Investor)
content: Geroscience Interest Group and NIA will host the fourth Geroscience Summit from April 24-26. The summit will examine gaps an opportunities in the field and how to advance geroscience research.

title: Baby Boomers surpass Millennials as largest generation of home buyers: NAR
content: The National Association of Realtors found the combined share of younger Boomer (58 to 67 years old) and older Boomer buyers (68 to 76 years old) rose to 39% in 2022, up from 29% the year prior.

title: Innovation Institute appoints General Counsel as new CEO (Business Service)
content: Mike McKinnon was appointed CEO of the Innovation Institute, effective May 1, 2023. He is currently a Partner at Sheppard Mullin Richter & Hampton LLP and has served as the General Counsel of The Innovation Institute since its founding 10 years ago.

title: Clinical study validates MindMics technology (Startup)
content: MindMics says a clinical study in Nature Digital Medicine validated its use of In-ear Infrasonic Hemodynography for cardiovascular monitoring. In-ear Infrasonic Hemodynography, invented and patented by MindMics, enables health monitoring using microphones which are often already embedded in TWS earbuds for Active Noise Cancelation. Robert Ciesielski, the R&D Manager of MindMics, said the study shows MindMics' can deliver Heart Rate and Heart Rate Variability with a 99% correlation to an ECG.

title: Casana will be the only FDA approved toilet seat that monitors heart health, captures information on chronic conditions (Startup)
content: In 2014, then PhD Engineering student at the Rochester Institute of Technology, Nicholas Conn, Casana's founder and CSO, discovered a new frontier for in-home medical monitoring devices - the bathroom. The Heart Seat was designed to necessitate no charging, reminders or modifications to patients' daily habits. Doctors will prescribe the seat, which will track patient data over an extended period. By analyzing the data, patients and physicians can get insights to help determine changes in health and the efficacy of treatments. The seat includes three sensors: an electrocardiogram, a photoplethysmogram and a ballistocardiogram. Each of these sensors help identify vital signals such as heart rate, blood pressure and blood oxygenation. The Heart Seat will be the only FDA cleared toilet seat focused on heart health monitoring and improving remote patient monitoring by capturing information on chronic conditions.

title: GaitBetter to attend 2023 NPA Spring Policy Forum (Startup)
content:
GaitBetter will be in attendance at the PACE 2023 NPA Spring Policy Forum from Mar 27-28. It invites attendees to experience its semi-immersive VR experience for fall prevention and gait rehabilitation.

GaitBetter
GaitBetter

title: United Church Homes, Ohio's Hospice partner to benefit  those with illnesses, housing, social needs (Testbed)
content: United Church Homes (UCH) and Ohio's Hospice partnered to bring together UCH's network of residential, healthcare and support services for older adults with Ohio's Hospice and Pure Healthcare's palliative and hospice care services. The organizations plan to design and implement innovative offerings for the benefit of those with chronic, serious, complex and life-threatening illnesses, housing or social needs.

title: Fidelity Investments, Nationwide partner on variable annuity (Enterprise)
content:
Fidelity's financial professionals are offering the Nationwide Personal Income Annuity, which is designed to provide growth potential, flexibility and guaranteed retirement income for life. It's a product that may be ideal for clients who are retired, semi-retired or approaching retirement and who want to continue growing their savings with a guaranteed income stream. The annuity includes the Nationwide Retirement Income Rider.
Related:
Fidelity Investments

title: Health & Housing Symposium will take place before LeadingAge 2023 Leadership Summit (Enterprise)
content: The 2023 Health & Housing Symposium, hosted by VOANS and sponsored by Parker Health Group and LeadingAge, will take place before the 2023 Leadership Summit begins.

title: ECHAlliance hosts Global and International Opportunities in Healthcare Session at ViVE 2023 (Enterprise)
content: Karolina Mackiewicz, Innovation Director of the ECHAlliance Group, invites participants to come to the Global and International Opportunities in Healthcare Session during ViVE.

title: Life Science Nation's RESI conference returns to Boston (Business Service)
content:
RESI is returning to Boston in June with a one-day in-person conference experience at The Westin Copley in Boston, followed by two days of virtual-only partnering.

title: NIA-funded study links severe COVID with evidence of brain aging (Investor)
content:
Harvard Medical School scientists at Beth Israel Deaconess Medical Center found gene usage in the brains of patients with COVID-19 is similar to that observed in aging brains. Using a molecular profiling technique called RNA sequencing to measure the levels of gene expression in a tissue sample, the scientists assessed changes in the brains of COVID-19 patients and compared them to changes observed in the brains of uninfected individuals. The team's analysis suggests many biological pathways in the brain that change with aging also changed in patients with severe COVID-19.

title: Walgreens launches Paxlovid delivery service (Enterprise)
content: In partnership with DoorDash and Uber, Walgreens is offering free delivery of Paxlovid, a COVID-19 oral antiviral therapy. This initiative is aimed at increasing access to COVID-19 treatment, with a focus on reaching those in socially vulnerable or medically underserved areas at a time when COVID-19 cases are beginning to rise again across the U.S. Eligible patients must have a Paxlovid prescription from a healthcare provider. This initiative is the latest offering in an ongoing collaboration between Walgreens, DoorDash and Uber to increase accessibility of life-saving treatments to medically underserved and underrepresented areas.

XRHealth adds VR cognitive rehab training software from NeuroReality to its virtual clinics
content: NeuroReality offers a VR gaming experience known as Koji’s Quest for individuals suffering from the consequences of stroke and brain injuries to help regain functionality in their everyday lives. It’s based on the concept of neuroplasticity, gamification, AI and conventional rehabilitation to rewire the brain to improve attention, executive functioning, visual spatial skills, reaction time, accuracy, memory and numerical manipulation. Through the XRHealth platform, patient data can be monitored by a clinician in real-time and training can be tailored for the individuals’ needs and outcomes can be measured at each session.

title: De Oro Devices' NexStride targets expansion to other diseases than Parkinsons
content: De Oro Devices’ plans to add more indications for its portable device for freezing gait associated with Parkinson’s disease. In 2023, the company will be looking to address multiple sclerosis, stroke and cerebral palsy and add mobility-gait software. The company recently hosted a webinar with the Parkinsons & Movement Disorder Alliance to demonstrate the applications for NexStride and to discuss freezing of gait, falls and how to safely improve independence and mobility.

title: Xandar Kardian contactless radar monitor found to help predict nursing home residents' decline
content: As part of a pilot program last year involving radar-based technology maker Xandar Kardian, contactless monitoring sensors were installed in a skilled nursing facility in New York. The facility monitored residents’ vital signs continuously using in-room XK300 devices, including during sleep. Data analysis showed that an elevated resting heart rate could predict an upcoming medical crisis, even when a resident’s respiratory rate was stable. In the case of one resident, Xandar Kardian’s sensors detected multiple sustained elevations of resting heart rate in the week before her cardiac arrest. Subsequent analysis suggested that care providers could in the future combine the data collected on resting heart rate and respiratory rate to detect the need for intervention within the first six hours of respiratory rate deterioration.

title: Seniors experience virtual Summer Olympic Games with Rendever VR
content: Cambridge Enhanced Senior Living and the Cambridge Rehabilitation & Healthcare Center in Moorestown, NJ, hosted a virtual Summer Olympic Games for residents as part of a partnership between the campus and VR platform Rendever. Cambridge hopes VR will boost physical and mental health and encourage intergenerational bonds as residents, children and grandchildren explore the future of technology together. After seeing the effects of the VR platform, Cambridge expanded its program by integrating RendeverFit and has introduced corporatewide private RendeverLive sessions, enabling residents to travel the world virtually and stay active through various VR games and sports.

Sana expands affordable health insurance offerings for small businesses to Ala.
content:
After entering the Ind. and Va markets this year, Sana expanded again to serve a traditionally underserved market in Ala. In addition to the lack of health insurance options for small businesses, Ala. ranks among the nation’s worst states regarding overall clinical care. Sana members receive no-cost virtual appointments with primary-care and mental-health providers. The company's customer satisfaction score is over 95% in an industry where 70-75% is average.

content:
Tembo Health was one of 10 startups chosen to be part of the four-month mentorship-driven UnitedHealthcare Accelerator, which began on Aug. 15. This iteration of the program took a hybrid approach, with six weeks of in-person support in Minn. Of the companies participating, 70% are led by founders who identify as women or BIPOC.
