title: Wareologie founder featured on Someone's Gotta Make It podcast
content: Released by Nutshell, their Someone's Gotta Make It podcast series showcases the entrepreneurs behind some familiar products, from bedsheets to barbecue sauce to artificial turf. Featured in Episode 6, Gina Adams, founder and CEO of Wareologie discusses medical devices and cash flow, starting a business and lessons from the trenches of entrepreneurship.

title: Somerville startup Rendever brings virtual reality to elder care
content: Rendever creates virtual shared experiences to combat feelings of depression and social isolation among seniors, especially those in nursing homes or hospice care. With the VR headset, users are able to revisit locations from their past, reconnect with family members pr check off bucket list items such as climbing Mt. Everest. The service has been provided to over 400 senior living communities in the six years the company's been active. Rendever continues to expand their library of experiences and integrate immersive content.

title: Mass. Expands adds four hubs to R&D Sandbox program
content:
The Massachusetts eHealth Institute at MassTech (MeHI) added four healthcare R&D hubs to join the Digital Health Sandbox Network and awarded grants to support three digital health companies in accessing the network. The new additions to the Sandbox Network are:

	
MITRE Digital Health Sandbox in Bedford;
The UMass Amherst Institute for Applied Life Sciences;
UMass Lowell; and
UMass Medical School in Worcester.
$95,000 to TechSpring @ Baystate Health to work with two startups, BlocHealth of Boston and Nutrimedy of Brookline, to access TechSpring's product development acceleration services and work with experienced Innovation Managers to test and validate their products in a real healthcare environment; and
$60,000 to MIT's Institute of Medical and Engineering Sciences (IMES) to cover the fees for Leuko Labs of Boston to perform usability testing of their product on volunteers in replicated home and clinical settings.

title: Army Distaff Foundation to test interest in personalized wellness resources at assisted living community
content: The Army Distaff Foundation (ADF), the operator of Washington, D.C.-based Knollwood Life Plan Community, is testing the viability of a holistic wellness program among 150 residents and their adult children. The rollout is part of a plan to better personalize programming. ADF is also offering complimentary memberships to the Mighty Health program and app. The aim is for residents to access the app on their phones or tablets and find opportunities to participate in activities that improve health and quality of life.

title: ThriveWell Tech earns top five ranking in Channel Futures MSP 501 Rankings
content: ThriveWell Tech earned 5th place in the 2022 Channel Futures MSP 501 rankings. ThriveWell was selected as one of the tech industries top-performing providers of managed services. The survey examines organizational performance based on annual sales, recurring revenue, profit margins, revenue mix, growth opportunities, innovation, technology solutions supported, and company and customer demographics.

title: Vivalon breaks ground on Healthy Aging Campus
content: Vivalon began construction of its Healthy Aging Campus in partnership with Eden Housing. The campus will include 67 units of 100% affordable senior homes in downtown San Rafael, Calif. It will also feature a Healthy Aging and Integrated Care Clinic that will combine traditional medical services with coordinated care, social engagement, learning opportunities, nutrition services, and activities and programs designed to promote healthy aging. The campus is expected to open in Dec. 2023.

title: United Church Homes invests in Texas seniors community
content: United Church Homes (UCH) is an investor in the project which involves construction of a 277-unit independent living senior community which UCH Management will manage once it’s completed. The Whisper Hills mixed income senior community in San Marcos, Texas is expected to be ready for occupancy by the end of 2024. UCH also welcomed three managed communities recently: Columbus Colony Housing in Columbus, Ohio, Ken Mar Apartments in Martinsville, Ind. and Meridian Point in Uniontown, Pa

title: Mediterranean Towers Ventures invests in foodtech firm MAOLAC
content: Mediterranean Towers Investment Fund invested $350,000 in foodtech firm MAOLAC, which is looking to develop biofunctional proteins for the elderly population. This is Mediterranean Towers' first investment in the foodtech industry.

title: Ochsner Health, Bold partner to reduce falls among seniors
content: Ochsner Health's innovation arm, innovationOchsner, partnered with Bold, a digital exercise platform for adults over 50 that aims to reduce falls. The platform is one of five interventions in the Ochsner Connected Stability pilot fall prevention and monitoring programs, which are focused on supporting Medicare Advantage members. The platform first completes an online assessment to pinpoint users' current health and fitness levels. It then designs a personalized program for the user, which can include shorter, seated classes or longer, standing classes. Users also receive motivational check-ins as they participate in the program. Ochsner Health is a portfolio company of Primetime Partners.

title: CABHI community aims to help develop aging and brain health innovations
content: Leap is the Centre for Aging + Brain Health Innovation (CABHI)'s virtual community for older adults & caregivers whose life experiences help inform aging and brain health innovations. It’s a community where we share, learn, collaborate, and advise on solutions being developed to make aging better. From Sept. 19 to 23 CABHI is hosting a Virtual Open House. Where Leap members can explore, participate and get to know how to use Leap and engage with the community.

title: Newcastle University develops non-invasive test to reveal premature skin aging
content: Newcastle University developed a personalized non-invasive test that can reveal if somebody's skin is at risk of ageing prematurely. Skin Life Analytics, a Newcastle University spin-out company, uses technology to slow down the skin ageing process. The team investigated damage to skin cell mitochondria - which can be thought of as the rechargeable batteries of our cells - and have developed a test that can measure skin aging, determine skin DNA damage from sun exposure, track treatments targeted at skin protection and determine potency of cosmetic actives. The same technology is used to determine the potency of protection of cosmetic actives in skincare brands. Skin Life Analytics is based at The Catalyst in the Newcastle Helix innovation district. The team works closely with the National Innovation Centre for Ageing (NICA), receiving both mentoring and business support.

title: TriNet launches tax optimized education program for SMBs
content:
The program, Enrich Learn, offers tax-optimized reimbursements for expenses by SMB employees to advance their education. Like the other Enrich products, Enrich Learn is a turn-key solution for benefits sponsored by the SMB. Enrich Learn will be available to all of TriNet's 23,000 SMB customers starting Oct.

title: Organicell Regenerative engages law firm McDermott Will & Emery
content: The clinical-stage biopharmaceutical company engaged law firm McDermott Will & Emery, due to is reputation of having the best health care practice in the U.S. Organicell, which recently closed a financing round and corporate restructuring, will look to McDermott to help navigate the biologics industry as the company continues to scale and expand.

title: Zendesk integrates AI with intelligent triage to speed up CX responses
content:
In a bid to help organizations deal with customer service challenges quickly, Zendesk added a series of AI-powered features aimed at accelerating issue remediation and workflow. The AI features have their basis in technologies that Zendesk gained in 2021 via the acquisition of Portugal-based startup Cleverly AI. The Cleverly technologies are serving as a foundation for incident triage and recommendation capabilities in the Zendesk Suite Enterprise Edition.
Related:
Forbes Advisor

title: Twilio social impact officer argues  corporate social responsibility programs should help company’s bottom line
content: The number of people in need of humanitarian assistance globally has risen by 90.4 million since before the pandemic. Meanwhile, funding for humanitarian assistance has nearly plateaued, increasing just 2.6% since 2018, after growing 10% annually between 2012 and 2017. Twilio's chief social impact officer says tough times create constraint but can also create momentum. Building a P&L and structuring a social impact team in the right part of the business means companies don’t have to make a hard decision when budgets dry up. Instead, they can continue doing good when it matters most.

content:

title: TriNet acquires Clarus R+D Solutions
content:
Clarus R+D helps SMBs take advantage of the research and development tax credit. Their platform has automated much of the R&D credit qualification and application process to ensure that the final incentives are optimized for each client. Businesses save valuable time as a result of the automated calculation process, while maximizing their R&D tax credit. As part of the acquisition, Clarus R+D will become a wholly owned subsidiary of TriNet and all members of the Clarus leadership team will remain in same or simliar roles.
